stanza.text: Of all the gifts Thy love bestows,||br||Thou Giver of all good!||br||||sp||||sp||Not heaven itself a richer knows||br||Than the Redeemer’s blood.
Faith, too, that trusts the blood through grace,||br||From that same love we gain;||br||||sp||||sp||Else, sweetly, as it suits our case,||br||The gift had been in vain.
We praise Thee, and would praise Thee more,||br||To Thee our all we owe;||br||||sp||||sp||The precious Saviour and the power||br||That makes Him precious too.

Father, ’twas Thy love that knew us||br||Earth’s foundation long before;||br||||sp||||sp||That same love to Jesus drew us||br||By its sweet constraining power,||br||||sp||||sp||And will keep us||br||Safely now, and evermore.

God of love, our souls adore Thee!||br||We would still Thy grace proclaim,||br||||sp||||sp||Till we cast our crowns before Thee,||br||And in glory praise Thy name;||br||||sp||||sp||Praise and worship||br||Be to God and to the Lamb!
O God! we see Thee in the Lamb||br||||sp||||sp||To be our hope, our joy, our rest;||br||||sp||||sp||The glories that compose Thy name||br||||sp||||sp||Standing engaged to make us blest.

Thou great and good! Thou just and wise!||br||||sp||||sp||Hail! as our Father and our God!||br||||sp||||sp||For we are Thine by sacred ties,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy sons and daughters, bought with blood.
Then, oh! to us this grace afford,||br||||sp||||sp||That far from Thee we ne’er may move;||br||||sp||||sp||Our guard—the presence of the Lord;||br||||sp||||sp||Our joy—Thy perfect present love.
This gives us ever to rejoice,||br||||sp||||sp||Turning to light our darkest days;||br||||sp||||sp||And lifts on high each feeble voice,||br||||sp||||sp||While we have breath to pray or praise.

Ere God had built the mountains,||br||Or raised the fruitful hills;||br||||sp||||sp||Before He filled the fountains||br||That feed the running rills;||br||||sp||||sp||In Thee, from everlasting,||br||The wonderful I AM||br||||sp||||sp||Found pleasures never wasting,||br||And Wisdom is Thy name.

When like a tent to dwell in,||br||He spread the skies abroad,||br||||sp||||sp||And swathed about the swelling||br||Of ocean’s mighty flood,||br||||sp||||sp||He wrought by weight and measure;||br||And Thou wast with Him then;||br||||sp||||sp||Thyself the Father’s pleasure,||br||And Thine the sons of men.

And couldst Thou be delighted||br||With creatures such as we,||br||||sp||||sp||Who, when we saw Thee, slighted||br||And nailed Thee to a tree?||br||||sp||||sp||Unfathomable wonder!||br||And mystery divine!||br||||sp||||sp||The voice that speaks in thunder||br||Says, “Sinner, I am thine!”

Unto Him who loved us—gave us||br||Every pledge that love could give;||br||||sp||||sp||Freely shed His blood to save us;||br||Gave His life that we might live;||br||||sp||||sp||Be the kingdom,||br||||sp||||sp||And dominion,||br||And the glory evermore.
Jesus! how much Thy name unfolds||br||To every opened ear;||br||||sp||||sp||The pardoned sinner’s memory holds||br||None other half so dear.
Thy name encircles every grace||br||That God as man could show;||br||||sp||||sp||There only could He fully trace||br||A life divine below.
Jesus—it speaks a life of love,||br||Of sorrows meekly borne;||br||||sp||||sp||It tells of sympathy above,||br||Whatever makes us mourn.
Jesus, the One who knew no sin,||br||Made sin to make us just;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou gav’st Thyself our love to win—||br||Our full confiding trust.
The mention of Thy name shall bow||br||Our hearts to worship Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||The chiefest of ten thousand Thou,||br||Whose love has set us free.

Thou Son of God!—the woman’s seed||br||||sp||||sp||Who didst for us on Calvary bleed,||br||And bear our heavy load;||br||||sp||||sp||Spoiler of death’s o’erwhelming power,||br||||sp||||sp||O’ercome by Thee in that dread hour;||br||Thou holy One of God!

Thy blood we sing; by that alone,||br||||sp||||sp||With boldness to th’ eternal throne,||br||Through Thee we now draw nigh||br||||sp||||sp||It blots out every stain of sin,||br||||sp||||sp||Washes the guilty conscience clean,||br||And makes th’ accuser fly.

Behold us, Lord! a feeble band,||br||||sp||||sp||In conflict with the foe we stand,||br||The ransomed of Thy cross;||br||||sp||||sp||We sing the triumphs of Thy name;||br||||sp||||sp||All other glory here is shame,||br||All other gain’s but loss.

O Lord, we adore Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||For Thou art the slain One||br||||sp||||sp||That livest forever,||br||Enthroned in heaven;||br||||sp||||sp||O Lord! we adore Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||For Thou hast redeemed us;||br||||sp||||sp||Our title to glory||br||We read in Thy blood.

O God, we acknowledge||br||||sp||||sp||Thy greatness, Thy glory!||br||||sp||||sp||For of Thee are all things||br||On earth and in heaven;||br||||sp||||sp||How rich is Thy mercy!||br||||sp||||sp||How great Thy salvation!||br||||sp||||sp||We bless Thee, we praise Thee:||br||Amen, and Amen.

Father, we, Thy children, bless Thee||br||For Thy love on us bestowed,||br||||sp||||sp||Source of blessing! we confess Thee||br||Now, our Father and our God.||br||||sp||||sp||Wondrous was Thy love in giving||br||Jesus for our sins to die!||br||||sp||||sp||Wondrous was His grace in leaving,||br||For our sakes, the heavens on high!

Now the sprinkled blood has freed us,||br||Hast’ning onward to our rest,||br||||sp||||sp||Through the desert Thou dost lead us,||br||With Thy constant favor blest;||br||||sp||||sp||By Thy truth and Spirit guiding,||br||Earnest He of what’s to come,||br||||sp||||sp||And with daily strength providing,||br||Thou dost lead Thy children home.

Though our pilgrimage be dreary,||br||This is not our resting-place;||br||||sp||||sp||Shall we of the way be weary||br||When we see our Master’s face?||br||||sp||||sp||No:—e’en now anticipating,||br||In this hope our souls rejoice,||br||||sp||||sp||And His promised advent waiting,||br||Soon shall hear His welcome voice.
Grace is the sweetest sound||br||That ever reached our ears,||br||||sp||||sp||When conscience charged and justice frowned,||br||’Twas grace removed our fears.
’Tis freedom to the slave,||br||’Tis light and liberty;||br||||sp||||sp||It takes its terror from the grave,||br||From death its victory.
Grace is a mine of wealth||br||Laid open to the poor;||br||||sp||||sp||Grace is the sovereign spring of health;||br||’Tis life forevermore.
Of grace then let us sing!||br||(A joyful, wondrous theme!)||br||||sp||||sp||Who ||i||grace||/i|| has brought, shall ||i||glory||/i|| bring,||br||And we shall reign with Him.
Then shall we see His face||br||With all the saints above,||br||||sp||||sp||And sing forever of His grace,||br||Forever of His love.

Jesus, the Lord, is risen||br||Triumphant o’er the grave;||br||||sp||||sp||For us he burst the prison,||br||Almighty now to save:||br||||sp||||sp||Captivity is captive led,||br||||sp||||sp||Since Jesus liveth that was dead.

Who to our charge shall lay||br||Iniquity or guilt?||br||||sp||||sp||Our sin is done away||br||Since Jesus’ blood was spilt.||br||||sp||||sp||Captivity is captive led,||br||||sp||||sp||Since Jesus liveth that was dead.

Who now accuseth them||br||Whom God hath justified?||br||||sp||||sp||Or who shall those condemn||br||For whom the Surety died?||br||||sp||||sp||Captivity is captive led,||br||||sp||||sp||Since Jesus liveth that was dead.

Christ hath the ransom paid,||br||The wondrous work is done;||br||||sp||||sp||On Him our help is laid,||br||The victory is won.||br||||sp||||sp||Captivity is captive led,||br||||sp||||sp||Since Jesus liveth that was dead.
Sing without ceasing, sing||br||The Saviour’s present grace,||br||||sp||||sp||How all things shine in light divine||br||For those who’ve seen His face.
He’s gone within the veil,||br||For us that place has won;||br||||sp||||sp||In Him we stand, a heavenly band||br||Where He Himself is gone.
There all’s unsullied light,||br||Our hearts let in its rays;||br||||sp||||sp||And heavenly light makes all things bright,||br||Seen in that blissful gaze.
Such here on earth we are,||br||Though we in weakness roam;||br||||sp||||sp||Our place on high, God’s self so nigh;||br||His presence is our home.
And stayed by joy divine,||br||As hireling fills his day,||br||||sp||||sp||Through scenes of strife and desert life||br||We tread in peace our way.
That way is upward still,||br||Where life and glory are;||br||||sp||||sp||Our rest’s above, in perfect love||br||The glory we shall share.
Forever with the Lord,||br||Forever like Him then,||br||||sp||||sp||And see His face in that blest place,||br||Our Father’s house in heaven.

Worship, and thanks, and blessing,||br||||sp||||sp||And strength ascribe to Jesus!||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord alone defends His own,||br||||sp||||sp||When earth or hell oppresses.||br||Omnipotent Redeemer!||br||||sp||||sp||Our ransomed souls adore Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Our Saviour Thou, we own it now,||br||||sp||||sp||And give to Thee the glory.

Thine arm hath safely brought us||br||||sp||||sp||A way no more expected||br||||sp||||sp||Than when Thy sheep passed through the deep||br||||sp||||sp||By crystal walls protected.||br||We sing Thine arm unshortened,||br||||sp||||sp||Brought through each sore temptation;||br||||sp||||sp||With heart and voice, in Thee rejoice,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou God of our salvation.

Thy glory is our rear-ward,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy hand our lives doth cover;||br||||sp||||sp||And we, e’en we, have passed the sea,||br||||sp||||sp||And marched triumphant over;||br||We own thy great deliverance,||br||||sp||||sp||And triumph in Thy favor;||br||||sp||||sp||And for the love which now we prove,||br||||sp||||sp||Shall praise Thy name forever.
Hark! ten thousand voices crying,||br||“Lamb of God!” with one accord;||br||||sp||||sp||Thousand thousand saints replying,||br||Wake at once the echoing chord.
“Praise the Lamb,” the chorus waking,||br||All in heaven together throng;||br||||sp||||sp||Loud and far each tongue partaking||br||Rolls around the endless song.
Grateful incense this, ascending||br||Ever to the Father’s throne:||br||||sp||||sp||Every knee to Jesus bending,||br||All the mind in heaven is one.
All the Father’s counsels claiming||br||Equal honors to the Son,||br||||sp||||sp||All the Son’s effulgence beaming,||br||Makes the Father’s glory known.
By the Spirit all pervading,||br||Hosts unnumbered round the Lamb,||br||||sp||||sp||Crowned with light and joy unfading,||br||Hail Him as the great “I AM.”
Joyful now the new creation||br||Rests in undisturbed repose,||br||||sp||||sp||Blest in Jesus’ full salvation,||br||Sorrow now nor thraldom knows.
Hark! the heavenly notes again!||br||Loudly swells the song of praise;||br||||sp||||sp||Through creation’s vault, Amen!||br||Amen! responsive joy doth raise.
All that we were—our sins, our guilt,||br||Our death—was all our own;||br||||sp||||sp||All that we are we owe to Thee,||br||Thou God of grace, alone.
Thy mercy found us in our sins,||br||And gave us to believe;||br||||sp||||sp||Then, in believing, peace we found;||br||And in Thy Christ we live.
All that we are as saints on earth,||br||All that we hope to be||br||||sp||||sp||When Jesus comes and glory dawns,||br||We owe it all to Thee.
Many sons to glory bringing,||br||God sets forth His heavenly name;||br||||sp||||sp||On we march in chorus singing,||br||“Worthy the ascended Lamb!”
God who gave the blood to screen us,||br||God looks down in perfect love;||br||||sp||||sp||Clouds may seem to pass between us,||br||There’s no change in Him above.
Though the restless foe accuses,||br||Sins recounting like a flood;||br||||sp||||sp||Every charge our God refuses:||br||Christ has answered with His blood.
In the refuge God provided,||br||Though the world’s destruction lowers,||br||||sp||||sp||We are safe—to Christ confided,||br||Everlasting life is ours.
And ere long, when come to glory,||br||We shall sing a well-known strain,||br||||sp||||sp||This the never-tiring story,||br||“Worthy is the Lamb once slain!”
May the grace of Christ our Saviour,||br||And the Father’s boundless love,||br||||sp||||sp||With the Holy Spirit’s favor,||br||Rest upon us from above!
Thus may we abide in union||br||With each other and the Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||And possess in sweet communion,||br||Joys which earth can ne’er afford.

Paschal Lamb, by God appointed,||br||All our sins were on Thee laid;||br||||sp||||sp||By Almighty love anointed,||br||Thou hast full atonement made.||br||||sp||||sp||All Thy people are forgiven||br||Through the virtue of Thy blood;||br||||sp||||sp||Opened is the gate of heaven,||br||Peace is made for us with God.

Jesus, hail! enthroned in glory,||br||There forever to abide;||br||||sp||||sp||All the heavenly hosts adore Thee,||br||Seated at Thy Father’s side;||br||||sp||||sp||Worship, honor, power, and blessing,||br||Thou art worthy to receive;||br||||sp||||sp||Loudest praises, without ceasing,||br||Meet it is for us to give.

Praise the Lord! He died to save us!||br||’Tis by Him alone we live;||br||||sp||||sp||And in Him the Father gave us||br||All that boundless love could give:||br||||sp||||sp||Life eternal||br||In the Saviour we receive.

Lord Jesus! we worship and bow at Thy feet,||br||||sp||||sp||And give Thee the glory, the honor that’s meet;||br||||sp||||sp||While through Thee, O Saviour, our praises ascend||br||||sp||||sp||And join in the chorus that never shall end.

“Abba, Father,” we approach Thee||br||In our Saviour’s precious name;||br||||sp||||sp||We, Thy children, here assembling,||br||Now the promised blessing claim.||br||||sp||||sp||From our guilt His blood has washed us,||br||’Tis through Him our souls draw nigh;||br||||sp||||sp||And Thy Spirit too has taught us||br||“Abba, Father,” thus to cry.

Once as prodigals we wandered||br||In our folly far from Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||But Thy grace, o’er sin abounding,||br||Rescued us from misery:||br||||sp||||sp||Clothed in garments of salvation,||br||At Thy table is our place;||br||||sp||||sp||We rejoice, and Thou rejoicest,||br||In the riches of Thy grace.

Thou the prodigal hast pardoned,||br||“Kissed us” with a Father’s love;||br||||sp||||sp||“Killed the fatted calf,” and called us||br||E’er to dwell with Thee above.||br||||sp||||sp||“It is meet,” we hear Thee saying,||br||“We should merry be and glad;||br||||sp||||sp||I have found my once lost children,||br||Now they live who once were dead.”

“Abba, Father!” we adore Thee,||br||While the hosts in heaven above||br||||sp||||sp||E’en in us now learn the wonders||br||Of Thy wisdom, grace and love.||br||||sp||||sp||Soon before Thy throne assembled,||br||All Thy children shall proclaim||br||||sp||||sp||Abba’s love as shown in Jesus,||br||And how full is Abba’s name!

“How bright, there above, is the mercy of God!”||br||||sp||||sp||“And void of all guilt, and clear of all sin,||br||||sp||||sp||Is my conscience and heart, through my Saviour’s blood.”||br||||sp||||sp||“Not a cloud above”—“not a spot within.”

Christ died! then I am clean: “Not a spot within.”||br||||sp||||sp||God’s mercy and love! “Not a cloud above.”||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis the Spirit, through faith, thus triumphs o’er sin:||br||||sp||||sp||“Not a cloud above”—“not a spot within.”
How good is the God we adore,||br||||sp||||sp||Our faithful, unchangeable Friend,||br||||sp||||sp||Whose love is as great as His power,||br||||sp||||sp||And knows neither measure nor end.

’Tis Jesus, the First and the Last,||br||||sp||||sp||Whose Spirit shall guide us safe home;||br||||sp||||sp||We’ll praise Him for all that is past,||br||||sp||||sp||And trust Him for all that’s to come.

Where shall our wandering souls begin?||br||How shall we all to heaven aspire?||br||||sp||||sp||As slaves redeemed from death and sin,||br||As brands plucked from eternal fire,||br||||sp||||sp||How shall we suited triumphs raise,||br||||sp||||sp||Or sing our great Deliverer’s praise?

O how shall we the goodness tell,||br||Father, which Thou to us hast showed,||br||||sp||||sp||Children of wrath and doomed to hell,||br||But children now redeemed to God?||br||||sp||||sp||On earth we know our sins forgiven,||br||||sp||||sp||Blest with this antepast of heaven.
Father, Thy name our souls would bless,||br||As children taught by grace,||br||||sp||||sp||Lift up our hearts in righteousness||br||And joy before Thy face.
Sweet is the confidence Thou giv’st,||br||Though high above our praise,||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts resort to where Thou liv’st||br||In heaven’s unclouded rays.
There in the purpose of Thy love||br||Our place is now prepared,||br||||sp||||sp||As sons with Him who is above,||br||Who all our sorrows shared.
Eternal ages shall declare||br||The riches of Thy grace,||br||||sp||||sp||To those who with Thy Son shall share||br||A son’s eternal place.
Absent as yet, we rest in hope,||br||Treading the desert path,||br||||sp||||sp||Waiting for Him who takes up||br||Beyond the power of death.
We joy in Thee, Thy holy love||br||Our endless portion is,||br||||sp||||sp||Like Thine own Son, with Him above,||br||In brightest heavenly bliss.
O Holy Father, keep us here||br||In that blest name of love,||br||||sp||||sp||Walking before Thee without fear||br||Till all be joy above.

hymn.author: J.A. Rothe, tr. by J. Wesley

stanza.text: O love divine, Thou vast abyss!||br||Our sins are swallowed up in Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Covered is our unrighteousness;||br||From condemnation we are free:||br||||sp||||sp||In Jesus’ blood our hearts can trace||br||||sp||||sp||The boundless riches of Thy grace.

Fixed on this ground must we remain;||br||Though heart may fail and flesh decay,||br||||sp||||sp||This anchor shall our souls sustain,||br||When earth and heaven shall pass away.||br||||sp||||sp||Mercy’s full worth we then shall prove,||br||||sp||||sp||Loved with an everlasting love.

Lamb of God, our souls adore Thee,||br||While upon Thy face we gaze,||br||||sp||||sp||There the Father’s love and glory||br||Shine in all their brightest rays.||br||||sp||||sp||Thy Almighty power and wisdom||br||All creation’s works proclaim,||br||||sp||||sp||Heaven and earth alike confess Thee,||br||As the ever great I AM.

Son of God! Thy Father’s bosom||br||Ever was Thy dwelling-place;||br||||sp||||sp||His delight, in Him rejoicing,||br||One with Him in power and grace:||br||||sp||||sp||O what wondrous love and mercy!||br||Thou didst lay Thy glory by,||br||||sp||||sp||And for us didst come from heaven||br||As the Lamb of God to die.

Lamb of God! when we behold Thee||br||Lowly in the manger laid;||br||||sp||||sp||Wandering as a homeless stranger||br||In the world Thy hands had made;||br||||sp||||sp||When we see Thee in the garden||br||In Thine agony of blood,||br||||sp||||sp||At Thy grace we are confounded,||br||Holy, spotless Lamb of God!

When we see Thee as the Victim||br||Nailed to the accursèd tree,||br||||sp||||sp||For our guilt and folly stricken,||br||All our judgment borne by Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Lord, we own, with hearts adoring,||br||Thou hast washed us in Thy blood:||br||||sp||||sp||Glory, glory everlasting,||br||Be to Thee, Thou Lamb of God!

Lamb of God! Thou now art seated||br||High upon Thy Father’s throne,||br||||sp||||sp||All Thy gracious work completed,||br||All Thy mighty victory won.||br||||sp||||sp||Every knee in heaven is bending||br||To the Lamb for sinner’s slain;||br||||sp||||sp||Every voice and heart is swelling,||br||“Worthy is the Lamb to reign.”

Lord, in all Thy power and glory||br||Still Thy thoughts and eyes are here;||br||||sp||||sp||Watching o’er Thy ransomed people||br||To Thy gracious heart so dear.||br||||sp||||sp||Thou for us art interceding,||br||Everlasting is Thy love;||br||||sp||||sp||And a blessed rest preparing||br||In our Father’s house above.

Lamb of God! Thy faithful promise||br||Says, “Behold, I quickly come;”||br||||sp||||sp||And our hearts, to Thine responsive,||br||Cry, “Come, Lord, and take us home.”||br||||sp||||sp||Oh! the rapture that awaits us||br||When we meet Thee in the air,||br||||sp||||sp||And with Thee ascend in triumph,||br||All Thy deepest joys to share.

Lamb of God! when Thou to glory||br||Shalt to this sad earth return,||br||||sp||||sp||All Thy foes shall quake before Thee,||br||All who now despise Thee mourn;||br||||sp||||sp||Then shall we at Thine appearing||br||With Thee in Thy kingdom reign,||br||||sp||||sp||Thine the praise, and Thine the glory,||br||Lamb of God, for sinners slain.

O blessed Saviour, Son of God!||br||||sp||||sp||Who hast redeemed us with Thy blood||br||From guilt and death and shame—||br||||sp||||sp||With joy and praise, Thy people see||br||||sp||||sp||The crown of glory worn by Thee,||br||And worthy Thee proclaim.

Exalted, by the Father’s love,||br||||sp||||sp||All thrones and powers and names above,||br||At God’s right hand in heaven:||br||||sp||||sp||Wisdom and riches, power divine,||br||||sp||||sp||Blessing and honor, Lord, are Thine—||br||All things to Thee are given.

Head of the church! Thou sittest there,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy members all the blessings share—||br||Thy blessing, Lord, is ours:||br||||sp||||sp||Our life Thou art—Thy grace sustains,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy strength in us each victory gains||br||O’er sin and Satan’s powers.

And soon, the day of glory come,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy bride shall reach her destined home,||br||And all Thy beauty see:||br||||sp||||sp||How great our joy to see Thee shine,||br||||sp||||sp||To hear Thee own us, Lord, as Thine,||br||And ever dwell with Thee.

Thou holy one of God,||br||Glorified in Thy cross,||br||||sp||||sp||He owns the value of that blood||br||Which speaks to Him for us.||br||||sp||||sp||The curse is gone, through Thee we’re blest,||br||||sp||||sp||God rests in Thee—in Thee we rest.

Soon the bright glorious day,||br||The rest of God, shall come,||br||||sp||||sp||Sorrow and sin shall pass away,||br||And we shall reach our home.||br||||sp||||sp||Then of the promised joy possessed,||br||||sp||||sp||Our souls shall know eternal rest.

The Father, from eternity,||br||||sp||||sp||Chose us, O Jesus Christ, in Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||In Thee, His well-belovèd:||br||||sp||||sp||And we, as given to Thee—Thy bride,||br||||sp||||sp||In Thee, Lord Jesus, can confide:||br||||sp||||sp||Thy love remains unmovèd.||br||From Thee daily||br||||sp||||sp||Strength receiving—to Thee cleaving,||br||Blessed Jesus!||br||||sp||||sp||May we all show forth Thy praises.

Before the world we’d make our boast,||br||||sp||||sp||That Thou, in whom is all our trust,||br||||sp||||sp||Art Lord of life and glory;||br||||sp||||sp||And soon Thou’lt bring us to that place||br||||sp||||sp||Where we shall see Thee face to face,||br||||sp||||sp||And, glorified, adore Thee.||br||Amen!—Be then||br||||sp||||sp||Praise and blessing—never ceasing||br||To Thee given||br||||sp||||sp||Here, and when we come to heaven.

Son of God! with joy we praise Thee,||br||On the Father’s throne above;||br||||sp||||sp||All Thy wondrous work displays Thee,||br||Full of grace and full of love!||br||||sp||||sp||Lord, accept our adoration—||br||For our sins Thou once wast slain;||br||||sp||||sp||Through Thy blood we have salvation;||br||Soon shall share Thine endless reign.

God, in Thee His love unfolding,||br||Shows how vast, how rich His grace;||br||||sp||||sp||Blest our lot, with joy beholding||br||All His glory in Thy face.||br||||sp||||sp||Oh! the mercy which hath blessed us,||br||Purposed thus ere time began,||br||||sp||||sp||Mercy which in Thee hath kept us,||br||Where His blessed race He ran.

Jesus, Captain of salvation,||br||Conqueror both of death and hell!||br||||sp||||sp||Thou who didst as sin’s oblation,||br||Feel what Thou alone couldst feel:||br||||sp||||sp||Through Thy sufferings, death, and merit,||br||||sp||||sp||We eternal bliss inherit,||br||Thousand thousand thanks to Thee,||br||Jesus, Lord, forever be!

The Lord is risen: the Red Sea’s judgment flood||br||||sp||||sp||Is passed in Him, who bought us with His blood.||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord is risen: we stand beyond the doom||br||||sp||||sp||Of all our sin, through Jesus’ empty tomb.

The Lord is risen: with Him we also rose,||br||||sp||||sp||And in His grave see vanquished all our foes.||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord is risen: beyond the judgment land,||br||||sp||||sp||In Him, in resurrection life we stand.

The Lord is risen: redeemèd now to God,||br||||sp||||sp||We tread the desert which His feet have trod.||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord is risen: the sanctuary’s our place,||br||||sp||||sp||Where now we dwell before the Father’s face.

The Lord is risen: the Lord is gone before,||br||||sp||||sp||We long to see Him, and to sin no more.||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord is risen: our triumph-shout shall be,||br||||sp||||sp||“Thou hast prevailed! Thy people, Lord, are free!”
Rise, my soul! behold, ’tis Jesus,||br||Jesus fills thy wondering eyes;||br||||sp||||sp||See Him now in glory seated,||br||Where thy sins no more can rise.
There in righteousness transcendent,||br||Lo! He doth in heaven appear,||br||||sp||||sp||Shows the blood of His atonement||br||As thy title to be there.
All thy sins were laid upon Him,||br||Jesus bore them on the tree;||br||||sp||||sp||God, who knew them, laid them on Him,||br||And, believing, thou art free.
God now brings thee to His dwelling,||br||Spreads for thee His feast divine,||br||||sp||||sp||Bids thee welcome, ever telling,||br||What a portion there is thine.
Blessed, glorious word, “forever”—||br||Yea “forever” is the word;||br||||sp||||sp||Nothing can the ransomed sever,||br||Nought divide them from the Lord.

Father, we own Thy sovereign claim||br||||sp||||sp||And bless Thy Son’s most precious name,||br||Whom Thou for us hast given;||br||||sp||||sp||Who bore the curse to sinners due,||br||||sp||||sp||Quickened our ruined souls anew,||br||And made us heirs of heaven.

’Tis by the Holy Ghost alone||br||||sp||||sp||That Christ, the Lord, is made our own,||br||The gift of grace divine:||br||||sp||||sp||But since to us, in His blest face,||br||||sp||||sp||There shines the glory of Thy grace,||br||We know that we are Thine.

Oh, while we here together join,||br||||sp||||sp||Before the throne of grace divine,||br||Bow down a Father’s ear;||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts have listened to Thy word,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy name we praise with glad accord,||br||Reveal Thyself as near.

Th’ atoning work is done;||br||The Victim’s blood is shed;||br||||sp||||sp||And Jesus now is gone||br||His people’s cause to plead:||br||||sp||||sp||He sits in heaven their great High Priest,||br||||sp||||sp||And bears their names upon His breast.

See “sprinkled with the blood||br||The mercy-seat” above;||br||||sp||||sp||For justice had withstood||br||The purposes of love;||br||||sp||||sp||But justice now withstands no more,||br||||sp||||sp||And mercy yields her boundless store.

And though awhile He be||br||Hid from the eyes of men,||br||||sp||||sp||His people look to see||br||Their great High Priest again.||br||||sp||||sp||In brightest glory He will come,||br||||sp||||sp||And take His waiting people home.

O what shall we do the Saviour to praise,||br||||sp||||sp||So faithful and true, so plenteous in grace,||br||||sp||||sp||So strong to deliver, to save from all harm||br||||sp||||sp||The weakest believer that leans on His arm!

How happy the man whose heart is set free,||br||||sp||||sp||The people, O God, that are joyful in Thee!||br||||sp||||sp||Their joy is to walk in the light of Thy face,||br||||sp||||sp||Forever to talk of Thy mercy and grace.

On His Father’s throne is seated||br||Christ the Lord, the living One!||br||||sp||||sp||All His toil on earth completed,||br||All His work for sinners done;||br||||sp||||sp||In the glory||br||See Him, God’s eternal Son!

Every knee shall bow before Him,||br||Every tongue confess His name,||br||||sp||||sp||Ransomed myriads shall adore Him,||br||Who endured the sinner’s shame!||br||||sp||||sp||From the glory||br||God doth now His worth proclaim.

Man the cross to Him awarded;||br||Man the Saviour crucified;||br||||sp||||sp||This world’s judgment stands recorded,||br||God’s own justice satisfied!||br||||sp||||sp||By the glory||br||Christ was claimed on earth who died.

Son of man, His incarnation||br||Opened first the tale of grace;||br||||sp||||sp||Son of man, in new creation||br||Leader of a chosen race!||br||||sp||||sp||Well may glory||br||Crown Him, in the ordered place!

O Thou great all-gracious Shepherd,||br||Shedding for us Thy life’s blood,||br||||sp||||sp||Unto shame and death delivered,||br||All to bring us nigh to God!||br||||sp||||sp||Now our willing hearts adore Thee,||br||Now we taste Thy dying love,||br||||sp||||sp||While by faith we come before Thee—||br||Faith which lifts our souls above.

As our Surety we behold Thee,||br||Ransoming our souls from death;||br||||sp||||sp||As the willing victim view Thee,||br||Yielding up to God Thy breath.||br||||sp||||sp||In this broken bread we own Thee,||br||Bruised for us and put to shame;||br||||sp||||sp||And this cup, O Lord, we thank Thee,||br||Speaks our pardon through Thy name.

But ’tis past, and, Lord we hail Thee,||br||Crowned with glory on the throne;||br||||sp||||sp||Meet it is Thy saints should bless Thee||br||For the place Thy death hath won:||br||||sp||||sp||Won for us—that in full measure||br||We should have our part with Thee:||br||||sp||||sp||Taste the river of Thy pleasure,||br||Share in all Thy victory.

Father, we worship Thee, our God!||br||What rich unfathomable grace,||br||||sp||||sp||On us, in Christ, hast Thou bestowed!||br||Children of wrath (our nature’s place),||br||||sp||||sp||Now ransomed and with Him made one,||br||Glories around unbounded shine,||br||||sp||||sp||The fullness of our God alone||br||The limit is of grace divine!
To Him that saved us from the world,||br||And washed us in His blood,||br||||sp||||sp||Called us to share His glorious throne,||br||As kings and priests to God:
To Him let every tongue be praise,||br||And every heart be love!||br||||sp||||sp||All grateful honors paid on earth,||br||And nobler songs above!
Not all the blood of beasts,||br||On Jewish altars slain,||br||||sp||||sp||Could give the guilty conscience peace||br||Or wash away its stain.
But Christ, the heavenly Lamb,||br||Took all our guilt away,||br||||sp||||sp||A sacrifice of nobler name,||br||And richer blood than they.
Our souls look back to see||br||The burden Thou didst bear||br||||sp||||sp||When hanging on th’ accursèd tree,||br||For all our guilt was there.
Believing we rejoice||br||To see the curse remove;||br||||sp||||sp||And bless the Lamb with cheerful voice,||br||And sing redeeming love.

Maker of earth and heaven,||br||||sp||||sp||Whose arm upholds creation,||br||||sp||||sp||To Thee we raise the voice of praise,||br||||sp||||sp||And bend in adoration.||br||We praise the power that made us,||br||||sp||||sp||We praise the love that blesses;||br||||sp||||sp||While every day that rolls away||br||||sp||||sp||Thy gracious care confesses.

Though trials and affliction||br||||sp||||sp||May cast their shadows o’er us,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy love doth throw a heavenly glow||br||||sp||||sp||Of light on all before us;||br||That love has smiled from heaven,||br||||sp||||sp||To cheer our path of sadness,||br||||sp||||sp||And lead the way through earth’s dark day,||br||||sp||||sp||To realms of joy and gladness.

The light of love and glory||br||||sp||||sp||Has shone through Christ our Saviour||br||||sp||||sp||The Crucified—who lived and died,||br||||sp||||sp||That we might live forever.||br||And since Thy great compassion||br||||sp||||sp||Thus brings Thy children near Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||May we to praise devote our days,||br||||sp||||sp||And keep forever near Thee.
Jesus, the Lord, our righteousness!||br||||sp||||sp||Our beauty Thou, our glorious dress!||br||||sp||||sp||Before the throne, in this arrayed,||br||||sp||||sp||With joy shall we lift up the head.

Bold shall we stand in that great day,||br||||sp||||sp||For who aught to our charge shall lay,||br||||sp||||sp||While by Thy blood absolved we are||br||||sp||||sp||From sin and guilt, from shame and fear?
Thus Abraham, the friend of God,||br||||sp||||sp||Thus all the saints redeemed with blood,||br||||sp||||sp||Saviour of sinners, Thee proclaim,||br||||sp||||sp||And all their boast is in Thy name.
This spotless robe the same appears||br||||sp||||sp||In new creation’s endless years,||br||||sp||||sp||No age can change its glorious hue,||br||||sp||||sp||The robe of Christ is ever new.
Till we behold Thee on Thy throne||br||||sp||||sp||In Thee we boast, in Thee alone,||br||||sp||||sp||Our beauty this, our glorious dress,||br||||sp||||sp||“Jesus, the Lord, our righteousness.”

Away with our sorrow and fear!||br||We soon shall have entered our home,||br||||sp||||sp||The heavenly city appear,||br||The day of our glory have come!||br||||sp||||sp||From earth we shall quickly remove,||br||To dwell in our proper abode,||br||||sp||||sp||In mansions of glory above—||br||The house of our Father and God.

There Christ has our dwelling-place won,||br||And we in His glory shall be||br||||sp||||sp||With Him everlastingly one,||br||His glory and bliss we shall see.||br||||sp||||sp||All tears shall have passed from our eyes,||br||When Him we behold in the cloud,||br||||sp||||sp||And taste the full joy of the skies,||br||The love of our Father and God.
Grace taught our wandering feet||br||To tread the heavenly road;||br||||sp||||sp||And new supplies each hour we meet||br||While traveling home to God.
’Twas grace that wrote each name||br||In God’s eternal book;||br||||sp||||sp||’Twas grace that gave us to the Lamb,||br||Who all our burdens took.
Grace saved us from the foe,||br||Grace taught us how to pray;||br||||sp||||sp||And God will ne’er His grace forego,||br||Till we have won the day.
May grace, free grace, inspire||br||Our souls with strength divine;||br||||sp||||sp||May every thought to God aspire,||br||And grace in service shine.
Grace all the work shall crown||br||Through everlasting days;||br||||sp||||sp||It lays in heaven the topmost stone,||br||And well deserves the praise.
High, in the Father’s house above,||br||Our mansion is prepared;||br||||sp||||sp||There is the home, the rest we love,||br||And there our bright reward.
With Him we love, in spotless white,||br||In glory we shall shine;||br||||sp||||sp||His blissful presence our delight,||br||In love and joy divine.
All taint of sin shall be removed,||br||All evil done away:||br||||sp||||sp||And we shall dwell with God’s Beloved,||br||Through God’s eternal day.
Christ delivered us when bound,||br||||sp||||sp||And, when wounded, healed our wound,||br||||sp||||sp||Sought us wandering, set us right,||br||||sp||||sp||Turned our darkness into light.
Can a mother’s tender care||br||||sp||||sp||Cease towards the child she bare?||br||||sp||||sp||Yes, she may forgetful prove,||br||||sp||||sp||He will never cease to love.
His is an unchanging love,||br||||sp||||sp||Higher than the heights above,||br||||sp||||sp||Deeper then the depths beneath,||br||||sp||||sp||Free and faithful, strong as death.
We shall see His glory soon,||br||||sp||||sp||When the work of grace is done,||br||||sp||||sp||Partners of His throne above;||br||||sp||||sp||Such to us His wondrous love!
This alone is our complaint,||br||||sp||||sp||That our love is weak and faint;||br||||sp||||sp||Yet we love Him, and adore,||br||||sp||||sp||O for grace to love Him more!

Our Father, we praise Thee, Thou blest One, who gave us||br||||sp||||sp||In grace without limit Thy well-beloved Son!||br||||sp||||sp||O Christ, we exalt Thee, who diedst once to save us,||br||||sp||||sp||And now by Thy Spirit hast sealed each one!
Jesus, our Lord! we know Thy name,||br||Thy name is all our trust;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou wilt not put our souls to shame,||br||Nor let our hope be lost.
Firm as Thy life the promise stands,||br||And Thou canst well secure||br||||sp||||sp||What we’ve committed to Thy hands,||br||Till the appointed hour.
Then wilt Thou own us each by name||br||Before Thy Father’s face;||br||||sp||||sp||And in the new Jerusalem||br||Give us our blood-bought place.

||i||Lord, we are Thine:||/i|| bought by Thy blood.||br||Once the poor guilty slaves of sin,||br||||sp||||sp||But Thou redeemedst us to God,||br||And mad’st Thy Spirit dwell within;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou hast our sinful wanderings borne||br||With love and patience all divine;||br||||sp||||sp||As brands, then, from the burning torn,||br||We own that we are ||i||wholly Thine.||/i||

||i||Lord, we are Thine:||/i|| Thy claims we own,||br||Ourselves to Thee we’d wholly give;||br||||sp||||sp||Reign Thou within our hearts alone,||br||And let us to Thy glory live;||br||||sp||||sp||Here let us each Thy mind display,||br||In all Thy gracious image shine;||br||||sp||||sp||And haste that long-expected day||br||When Thou shalt own ||i||that we are Thine.||/i||

The Son—He left God’s throne above||br||(So free, so infinite His grace!)||br||||sp||||sp||Emptied Himself, and then in love||br||Bled for our lost, our ruined race:||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis mercy, all beyond our thought,||br||||sp||||sp||That us to God in Jesus brought.

No condemnation now we dread,||br||Jesus is ours, prepared our place,||br||||sp||||sp||Our life in Him, our hidden Head,||br||Himself our righteousness through grace,||br||||sp||||sp||Bold we approach the heavenly throne,||br||||sp||||sp||Heirs of the crown He for us won.
How sweet the name of Jesus sounds||br||In a believer’s ear!||br||||sp||||sp||It soothes his sorrows, heals his wounds,||br||And drives away his fear.
It makes the wounded spirit whole,||br||It calms the troubled breast;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis manna to the hungry soul,||br||And to the weary rest.
Blest name! the rock on which we build,||br||Our shield and hiding-place;||br||||sp||||sp||Our never-failing treasury, filled||br||With boundless stores of grace.
Jesus! our Saviour, Shepherd, Friend,||br||Thou Prophet, Priest, and King;||br||||sp||||sp||Our Lord, our Life, our Way, our End,||br||Accept the praise we bring.
Weak is the effort of our heart,||br||And cold our warmest thought;||br||||sp||||sp||But when we see Thee as Thou art,||br||We’ll praise Thee as we ought.
Till then we would Thy love proclaim||br||With every fleeting breath;||br||||sp||||sp||And triumph in Thy blessed name||br||Which quells the power of death.
Through waves, through clouds and storms,||br||God gently clears the way;||br||||sp||||sp||We wait His time; so shall the night||br||Soon end in blissful day.
He everywhere hath sway,||br||And all things serve His might;||br||||sp||||sp||His every act pure blessing is,||br||His path unsullied light.
When He makes bare His arm,||br||Who shall His work withstand?||br||||sp||||sp||When He His people’s cause defends,||br||Who then shall stay His hand?
We leave it to Himself||br||To choose and to command,||br||||sp||||sp||With wonder filled, we soon shall see||br||How wise, how strong His hand!
We comprehend Him not,||br||Yet earth and heaven tell||br||||sp||||sp||God sits as sovereign on the throne||br||And ruleth all things well.

O Lord, how blest our journey,||br||Though here on earth we roam,||br||||sp||||sp||Who find in Abba’s favor||br||Our spirit’s present home:||br||||sp||||sp||For where Thou now art sitting||br||By faith we’ve found repose,||br||||sp||||sp||Free to look up to heaven,||br||Since our blest Head arose.

In spirit there already;||br||Soon we ourselves shall be||br||||sp||||sp||In soul and body perfect,||br||All glorified with Thee:||br||||sp||||sp||Thy Father’s love sustains us||br||Along the thorny way,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy Father’s house, the dwelling||br||Made ready for that day.

The Comforter, now present,||br||Assures us of Thy love;||br||||sp||||sp||He is the blessed earnest||br||Of glory there above;||br||||sp||||sp||The river of Thy pleasure||br||Is what sustains us now,||br||||sp||||sp||Till Thy new name’s imprinted||br||On every sinless brow.

Lord, we await Thy glory;||br||We have no home but there,||br||||sp||||sp||Where the adopted family||br||With us Thy joy shall share.||br||||sp||||sp||No place can fully please us||br||Where Thou, O Lord, art not;||br||||sp||||sp||In Thee, and with Thee, ever||br||Is found, by grace, our lot.
On the Lamb our souls are resting,||br||What His love no tongue can say,||br||||sp||||sp||All our sins, so great, so many,||br||In His blood are washed away.
Sweetest rest and peace have filled us,||br||Sweeter praise than tongue can tell,||br||||sp||||sp||God is satisfied with Jesus,||br||We are satisfied as well.
Conscience now no more condemns us,||br||For His own most precious blood||br||||sp||||sp||Once for all has washed and cleansed us,||br||Cleansed us in the eyes of God.
Filled with this sweet peace forever,||br||On we go, through strife and care,||br||||sp||||sp||Till we find that peace around us||br||In the Lamb’s high glory there.
Lord! who can pay the mighty debt||br||Of love so rich as Thine?||br||||sp||||sp||Love, which surpasseth finding out,||br||Unspeakable, divine!
O rather give us, daily, more—||br||More every hour—to see||br||||sp||||sp||That such a bounteous Giver Thou,||br||We must Thy debtors be.
Wisdom! Jehovah’s first delight,||br||The everlasting Son!||br||||sp||||sp||Before the first of all His works,||br||Creation, was begun;
Before the skies and watery clouds,||br||Before the solid land;||br||||sp||||sp||Before the fields, before the floods,||br||Thou wast at His right hand!
When He adorned the arch of heaven||br||And built it, Thou wast there,||br||||sp||||sp||To order where the sun should rise,||br||And marshal every star.
When ocean’s bed was measured out,||br||And spread the hoary deep,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou gav’st the flood a firm decree||br||In its own bounds to keep.
When, hung amid the empty space,||br||The earth was balanced well,||br||||sp||||sp||With joy Thou saw’st the mansion where||br||The sons of men should dwell.
Jesus! from everlasting days||br||Thy thoughts upon us ran;||br||||sp||||sp||Ere sin was known, ere Adam’s dust||br||Was fashioned into man.

Our thanks to God most high!||br||The Father of our Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||The Saviour-God is He,||br||And be His name adored!||br||||sp||||sp||O God, Thy mercy shall endure,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy word abide forever sure.

He sent His only Son||br||And saved us from our woe—||br||||sp||||sp||From Satan, guilt, and hell,||br||And every hurtful foe.||br||||sp||||sp||Thy mercy, Lord. shall still endure,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy Word abide forever sure.

Give thanks aloud to God,||br||To God your praises bring,||br||||sp||||sp||To God upon His throne||br||His works and glories sing.||br||||sp||||sp||Thy power and grace are still the same,||br||||sp||||sp||Let endless praise exalt His name.
How wondrous the glories that meet||br||||sp||||sp||In Jesus, and from His face shine,||br||||sp||||sp||His love is eternal and sweet,||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis human, ’tis also divine!
His glory—not only God’s Son—||br||||sp||||sp||In manhood He had His full part—||br||||sp||||sp||And the union of both joined in one||br||||sp||||sp||Form the fountain of love in His heart.
The merits and worth of His blood||br||||sp||||sp||Have freed us from hell and from fear,||br||||sp||||sp||That we, as the blest sons of God,||br||||sp||||sp||May make His good pleasure our care.
O then may this union and love||br||||sp||||sp||Make us walk in the service of heaven,||br||||sp||||sp||’Mid obedience and suffering to prove||br||||sp||||sp||That we to the Lamb have been given.

In the Lord we have redemption,||br||Full remission in His blood;||br||||sp||||sp||From the curse entire exemption,||br||From the curse pronounced by God:||br||||sp||||sp||What a Saviour Jesus is!||br||||sp||||sp||O what grace, what love is His!

Sweet His name, that name transcending||br||Every name on earth, in heaven;||br||||sp||||sp||Praise through ages never-ending,||br||To the Son of God be given!||br||||sp||||sp||He alone the Saviour is,||br||||sp||||sp||Everlasting praise be His.

When wandering far from the Father’s abode,||br||||sp||||sp||The heart full of pride and hatred to God,||br||||sp||||sp||The children of darkness, of Satan the slaves,||br||||sp||||sp||’Twas Jesus redeemed us—His merit that saves.

Our sins on the cross He on Calvary bore,||br||||sp||||sp||He blotted them out and they are no more;||br||||sp||||sp||Now pardoned and washèd we boldly draw near,||br||||sp||||sp||And cry, “Abba, Father!” unhindered by fear.

Despised by the world, we’re strangers below,||br||||sp||||sp||But callèd to heaven we cheerfully go;||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord is our Leader; and, strong in His might,||br||||sp||||sp||Though Satan opposes we fight the good fight.

We look for the day when Jesus shall come,||br||||sp||||sp||And take His blood-purchased brethren home;||br||||sp||||sp||When we shall behold all His glory and grace,||br||||sp||||sp||And a heaven be found in the light of His face.
Oh bright and blessed scenes!||br||Where sin can never come,||br||||sp||||sp||Whose sight our longing spirit weans||br||From earth where yet we roam.
And can we call our home||br||Our Father’s house on high,||br||||sp||||sp||The rest of God our rest to come,||br||Our place of liberty?
Yes! in that light unstained,||br||Our stainless souls shall live,||br||||sp||||sp||Our heart’s deep longings more than gained,||br||When God His rest shall give.
His presence there, my soul,||br||Its rest, its joy untold,||br||||sp||||sp||Shall find when endless ages roll,||br||And time shall ne’er grow old.
Our God the center is,||br||His presence fills that land,||br||||sp||||sp||And countless myriads owned as His,||br||Round Him adoring stand.
Our God whom we have known,||br||Well known in Jesus’ love,||br||||sp||||sp||Rests in the blessing of His own,||br||Before Himself above.
Glory supreme is there,||br||Glory that shines through all,||br||||sp||||sp||More precious still that love to share||br||As those that love did call.
Like Jesus in that place||br||Of light and love supreme;||br||||sp||||sp||Once Man of Sorrows, full of grace,||br||Heaven’s blest and endless theme.
Like Him! O grace supreme!||br||Like Him before Thy face,||br||||sp||||sp||Like Him to know that glory beam||br||Unhindered face to face.
O love supreme and bright!||br||Good to the feeblest heart,||br||||sp||||sp||That gives us now, as heavenly light,||br||What soon shall be our part.

O how the thought that I shall know||br||||sp||||sp||The Man that suffered here below,||br||To manifest God’s favor||br||||sp||||sp||For me, and for the saints I love,||br||||sp||||sp||Both here, and with Himself above,||br||||sp||||sp||Doth my renewèd nature move||br||At that sweet word, “Forever!”

Forever to behold Him shine!||br||||sp||||sp||Forevermore to call Him mine!||br||And see Him still before me;||br||||sp||||sp||Forever on His face to gaze,||br||||sp||||sp||And meet the full assembled rays,||br||||sp||||sp||While all His beauty He displays||br||To all the saints in glory!

Not all things else are half so dear||br||||sp||||sp||As is His blissful presence here,||br||What will it be in heaven!||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis heaven on earth that we can say,||br||||sp||||sp||As now we journey, day by day,||br||||sp||||sp||“Himself has borne our guilt away,||br||Our sins are all forgiven.”

But how will His celestial voice||br||||sp||||sp||Make each enraptured heart rejoice,||br||Of saints in glory near Him!||br||||sp||||sp||When we no longer absent wait,||br||||sp||||sp||But like Him in His glorious state,||br||||sp||||sp||Where nought our bliss can e’er abate,||br||With joy in heaven shall hear Him!

Go, and search the tomb of Jesus,||br||Where the Lord of glory lay;||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus is not there, but risen,||br||And has borne our sins away,||br||||sp||||sp||It is finished!||br||Captive led captivity.

Could not all our sins retain Him,||br||Prisoned in the guarded cave?||br||||sp||||sp||These He blotted out in dying,||br||By His cross He spoiled the grave:||br||||sp||||sp||Lo! He’s risen!||br||Yes, the Lord is risen indeed.
Like Thee, O Lord—how wondrous fair,||br||||sp||||sp||Lord Jesus, all Thy members are;||br||||sp||||sp||A life divine to them is given—||br||||sp||||sp||The bright inheritance of heaven.
Just as we were we came to Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||As heirs of wrath and misery;||br||||sp||||sp||Just as Thou art—now we are Thine,||br||||sp||||sp||We stand in righteousness divine.
Just as Thou art—nor doubt, nor fear,||br||||sp||||sp||Can e’er to those like Thee be near,||br||||sp||||sp||O boundless love! as Thee we’re seen||br||||sp||||sp||The “righteousness of God in Him.”
Just as Thou art—O blissful ray||br||||sp||||sp||That turned our darkness into day!||br||||sp||||sp||That woke us from our death of sin||br||||sp||||sp||To know our perfectness in Him.
Soon, soon, ’mid joys on joys untold,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou wilt this grace and love unfold,||br||||sp||||sp||And worlds on worlds adoring see||br||||sp||||sp||The part Thy members have in Thee.

Thy name we bless, Lord Jesus,||br||||sp||||sp||That name all names excelling,||br||||sp||||sp||How great Thy love, all praise above,||br||||sp||||sp||Should every tongue be telling.||br||The Father’s loving-kindness||br||||sp||||sp||In giving Thee was shown us;||br||||sp||||sp||Now by Thy blood redeemed to God,||br||||sp||||sp||As children He doth own us.

From that eternal glory||br||||sp||||sp||Thou hadst with God the Father,||br||||sp||||sp||He gave His Son that He in one||br||||sp||||sp||His children all might gather;||br||Our sins were all laid on Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||God’s wrath Thou hast endured;||br||||sp||||sp||It was for us Thou sufferedst thus,||br||||sp||||sp||And hast our peace securèd.

Thou from the dead was raisèd—||br||||sp||||sp||And from all condemnation||br||||sp||||sp||Thy saints are free, as risen in Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Head of the new creation!||br||On high Thou hast ascended,||br||||sp||||sp||To God’s right hand in heaven,||br||||sp||||sp||The Lamb once slain, alive again—||br||||sp||||sp||To Thee all power is given.

Thou hast bestowed the earnest||br||||sp||||sp||Of that we shall inherit;||br||||sp||||sp||Till Thou shalt come to take us home,||br||||sp||||sp||We’re sealed by God the Spirit.||br||We wait for Thine appearing,||br||||sp||||sp||When we shall know more fully||br||||sp||||sp||The grace divine that made us Thine,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou Lamb of God most holy!
Thou, Lamb of God! didst shed Thy blood,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou didst our load of misery bear;||br||||sp||||sp||And hast exalted us to share||br||||sp||||sp||The rank of kings and priests to God.
To Thee we render evermore||br||||sp||||sp||The honor, glory, praise that’s due;||br||||sp||||sp||Might, power, and obedience, too,||br||||sp||||sp||And in our hearts we Thee adore.
Amen! Amen!||br||||sp||||sp||O Lord, Amen!
Sovereign grace o’er sin abounding:||br||Ransomed souls the tidings swell!||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis a deep that knows no sounding;||br||Who its length or breadth can tell?
Saved by Christ, we’re free forever,||br||This the Spirit’s voice declares!||br||||sp||||sp||Death, nor life, nor aught can sever||br||Jesus from the chosen heirs.
Souls above, in His communion,||br||Now with Him from conflict rest,||br||||sp||||sp||While below, with Christ in union,||br||We can sing how saints are blest.

O Jesus! everlasting God!||br||||sp||||sp||Who didst for sinners shed Thy blood||br||Upon th’ accursèd tree;||br||||sp||||sp||And, finishing redemption’s toil,||br||||sp||||sp||Didst win for us the happy spoil—||br||All praise we give to Thee.

Fain would we think upon Thy pain,||br||||sp||||sp||Would find in Thee our life and gain,||br||And firmly fix our heart||br||||sp||||sp||Upon Thy grief and dying love,||br||||sp||||sp||Nor evermore from Thee remove.||br||Though from all else we part.

The more through grace ourselves we know,||br||||sp||||sp||The more rejoiced we are to bow||br||And glory in Thy cross;||br||||sp||||sp||To trust in Thine atoning blood,||br||||sp||||sp||And look to Thee for every good,||br||And count all else but dross.
Well may we sing! with triumph sing,||br||The great Redeemer’s praise!||br||||sp||||sp||The glories of the living God,||br||Revealed in Jesus’ face.
The love of God it was that sought||br||From sin to set us free;||br||||sp||||sp||That gave the Son, whose precious blood||br||Has wrought our liberty.
In Him we read the Father’s love,||br||And find eternal peace;||br||||sp||||sp||We meet in Him a Saviour-God,||br||And fear and terror cease.
Then gladly sing, and sound abroad||br||The great Redeemer’s praise;||br||||sp||||sp||The glories of the living God,||br||The riches of His grace!

The Lord of life in death hath lain,||br||||sp||||sp||To clear me from all charge of sin;||br||||sp||||sp||And, Lord, from guilt of crimson stain||br||||sp||||sp||Thy precious blood hath made me clean.
And now a righteousness divine||br||||sp||||sp||Is all my glory, all my trust;||br||||sp||||sp||Nor will I fear since that is mine,||br||||sp||||sp||While Thou dost live, and God is just.
Clad in this robe, how bright I shine!||br||||sp||||sp||Angels possess not such a dress;||br||||sp||||sp||Angels have not a robe like mine—||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus, the Lord’s my righteousness.
The day of glory bearing||br||Its brightness far and near,||br||||sp||||sp||The day of Christ’s appearing||br||We now no longer fear.
He once a spotless victim||br||For us on Calvary bled;||br||||sp||||sp||Jehovah did afflict Him,||br||And bruised Him in our stead.
To Him by grace united,||br||We joy in Him alone;||br||||sp||||sp||And now by faith delighted,||br||Behold Him on the throne.
Then let Him come in glory,||br||Who comes His saints to raise,||br||||sp||||sp||To perfect all the story||br||Of wonder, love and praise.

Thy mercy, O God, is the theme of my song,||br||||sp||||sp||The joy of my heart, and the boast of my tongue;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis free grace alone, from the first to the last,||br||||sp||||sp||That wins the affections, and binds the soul fast.
Rise, my soul, thy God directs thee,||br||Stranger hands no more impede;||br||||sp||||sp||Pass thou on, His hand protects thee,||br||Strength that has the captive freed.
Is the wilderness before thee,||br||Desert land where drought abides?||br||||sp||||sp||Heavenly springs shall there restore thee,||br||Fresh from God’s exhaustless tides.
Light divine surrounds thy going,||br||God Himself shall mark thy way;||br||||sp||||sp||Secret blessings, richly flowing,||br||Lead to everlasting day.
God, thine everlasting portion,||br||Feeds thee with the mighty’s meat;||br||||sp||||sp||Price of Egypt’s hard extortion,||br||Egypt’s food no more to eat.
Art thou weaned from Egypt’s pleasures?||br||God in secret thee shall keep,||br||||sp||||sp||There unfold His hidden treasures,||br||There His love’s exhaustless deep.
In the desert God will teach thee||br||What the God that thou hast found,||br||||sp||||sp||Patient, gracious, powerful, holy,||br||All His grace shall there abound.
On to Canaan’s rest still wending,||br||E’en thy wants and woes shall bring||br||||sp||||sp||Suited grace from high descending,||br||Thou shalt taste of mercy’s spring.
Though thy way be long and dreary,||br||Eagle strength He’ll still renew:||br||||sp||||sp||Garments fresh and foot unweary||br||Tell how God hath brought thee through.
When to Canaan’s long-loved dwelling||br||Love divine thy foot shall bring,||br||||sp||||sp||There, with shouts of triumph swelling,||br||Zion’s songs in rest to sing—
There no stranger-God shall meet thee,||br||Stranger thou in courts above,||br||||sp||||sp||He who to His rest shall greet thee,||br||Greets thee with a well-known love.
Jesus! O name divinely sweet!||br||How soothing is the sound!||br||||sp||||sp||What joyful news, what heavenly power||br||In that blest name is found.
Our souls, as guilty and condemned,||br||In hopeless fetters lay;||br||||sp||||sp||Our souls with countless sins defiled||br||Of death and hell the prey.
Jesus, to purge away our guilt,||br||A willing victim fell,||br||||sp||||sp||And on His cross triumphant broke||br||The bands of death and hell.
O what blessings flow from grace,||br||||sp||||sp||Treasured up in Christ the Head!||br||||sp||||sp||He who perfected life’s race||br||||sp||||sp||Bore sin’s burden in our stead.
Christ our ransom doth appear||br||||sp||||sp||In the glorious courts above:||br||||sp||||sp||Righteousness divine we wear,||br||||sp||||sp||Loved with everlasting love.
Rest of the saints above,||br||Jerusalem of God,||br||||sp||||sp||Who in thy palaces of love,||br||Thy golden streets have trod?
To me thy joy to tell,||br||Those courts secure from ill,||br||||sp||||sp||Where God Himself vouchsafes to dwell,||br||And every bosom fill.
Who shall to me that joy||br||Of saint-thronged courts declare;||br||||sp||||sp||Tell of that constant sweet employ||br||My spirit longs to share?
That rest secure from ill||br||No cloud of grief e’er stains,||br||||sp||||sp||Unfailing praise each heart doth fill,||br||And love eternal reigns.
The Lamb is there, my soul—||br||There God Himself doth rest,||br||||sp||||sp||In love divine diffused through all||br||With Him supremely blest.
God and the Lamb—’tis well||br||I know that source divine||br||||sp||||sp||Of joy and love no tongue can tell,||br||Yet know that all is mine.
And see, the Spirit’s power||br||Has ope’d the heavenly door,||br||||sp||||sp||Has brought me to that favored hour||br||When toil shall all be o’er.
There on the hidden bread||br||Of Christ—once humbled here—||br||||sp||||sp||God’s treasured store—forever fed,||br||His love my soul shall cheer.
Called by that secret name||br||Of undisclosed delight,||br||||sp||||sp||(Blest answer to reproach and shame)||br||Graved on the stone of white.
There in effulgence bright,||br||Saviour and Guide, with Thee||br||||sp||||sp||I’ll walk, and in Thy heavenly light||br||Whiter my robe shall be.
There in th’ unsullied way||br||Which His own hand hath dressed,||br||||sp||||sp||My feet press on where brightest day||br||Shines forth on all the rest.
But who that glorious blaze||br||Of living light shall tell,||br||||sp||||sp||Where all His brightness God displays,||br||And the Lamb’s glories dwell?
(There only to adore,||br||My soul its strength may find,||br||||sp||||sp||Its life, its joy forevermore,||br||By sight nor sense defined.)
God and the Lamb shall there||br||The light and temple be,||br||||sp||||sp||And radiant hosts forever share||br||The unveiled mystery.

On earth the song begins;||br||In heaven more sweet and loud—||br||||sp||||sp||“To Him that cleansed our sins||br||By His atoning blood;||br||||sp||||sp||To Him,” we sing in joyful strain,||br||||sp||||sp||“Be honor, power, and praise, Amen.”

Alone He bare the cross,||br||Alone its grief sustained;||br||||sp||||sp||His was the shame and loss,||br||And He the victory gained;||br||||sp||||sp||The mighty work was all His own,||br||||sp||||sp||Though we shall share His glorious throne.
Arm of the Lord, whose wondrous power||br||The world and all things made,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou art our Rock, our Shield, our Tower||br||Our ransom Thou hast paid.
Revealer of the Father’s love,||br||His glory and His power;||br||||sp||||sp||Upholding all things now above,||br||Till the appointed hour—
That hour when all Thy foes to Thee||br||A footstool shall be given;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy praise Thy people’s food shall be;||br||Their place with Thee in heaven.
Jesus, Thou alone art worthy||br||Ceaseless praises to receive;||br||||sp||||sp||For Thy love and grace and goodness||br||Rise o’er all our thoughts conceive.
With adoring hearts, we render||br||Honor to Thy precious name,||br||||sp||||sp||Overflowing with Thy mercies,||br||Far and wide Thy worth proclaim.
Praise Him! praise Him! praise the Saviour,||br||Saints aloud your voices raise!||br||||sp||||sp||Praise Him! praise Him! till in heaven||br||Perfected we’ll sing His praise.
See! see, the blessed Saviour comes,||br||The God of love and grace;||br||||sp||||sp||With Him we spend eternity||br||In triumph and in praise.
Forever our still wondering eyes||br||Shall o’er His beauties rove;||br||||sp||||sp||To endless ages we’ll adore||br||The riches of His love!
We hear the words of love,||br||We gaze upon the blood,||br||||sp||||sp||We see the mighty sacrifice,||br||And we have peace with God.
’Tis everlasting peace!||br||Sure as Jehovah’s name;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis stable as His steadfast throne,||br||Forevermore the same.
Our love is ofttimes low,||br||Our joy still ebbs and flows;||br||||sp||||sp||But peace with Him remains the same,||br||No change Jehovah knows.
We change—He changes not;||br||Our Christ can never die:||br||||sp||||sp||His love, not ours, the resting-place,||br||We on His truth rely.
The cross still stands unchanged,||br||Though heaven is now His home;||br||||sp||||sp||The mighty stone is rolled away,||br||But yonder is His tomb!
And yonder is our peace,||br||The grave of all our woes;||br||||sp||||sp||We know the Son of God has come,||br||We know He died and rose.
We know He liveth now||br||At God’s right hand above;||br||||sp||||sp||We know the throne on which He sits,||br||We know His truth and love!

O Lord, Thy love’s unbounded!||br||So full, so vast, so free!||br||||sp||||sp||Our thoughts are all confounded||br||Whene’er we think of Thee:||br||||sp||||sp||For us Thou cam’st from heaven,||br||For us to bleed and die,||br||||sp||||sp||That purchased and forgiven,||br||We might ascend on high.

But oh! the hope of being||br||Forever with the Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||The joyful hope of seeing||br||That face for us so marred!||br||||sp||||sp||It fills our heart with comfort,||br||It fills our lips with praise,||br||||sp||||sp||So that amidst our sorrow||br||A joyful song we raise.

O Lamb of God, we thank Thee,||br||We bless Thy holy name;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy love once made Thee willing||br||To bear our sin and shame.||br||||sp||||sp||And now thy love is waiting||br||Thy saints like Thee to raise;||br||||sp||||sp||Firstborn of many brethren,||br||To Thee be all the praise.

O Lord! Thou now art seated,||br||Above the heavens, on high,||br||||sp||||sp||(The gracious work completed,||br||For which Thou cam’st to die);||br||||sp||||sp||To Thee our hearts are lifted,||br||While pilgrims wandering here,||br||||sp||||sp||For Thou alone art gifted||br||Our every weight to bear.

We know, Lord, Thou hast bought us,||br||And washed us in Thy blood;||br||||sp||||sp||We know Thy grace has brought us||br||As kings and priests to God.||br||||sp||||sp||We know that that blest morning,||br||Long looked for, draweth near,||br||||sp||||sp||When we, at Thy returning,||br||In glory shall appear.

O by Thy love constrain us,||br||And fix our hearts on Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Let nothing henceforth pain us,||br||But that which paineth Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Our joy, our blest endeavor,||br||Through suffering, conflict, shame,||br||||sp||||sp||To serve Thee, gracious Saviour,||br||And magnify Thy name.

In Jesus Himself (the Father’s delight),||br||||sp||||sp||The saints, without blame, appear in God’s sight;||br||||sp||||sp||And while He in Jesus our souls shall approve,||br||||sp||||sp||So long shall the Father continue His love.

In Jesus, free grace all blessings secures;||br||||sp||||sp||We know and rejoice that all things are ours;||br||||sp||||sp||And God from His purpose will never remove,||br||||sp||||sp||But love us, and bless us, and “rest in His love.”
O blessed Saviour, is Thy love||br||So great, so full, so free?||br||||sp||||sp||Fain would we have our thoughts, our hearts,||br||Our lives engaged with Thee.
We love Thee for the glorious worth||br||Which in Thyself we see:||br||||sp||||sp||We love Thee for that shameful cross,||br||Endured so patiently.
No man of greater love can boast||br||Than for His friend to die;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou for Thine enemies wast slain!||br||What love with Thine can vie?
Though in the very form of God,||br||With heavenly glory crowned,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou didst a servant’s form assume,||br||Beset with sorrow round.
Thou wouldst like wretched man be made||br||In everything but sin,||br||||sp||||sp||That we as like Thee might become||br||As we unlike had been:
Like Thee in faith, in meekness, love,||br||In every beauteous grace;||br||||sp||||sp||From glory into glory changed,||br||Till we behold Thy face.
O Lord! we treasure in our souls||br||The memory of Thy love;||br||||sp||||sp||And ever shall Thy name to us||br||A grateful odor prove.
Hosanna to the King of kings!||br||The great incarnate Word!||br||||sp||||sp||Ten thousand songs and glories wait||br||The coming of our Lord!
Thy victories and Thine endless fame||br||Through the wide world shall run,||br||||sp||||sp||And everlasting ages sing||br||The triumphs Thou hast won.
Glory, honor, praise, and power,||br||Be unto the Lamb forever!||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus Christ is our Redeemer.||br||Hallelujah! Hallelujah!||br||||sp||||sp||Hallelujah! Praise we the Lord!
O what a debt we owe||br||To Him who shed His blood,||br||||sp||||sp||And cleansed our souls, and gave us power||br||To stand before His God.
Saviour and Lord! we own||br||The riches of Thy grace;||br||||sp||||sp||For we can call Thy God, our God—||br||Can bow before His face.
Thy Father, too, above,||br||We worship as our own,||br||||sp||||sp||Who gave with Thee the Spirit’s cry,||br||To us His sons foreknown.

How sweet away from self to flee,||br||And shelter in our Saviour;||br||||sp||||sp||Oh! precious grace, with Him’s our place,||br||In God’s eternal favor.||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus the goal before our soul,||br||The One we know in glory;||br||||sp||||sp||While we’re on earth, we’d tell His worth,||br||A saved one’s sweetest story.
From the palace of His glory,||br||From the home of joy and love,||br||||sp||||sp||Came the Lord Himself to seek us;||br||He would have us there above.
There from that eternal brightness||br||Have His thoughts flowed forth in love;||br||||sp||||sp||He in His great love would have us||br||Ever there with Him above.
Trembling we had hoped for mercy—||br||Some lone place within His door:||br||||sp||||sp||But the crown, the throne, the mansion,||br||All were ready long before.
And in past and distant ages,||br||In those courts so bright and fair,||br||||sp||||sp||Ere we were, was He rejoicing,||br||All He won with us to share.
The Lord is risen indeed,||br||And all His work performed!||br||||sp||||sp||The captive Surety now is freed,||br||And death, our foe, disarmed.
The Lord is risen indeed:||br||He lives—to die no more;||br||||sp||||sp||He lives—His people’s cause to plead,||br||Whose curse and shame He bore.
The Lord is risen indeed:||br||And death has lost its prey:||br||||sp||||sp||And with Him all the ransomed seed||br||Shall reign in endless day.
Break forth and sing the song||br||Of “Glory to the Lamb!”||br||||sp||||sp||Wake every heart and every tongue||br||To praise the Saviour’s name.
Sing of His dying love;||br||Sing of His rising power;||br||||sp||||sp||Sing how He intercedes above||br||For those whose sins He bore.
Sing on your heavenly road,||br||Ye sons of glory, sing;||br||||sp||||sp||To the ascended Lamb of God,||br||Your cheerful praises bring.
Soon shall we hear Him say,||br||“Ye ransomed pilgrims, come”;||br||||sp||||sp||Soon will He call us hence away,||br||And take us to His home.
Then shall each raptured tongue||br||His fullest praise proclaim;||br||||sp||||sp||And sweeter voices wake the song||br||Of “Glory to the Lamb!”
The Saviour lives, no more to die;||br||||sp||||sp||He lives, our Head, enthroned on high;||br||||sp||||sp||He lives triumphant o’er the grave;||br||||sp||||sp||He lives eternally to save.
The chief of sinners He receives;||br||||sp||||sp||His saints He loves and never leaves;||br||||sp||||sp||He’ll guard us safe from every ill,||br||||sp||||sp||And all His promises fulfill.
Abundant grace will He afford,||br||||sp||||sp||Till we are present with the Lord;||br||||sp||||sp||And prove what we have sung before,||br||||sp||||sp||That Jesus lives forevermore.
Then let our souls in Him rejoice,||br||||sp||||sp||And sing His praise with cheerful voice:||br||||sp||||sp||Our doubts and fears forever gone,||br||||sp||||sp||For Christ is on the Father’s throne.
Blest Lamb of God! with grateful praise||br||||sp||||sp||Our voices now to Thee we raise—||br||||sp||||sp||O’er earth to reign, redeemed by blood,||br||||sp||||sp||Kingdom and priests are we to God.
Soon, too, in glory shall we sing,||br||||sp||||sp||And louder praises to Thee bring,||br||||sp||||sp||While every nation, tongue and tribe,||br||||sp||||sp||Strength, glory, might, to Thee ascribe!
Amen! Amen!||br||||sp||||sp||O Lord, Amen!
Gazing on the Lord in glory,||br||While our hearts in worship bow,||br||||sp||||sp||There we read the wondrous story||br||Of the cross—it’s shame and woe.
Every mark of dark dishonor||br||Heaped upon the thorn-crowned brow,||br||||sp||||sp||All the depths of Thy heart’s sorrow||br||Told in answering glory now.
On that cross alone—forsaken—||br||Where no pitying eye was found;||br||||sp||||sp||Now to God’s right hand exalted,||br||With Thy praise the heavens resound.
Did Thy God e’en then forsake Thee,||br||Hide His face from Thy deep need?||br||||sp||||sp||In Thy face, once marred and smitten,||br||All His glory now we read.
Gazing on it we adore Thee,||br||Blessed, precious, holy Lord;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou, the Lamb, alone art worthy,||br||This be earth’s and heaven’s accord.
Rise our hearts, and bless the Father,||br||Ceaseless song e’en here begun,||br||||sp||||sp||Endless praise and adoration||br||To the Father and the Son.
On Christ salvation rests secure;||br||||sp||||sp||The Rock of Ages must endure;||br||||sp||||sp||Nor can that faith be overthrown||br||||sp||||sp||Which rests upon the “Living Stone.”
No other hope shall intervene:||br||||sp||||sp||To Him we look, on Him we lean:||br||||sp||||sp||Other foundations we disown,||br||||sp||||sp||And build on Christ, the “Living Stone.”
In Him, it is ordained to raise||br||||sp||||sp||A temple to Jehovah’s praise,||br||||sp||||sp||Composed of all the saints, who own||br||||sp||||sp||No Saviour but the “Living Stone.”
View the vast building, see it rise;||br||||sp||||sp||The work how great! the plan how wise!||br||||sp||||sp||O wondrous fabric! power unknown!||br||||sp||||sp||That rears it on the “Living Stone.”
But most adore His precious name;||br||||sp||||sp||His glory and His grace proclaim;||br||||sp||||sp||For us, condemned, despised, undone,||br||||sp||||sp||He gave Himself, the “Living Stone.”

Now in a song of grateful praise,||br||||sp||||sp||To our dear Lord the voice we’ll raise;||br||||sp||||sp||With all His saints we’ll join to tell,||br||||sp||||sp||“Our Jesus hath done all things well.”

All worlds His glorious power confess,||br||||sp||||sp||His wisdom all His works express;||br||||sp||||sp||But oh, His love!—what tongue can tell?||br||||sp||||sp||“Our Jesus hath done all things well.”

And since our souls have known His love,||br||||sp||||sp||What mercies has He made us prove,||br||||sp||||sp||Mercies which all our praise excel;||br||||sp||||sp||“Our Jesus hath done all things well.”

And when on that bright day we rise,||br||||sp||||sp||And join the anthems of the skies,||br||||sp||||sp||In heavenly songs this note shall swell,||br||||sp||||sp||“Our Jesus hath done all things well.”

We bless Thee, O Thou great Amen!||br||||sp||||sp||Jehovah’s pledge to sinful men,||br||Confirming all His word!||br||||sp||||sp||Doubtful no promises remain,||br||||sp||||sp||For all are Yea, and all Amen,||br||In Thee, the faithful Lord,

How great the grace of God to bless||br||||sp||||sp||By Thee, the Lord, our righteousness!||br||By Thee, we say again:||br||||sp||||sp||For to us all things thus are sure,||br||||sp||||sp||Through life, in death, and evermore,||br||By Thee, the great Amen.

O faithful Witness of our God,||br||||sp||||sp||Who cam’st by water and by blood!||br||In Thee (the holy One)||br||||sp||||sp||God’s record doth forever stand,||br||||sp||||sp||Of life eternal, from His hand,||br||To all in Thee the Son.

Gladly His promises we hear,||br||||sp||||sp||For God’s “Amen” dispels all fear,||br||His faithfulness it proves;||br||||sp||||sp||And while such grace from God is shown,||br||||sp||||sp||To His Amen we add our own||br||For our Amen He loves.
Come, let us join our cheerful songs,||br||And thus approach the throne:||br||||sp||||sp||Had we ten thousand thousand tongues,||br||Our theme of joy’s but one:
“Worthy the Lamb that’s gone on high||br||To be exalted thus;”||br||||sp||||sp||“Worthy the Lamb that died,” we cry,||br||“For He was slain for us.”
Jesus is worthy to receive||br||Honor and power divine:||br||||sp||||sp||And blessings more than we can give||br||Be, Lord, forever Thine.
Soon shall the saints, exalted high,||br||A glorious anthem raise;||br||||sp||||sp||And all that dwell beneath the sky||br||Speak forth Thine endless praise.
Redeemed creation join in one,||br||T’ adore the sacred name||br||||sp||||sp||Of Him that sits upon the throne,||br||And to exalt the Lamb.
We’ll sing of the Shepherd that died,||br||||sp||||sp||That died for the sake of the flock;||br||||sp||||sp||His love to the utmost was tried,||br||||sp||||sp||But firmly endured as a rock.
When blood from a victim must flow,||br||||sp||||sp||This Shepherd by pity was led||br||||sp||||sp||To stand between us and the foe,||br||||sp||||sp||And willingly died in our stead.
Our song, then, forever shall be||br||||sp||||sp||Of the Shepherd who gave Himself thus;||br||||sp||||sp||No subject’s so glorious as He,||br||||sp||||sp||No theme so affecting to us.
Of Him and His love will we sing,||br||||sp||||sp||His praises our tongues shall employ||br||||sp||||sp||Till heavenly anthems we bring||br||||sp||||sp||In yonder bright regions of joy.

“Abba,” Father—thus we call Thee,||br||(Hallowed name!) from day to day;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis Thy children’s right to know Thee,||br||None but children “Abba” say.||br||||sp||||sp||This high honor we inherit,||br||Thy free gift, through Jesus’ blood;||br||||sp||||sp||God the Spirit, with our spirit,||br||Witnesseth we’re sons of God.

Abba’s purpose gave us being||br||When in Christ, in that vast plan,||br||||sp||||sp||Abba chose the saints in Jesus||br||Long before the world began;||br||||sp||||sp||O what love the Father bore us!||br||O how precious in His sight!||br||||sp||||sp||When He gave the church to Jesus!||br||Jesus, His whole soul’s delight!

Though our nature’s fall in Adam||br||Seemed to shut us out from God,||br||||sp||||sp||Thus it was His counsel brought us||br||Nearer still, through Jesus’ blood;||br||||sp||||sp||For in Him we found redemption,||br||Grace and glory in the Son;||br||||sp||||sp||Oh the height and depth of mercy!||br||“Christ and we, through grace, are one.”

Glory, glory everlasting||br||Be to Him who bore the cross.||br||||sp||||sp||Who redeemed our souls by tasting||br||Death, the death deserved by us!||br||||sp||||sp||Spread His glory||br||Who redeemed His people thus.

His is love, ’tis love unbounded,||br||Without measure, without end;||br||||sp||||sp||Human thought is here confounded;||br||’Tis too vast to comprehend:||br||||sp||||sp||Praise the Saviour!||br||Magnify the sinner’s Friend.

While we tell the wondrous story||br||Of the Saviour’s cross and shame,||br||||sp||||sp||Sing we, “Everlasting glory||br||Be to God and to the Lamb.”||br||||sp||||sp||Hallelujah!||br||Give ye glory to His name.
O Lord! ’tis joy to look above,||br||And see Thee on the throne,||br||||sp||||sp||To search the heights and depths of love||br||Which Thou to us hast shown.
To look beyond the long dark night,||br||And hail the coming day,||br||||sp||||sp||When Thou, to all Thy saints in light,||br||Thy glories wilt display.
And, oh! ’tis joy the path to trace||br||By Thee so meekly trod;||br||||sp||||sp||Learning of Thee to walk in grace,||br||And fellowship with God!
Joy to confess Thy blessed name,||br||The virtue of Thy blood,||br||||sp||||sp||And to the wearied heart proclaim,||br||Behold the Lamb of God!

O Jesus, Lord! ’tis joy to know||br||||sp||||sp||Thy path is o’er of shame and woe,||br||For us so meekly trod:||br||||sp||||sp||All finished is Thy work of toil,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou reapest now the fruit and spoil,||br||Exalted by our God.

Thy holy head, once bound with thorns,||br||||sp||||sp||The crown of glory now adorns;||br||Thy seat, the Father’s throne;||br||||sp||||sp||O Lord! e’en now we sing Thy praise,||br||||sp||||sp||Ours the eternal song to raise—||br||Worthy the Lord alone!

As Head for us Thou sittest there,||br||||sp||||sp||Until Thy members too shall share||br||In all Thou dost receive:||br||||sp||||sp||Thy glory and Thy royal throne||br||||sp||||sp||Thy boundless love has made our own,||br||Who in Thy name believe.

We triumph in Thy triumphs, Lord;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy joys our deepest joys afford,||br||The fruit of love divine.||br||||sp||||sp||While sorrowing, suffering, toiling here,||br||||sp||||sp||How does the thought our spirits cheer,||br||The throne of glory’s Thine.
Lord of life, and King of glory!||br||Now to Thee our hearts we raise;||br||||sp||||sp||While we sing the joyful story||br||Of the triumphs of Thy grace.
Long in error’s path benighted,||br||Deeply sunk in sin’s abyss,||br||||sp||||sp||We Thy proffered mercy slighted,||br||Would not have eternal bliss.
Straying then on sin’s dark mountain,||br||Thou didst bid us cease to roam,||br||||sp||||sp||Make us see the living fountain,||br||Call with power Thy wanderers home.
Jesus, strength of our salvation,||br||None can pluck us from Thy hand;||br||||sp||||sp||In the hour of dark temptation,||br||Kept by Thee we safely stand.
Though by enemies surrounded,||br||Onward still our steps we wend;||br||||sp||||sp||All our foes shall be confounded,||br||Safely come our journey’s end.
Grace begun shall end in glory;||br||Jesus, He the victory won;||br||||sp||||sp||In His own triumphant story||br||Is the record of our own.

Jesus! That name is love,||br||Jesus, our Lord!||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus, all names above,||br||Jesus, the Lord!||br||||sp||||sp||Thou, Lord our all must be;||br||||sp||||sp||Nothing that’s good have we,||br||||sp||||sp||Nothing apart from Thee,||br||Jesus, our Lord!

As Son of man it was,||br||Jesus, the Lord!||br||||sp||||sp||Thou gav’st Thy life for us,||br||Jesus, our Lord!||br||||sp||||sp||Great was indeed Thy love,||br||||sp||||sp||All other loves above,||br||||sp||||sp||Love Thou didst dearly prove,||br||Jesus, our Lord!

Righteous alone in Thee,||br||Jesus, the Lord!||br||||sp||||sp||Thou wilt a refuge be,||br||Jesus, our Lord!||br||||sp||||sp||Whom then have we to fear,||br||||sp||||sp||What trouble, grief, or care,||br||||sp||||sp||Since Thou art ever near,||br||Jesus, our Lord!

Soon Thou wilt come again,||br||Jesus, the Lord!||br||||sp||||sp||We shall be happy then,||br||Jesus, our Lord!||br||||sp||||sp||When Thine own face we see,||br||||sp||||sp||Then shall we like Thee be,||br||||sp||||sp||Then evermore with Thee,||br||Jesus, our Lord!

O God! Thou now hast glorified||br||Thy holy, blest, eternal Son;||br||||sp||||sp||The Nazarene, the Crucified,||br||Now sits exalted on Thy throne!||br||||sp||||sp||To Him in faith we cry aloud,||br||||sp||||sp||Worthy art Thou, O Lamb of God!

Father, Thy holy name we bless,||br||Gracious and just Thy wise decree,||br||||sp||||sp||That every tongue shall soon confess||br||Jesus the Lord of all to be!||br||||sp||||sp||But, oh! Thy grace has taught us now||br||||sp||||sp||Before that Lord the knee to bow.

Him as our Lord we gladly own:||br||To Him alone we now would live,||br||||sp||||sp||Who bowed our hearts before Thy throne,||br||And gave us all that love could give.||br||||sp||||sp||Our willing voices cry aloud,||br||||sp||||sp||Worthy art Thou, O Lamb of God!
