By Thee, O God, invited,||br||We look unto the Son,||br||||sp||||sp||In whom Thy soul delighted,||br||Who all Thy will hath done;||br||||sp||||sp||And by the one chief treasure||br||Thy bosom freely gave,||br||||sp||||sp||Thine own pure love we measure,||br||Thy willing mind to save.

O God of mercy—Father!||br||The one unchanging claim,||br||||sp||||sp||The brightest hopes we gather||br||From Christ’s most precious name;||br||||sp||||sp||What always sounds so sweetly||br||In Thine unwearied ear||br||||sp||||sp||Has freed our souls completely||br||From all our sinful fear.

The trembling sinner feareth||br||That God can ne’er forget;||br||||sp||||sp||But one full payment cleareth||br||His memory of all debt.||br||||sp||||sp||When nought beside could free us,||br||Or set our souls at large,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy holy work, Lord Jesus,||br||Secured a full discharge.

No wrath God’s heart retaineth||br||To us-ward who believe;||br||||sp||||sp||No dread in ours remaineth||br||As we His love receive;||br||||sp||||sp||Returning sons He kisses,||br||And with His robe invests;||br||||sp||||sp||His perfect love dismisses||br||All terror from our breasts.

Eternal praise, our God, shall rise:||br||||sp||||sp||In mansions far beyond the skies||br||Thy name shall be adored.||br||||sp||||sp||With joyful hearts our songs we raise;||br||||sp||||sp||Our God and Father, Thee we praise,||br||While waiting for our Lord.

When ruined, guilty, and undone,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou gav’st for us Thine only Son,||br||We trust Thy truthful word.||br||||sp||||sp||Rejoicing in Thy love we sing,||br||||sp||||sp||Praise for Thy gift of gifts we bring,||br||Thy goodness we record.

We praise Thee in our pathway here,||br||||sp||||sp||Far off we were, but now brought near||br||Through Jesus Christ our Lord.||br||||sp||||sp||Fresh grace for every moment here,||br||||sp||||sp||Fresh manna o’er the desert drear||br||Thy Spirit doth afford.

When Thou shalt come, for whom we wait,||br||||sp||||sp||We then shall see and know how great||br||The gain that faith hath stored.||br||||sp||||sp||With joyful hearts our songs we raise;||br||||sp||||sp||Our God and Father, now to praise,||br||While waiting for our Lord.
Lord Jesus, ’tis our joy to think||br||||sp||||sp||Our life is so bound up with Thine,||br||||sp||||sp||That nothing can divide the link||br||||sp||||sp||Secured and fixed by love divine.

By faith we see Thee, Lord, enthroned||br||||sp||||sp||At God’s right hand of power on high;||br||||sp||||sp||And Thy redeemèd ones, we’re owned||br||||sp||||sp||As one with Thee, in Thee brought nigh.

The holiest we enter||br||In perfect peace with God,||br||||sp||||sp||Through whom we found our center,||br||In Jesus and His blood:||br||||sp||||sp||Though great may be our dullness||br||In thought, and word, and deed,||br||||sp||||sp||We glory in the fullness||br||Of Him that meets our need.

Much incense is ascending||br||Before th’ eternal throne;||br||||sp||||sp||God graciously is bending||br||To hear each feeble groan;||br||||sp||||sp||To all our prayers and praises||br||Christ adds His sweet perfume,||br||||sp||||sp||And love the censer raises,||br||These odors to consume.

O God, we come with singing,||br||Because Thy great High Priest||br||||sp||||sp||Our names to Thee is bringing,||br||Nor e’er forgets the least;||br||||sp||||sp||For us He wears the mitre,||br||Where “holiness” shines bright,||br||||sp||||sp||For us His robes are whiter||br||Than heaven’s unsullied light.

Head of the church, Thy body,||br||||sp||||sp||O Christ, the great Salvation!||br||||sp||||sp||Sweet to the saints||br||||sp||||sp||It is to think||br||||sp||||sp||Of all Thine exaltation!||br||||sp||||sp||All power’s to Thee committed.||br||||sp||||sp||All power on earth, in heaven;||br||||sp||||sp||To Thee a name||br||||sp||||sp||Of widest fame||br||||sp||||sp||Above all glory’s given.

With Thee believers raised,||br||||sp||||sp||In Thee in high are seated;||br||||sp||||sp||All guilty once,||br||||sp||||sp||But cleared by Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Redemption-toil’s completed.||br||||sp||||sp||And when Thou, Lord and Saviour,||br||||sp||||sp||Shalt come again in glory,||br||||sp||||sp||There by Thy side,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy spotless bride||br||||sp||||sp||Shall crown the wondrous story.

At length—the final kingdom,||br||||sp||||sp||No bound, no end possessing:||br||||sp||||sp||When heaven and earth—||br||||sp||||sp||God all in all||br||||sp||||sp||Shall fill with largest blessing.||br||||sp||||sp||All root of evil banished,||br||||sp||||sp||No breath of sin to wither,||br||||sp||||sp||On earth—on high—||br||||sp||||sp||Naught else but joy,||br||||sp||||sp||And blissful peace forever!
O render thanks to God above,||br||||sp||||sp||The fountain of eternal love;||br||||sp||||sp||Whose mercy firm through ages past||br||||sp||||sp||Hath stood, and doth forever last.

The Father’s boundless love we sing,||br||||sp||||sp||The fountain whence our blessings spring;||br||||sp||||sp||How great the depth, how high it flows,||br||||sp||||sp||No saint can tell, no angel knows.

Its length and breadth no eye can trace,||br||||sp||||sp||No thought explore the bounds of grace;||br||||sp||||sp||The love that saved our souls from hell||br||||sp||||sp||Transcends the creature’s power to tell.
Not to ourselves we owe||br||That we, O God, are Thine;||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus, the Lord, our night broke through||br||And gave us light divine.
The Father’s grace and love,||br||This blessed mercy gave,||br||||sp||||sp||And Jesus left the throne above,||br||His wandering sheep to save.
No more the heirs of wrath—||br||Thy sovereign love we see;||br||||sp||||sp||And, Father, in confiding faith,||br||We cast our souls on Thee.
Our hearts look up to see||br||The glory Thou hast given,||br||||sp||||sp||And dwell e’en now where we shall be||br||With Christ, Thine heirs, in heaven.
With the adopted band,||br||Soon shall we see Thee there:||br||||sp||||sp||With them and Him in glory stand,||br||And all His honors share.
Awake, each saint, in joyful lays,||br||||sp||||sp||To sing the great Redeemer’s praise;||br||||sp||||sp||He justly claims a song from thee:||br||||sp||||sp||His loving-kindness, oh how free!
He saw us ruined in the fall,||br||||sp||||sp||Yet loved us notwithstanding all;||br||||sp||||sp||He saved us from our lost estate:||br||||sp||||sp||His loving-kindness, oh how great!
Though numerous hosts of mighty foes,||br||||sp||||sp||Though earth and hell our way oppose;||br||||sp||||sp||He safely leads His saints along:||br||||sp||||sp||His loving-kindness, oh how strong!
When trouble, like a gloomy cloud,||br||||sp||||sp||Has gathered thick, and thundered loud;||br||||sp||||sp||He with His church has always stood:||br||||sp||||sp||His loving-kindness, oh how good!
Soon shall we mount and soar away||br||||sp||||sp||To the bright realms of endless day,||br||||sp||||sp||And sing with rapture and surprise||br||||sp||||sp||His loving-kindness in the skies.

O Head! once full of bruises,||br||So full of pain and scorn,||br||||sp||||sp||’Mid other sore abuses||br||Mocked with a crown of thorn;||br||||sp||||sp||O Head! e’en now surrounded||br||With brightest majesty,||br||||sp||||sp||In death once bowed and wounded||br||On the accursèd tree:

Thou Countenance transcendent!||br||Thou life-creating Sun!||br||||sp||||sp||To worlds on Thee dependent—||br||Yet bruised and spit upon:||br||||sp||||sp||O Lord! what Thee tormented||br||Was our sin’s heavy load,||br||||sp||||sp||We had the debt augmented||br||Which Thou didst pay in blood.

We give Thee thanks unfeignèd,||br||O Saviour! Friend in need,||br||||sp||||sp||For what Thy soul sustainèd||br||When Thou for us didst bleed;||br||||sp||||sp||Grant us to lean unshaken||br||Upon Thy faithfulness;||br||||sp||||sp||Until to glory taken,||br||We see Thee face to face.

O Thou who didst Thy glory leave,||br||||sp||||sp||Apostate sinners to retrieve||br||From nature’s deadly fall!||br||||sp||||sp||Thou, Thou hast bought us with a price,||br||||sp||||sp||Our sins against us ne’er can rise,||br||For Thou hast borne them all.

See Him for our transgressions given;||br||||sp||||sp||See the blest Lamb of God from heaven,||br||For us, His foes, expire;||br||||sp||||sp||Rejoice! rejoice! the tidings hear!||br||||sp||||sp||He bore, that we might never bear,||br||Th’ Almighty’s righteous ire.

Ye saints, “the Man of sorrows” bless,||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord, for your unrighteousness||br||Deputed to atone;||br||||sp||||sp||Praise, till with all the ransomed throng||br||||sp||||sp||Ye sing the never-ending song,||br||And sit upon His throne!
Glory unto Jesus be!||br||||sp||||sp||From the curse who set us free;||br||||sp||||sp||All our guilt on Him was laid,||br||||sp||||sp||He the ransom fully paid.
All that blessed work is done,||br||||sp||||sp||God’s well-pleasèd with His Son;||br||||sp||||sp||He has raised Him from the dead,||br||||sp||||sp||Set Him over all as Head.
This we know, and cease to mourn,||br||||sp||||sp||Patient wait His sure return:||br||||sp||||sp||For His saints with Him shall reign—||br||||sp||||sp||“Come, Lord Jesus, come! Amen!”
Jesus, Thou glorious Priest and King!||br||||sp||||sp||Accept the tribute that we bring;||br||||sp||||sp||Accept the feeble song of praise||br||||sp||||sp||Which here on earth Thy people raise.
May every minute as it flies||br||||sp||||sp||Augment our love, increase our joys,||br||||sp||||sp||Till we are brought to sing Thy name||br||||sp||||sp||At the glad supper of the Lamb.

And soon the months will roll away,||br||||sp||||sp||And quickly come the nuptial day,||br||||sp||||sp||When Thou, the Lamb, shalt take Thy throne,||br||||sp||||sp||And fully there Thy church shalt own.

The gladness of that happy day,||br||||sp||||sp||In this sad world’s our strength and stay;||br||||sp||||sp||Then let not faith forsake its hold,||br||||sp||||sp||Nor comfort sink, nor love grow cold.
Jesus, spotless Lamb of God,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou hast bought us with Thy blood;||br||||sp||||sp||We are Thine, and Thine alone;||br||||sp||||sp||This we gladly, fully own.
Help us to confess Thy name,||br||||sp||||sp||Bear with joy Thy cross and shame;||br||||sp||||sp||Only seek to follow Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Though reproach our portion be.
When we are to glory come,||br||||sp||||sp||And have reached our heavenly home,||br||||sp||||sp||Louder then each lip shall own,||br||||sp||||sp||We are Thine, and Thine alone.
Jesus, our Lord, Thou Morning Star,||br||How well we know Thy name,||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus, the Lord, the Crucified,||br||In glory still the same.
Jesus, the One who left the throne||br||To save a ruined race,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy love and lowliness still shine||br||Upon that glorious face.
Jesus, the One who trod the earth,||br||The lowly, subject One,||br||||sp||||sp||Obedience unto death was Thine,||br||God’s well-belovèd Son!
Jesus! what memories thrill our hearts||br||Of Thy blest footprints here,||br||||sp||||sp||While now to heaven our eyes we turn||br||And gaze upon Thee there!
Jesus, our Saviour, quickly come!||br||That we may with Thee be;||br||||sp||||sp||Heaven’s morning breaks and glory dawns,||br||When Thy blest face we see.
Behold the Lamb with glory crowned!||br||To Him all power be given;||br||||sp||||sp||No place too high for Him is found,||br||No place too high in heaven.
He fills the throne—the throne above,||br||He fills it without wrong;||br||||sp||||sp||The object of His Father’s love,||br||Theme of the ransomed’s song.
Though high yet He accepts the praise||br||His people offer here;||br||||sp||||sp||The faintest, feeblest cry they raise||br||Will reach the Saviour’s ear.
This song be ours, and this alone,||br||To celebrate the name||br||||sp||||sp||Of Him that sits upon the throne,||br||And to exalt the Lamb.
To Him whom men despise and slight,||br||To Him be glory given;||br||||sp||||sp||The crown is His, and His by right||br||The highest place in heaven.
Endless praises to the Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||Ever be His name adored!||br||||sp||||sp||Hallelujah!||br||||sp||||sp||He is worthy—praise His name.
We adore Him, sound His fame,||br||||sp||||sp||Us He saved from endless shame:||br||||sp||||sp||Hallelujah!||br||||sp||||sp||Glory to the Priest and King.

How blest a home! the Father’s house!||br||There love divine doth rest;||br||||sp||||sp||What else could satisfy the hearts||br||Of those in Jesus blest?||br||||sp||||sp||His home made ours—His Father’s love||br||Our heart’s full portion given,||br||||sp||||sp||The portion of the firstborn Son,||br||The full delight of heaven.

Oh what a home! The Son who knows,||br||He only—all His love;||br||||sp||||sp||And brings us as His well beloved||br||To that bright rest above,||br||||sp||||sp||Dwells in His bosom—knoweth all||br||That in that bosom lies,||br||||sp||||sp||And came to earth to make it known,||br||That we might share His joys.

Oh what a home! there fullest love||br||Flows through its courts of light;||br||||sp||||sp||The Son’s divine affections flow||br||Throughout its depth and height.||br||||sp||||sp||And full response the Father gives,||br||To fill with joy the heart—||br||||sp||||sp||No cloud is there to dim the scene||br||Or shadow to impart.

Oh what a home! But such His love||br||That He must bring us there,||br||||sp||||sp||To fill that home, to be with Him,||br||And all His glory share.||br||||sp||||sp||The Father’s house, the Father’s heart,||br||All that the Son is given||br||||sp||||sp||Made ours—the objects of His love,||br||And He, our joy in heaven.
See mercy, mercy from on high,||br||||sp||||sp||Descend to rebels doomed to die;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis mercy free, which knows no bound;||br||||sp||||sp||How sweet, how pleasant is the sound!
Soon as the reign of sin began,||br||||sp||||sp||The light of mercy dawned on man,||br||||sp||||sp||When God announced the blessed news,||br||||sp||||sp||“The woman’s seed thy head shall bruise.”
Brightly it beamed on men forlorn,||br||||sp||||sp||When Christ, the holy child was born;||br||||sp||||sp||And brighter still in splendor shone||br||||sp||||sp||When Jesus, dying, cried, ’Tis done!
Complete in power when He arose,||br||||sp||||sp||And burst the bands of all His foes;||br||||sp||||sp||Then captive led captivity,||br||||sp||||sp||And took for us His seat in high.
Till we around Him there shall throng,||br||||sp||||sp||This mercy shall be still our song;||br||||sp||||sp||For God shall every scheme confound||br||||sp||||sp||Of all that seek its course to bound!
Awake each soul! awake each tongue||br||The subject is divine;||br||||sp||||sp||The Saviour’s love demands our song;||br||Let all His people join.
This Saviour is the mighty God,||br||The God of heaven above;||br||||sp||||sp||Revealed in flesh, He shed His blood,||br||Blest proof of endless love.
Jesus, Thy love exceeds our thought;||br||But this at least we see,||br||||sp||||sp||The soul that knows Thy love is taught||br||To value naught but Thee.
And though Thy love be faintly seen,||br||What’s seen demands our praise;||br||||sp||||sp||Without it, Lord, we still had been||br||Ensnared in Satan’s ways.

With Christ our theme begins,||br||The Lord of truth and love;||br||||sp||||sp||When He had purged our sins,||br||He took His seat above.||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts are glad; we raise the voice;||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord has made us to rejoice.

His power can never fail,||br||He’ll rule o’er earth, in heaven;||br||||sp||||sp||The keys of death and hell||br||To Him alone are given.||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts are glad; we raise the voice;||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord has made us to rejoice.

And sweet that blessed hope:||br||Jesus, the Lord, shall come,||br||||sp||||sp||And take His brethren up||br||E’en to His Father’s home.||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts are glad; we raise the voice;||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord has made us to rejoice.
Praise we to the Father give,||br||||sp||||sp||God in whom we move and live;||br||||sp||||sp||Children’s praise He loves to hear,||br||||sp||||sp||Children’s songs delight His ear.
Praise we to the Firstborn bring,||br||||sp||||sp||Christ the Prophet, Priest, and King;||br||||sp||||sp||Glad we raise our sweetest strain||br||||sp||||sp||To the Lamb that once was slain!
Praises for the Holy Ghost||br||||sp||||sp||Sent from heaven at Pentecost!||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis through Him alone we live,||br||||sp||||sp||And the precious truth receive.
Blest our portion thus to be||br||||sp||||sp||Glorying in the Trinity;||br||||sp||||sp||For the gospel from above,||br||||sp||||sp||For the word that “God is love.”
The person of the Christ,||br||Enfolding every grace,||br||||sp||||sp||Once slain, but now alive again,||br||In heaven demands our praise.
Gladly of Him we sing,||br||Since we with Him are dead;||br||||sp||||sp||Our life is hid with Christ in God,||br||In Christ the church’s Head.
The heavens are opened now!||br||Sound it through earth abroad;||br||||sp||||sp||And we, by faith, in heaven behold||br||Jesus the Christ, our Lord.
Let saints on earth their anthems raise,||br||Who taste the Saviour’s grace;||br||||sp||||sp||Sing, till in heaven they tune His praise,||br||And hail Him “Prince of Peace.”
Praise Him who laid His glory by||br||For man’s apostate race;||br||||sp||||sp||Praise Him who stooped to bleed and die,||br||And hail Him “Prince of Peace.”
We soon shall reach the blissful shore,||br||And view His glorious face;||br||||sp||||sp||His name forever to adore,||br||And hail Him “Prince of Peace.”

Lord of glory, we adore Thee!||br||Christ of God, ascended high!||br||||sp||||sp||Heart and soul we bow before Thee,||br||Glorious now beyond the sky:||br||||sp||||sp||Thee we worship,||br||||sp||||sp||Thee we praise—||br||||sp||||sp||Excellent in all Thy ways.

Anointed King, with glory crownèd,||br||Rightful heir and Lord of all!||br||||sp||||sp||Once rejected, scorned, disownèd,||br||E’en by those Thou cam’st to call:||br||||sp||||sp||Thee we honor,||br||||sp||||sp||Thee adore—||br||||sp||||sp||Glorious now and evermore.

Lord of life! to death once subject;||br||Blesser, yet a curse once made;||br||||sp||||sp||Of Thy Father’s heart the object,||br||Yet in depths of anguish laid:||br||||sp||||sp||Thee we gaze on,||br||||sp||||sp||Thee recall—||br||||sp||||sp||Bearing here our sorrows all.

Royal robes shall soon invest Thee,||br||Royal splendors crown Thy brow;||br||||sp||||sp||Christ of God, our souls confess Thee||br||King and Sovereign even now!||br||||sp||||sp||Thee we reverence,||br||||sp||||sp||Thee obey—||br||||sp||||sp||Own Thee Lord and Christ alway.

We joy in our God, and we sing of that love,||br||||sp||||sp||So sovereign and free which did His heart move!||br||||sp||||sp||When lost our condition, all ruined, undone,||br||||sp||||sp||He saw with compassion, and spared not His Son!

His Son, His delight, His loved One, He gave||br||||sp||||sp||The curse to endure—by suffering to save:||br||||sp||||sp||Sure love so amazing, unmeasured, untold,||br||||sp||||sp||Since Him it hath given, no good will withhold!

We praise, then our God; how rich is His grace!||br||||sp||||sp||We were far from Him once—estranged from His face,||br||||sp||||sp||By blood we are purchased, are cleansed and made nigh,||br||||sp||||sp||And blest in His presence, in Jesus, on high!
The veil is rent:—our souls draw near||br||Unto a throne of grace;||br||||sp||||sp||The merits of the Lord appear,||br||They fill the holy place.
His precious blood has spoken there,||br||Before and on the throne:||br||||sp||||sp||And His own wounds in heaven declare,||br||The atoning work is done.
’Tis finished!—here our souls have rest,||br||His work can never fail:||br||||sp||||sp||By Him, our Sacrifice and Priest,||br||We pass within the veil.
Within the holiest of all,||br||Cleansed by His precious blood,||br||||sp||||sp||Before the throne we prostrate fall,||br||And worship Thee, O God!
Boldly the heart and voice we raise,||br||His blood, His name, our plea;||br||||sp||||sp||Assured our prayers and songs of praise||br||Ascend, by Christ, to Thee.

O Christ, what burdens bowed Thy head!||br||Our load was laid on Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou stoodest in the sinner’s stead—||br||To bear all ill for me.||br||||sp||||sp||A victim led, Thy blood was shed;||br||Now there’s no load for me.

Death and the curse were in our cup—||br||O Christ, ’twas full for Thee!||br||||sp||||sp||But Thou hast drained the last dark drop,||br||’Tis empty now for me.||br||||sp||||sp||That bitter cup—love drank it up;||br||Left but the love for me.

Jehovah lifted up His rod—||br||O Christ, it fell on Thee!||br||||sp||||sp||Thou wast forsaken of Thy God;||br||No distance now for me.||br||||sp||||sp||Thy blood beneath that rod has flowed:||br||Thy bruising healeth me.

The tempest’s awful voice was heard,||br||O Christ, it broke on Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy open bosom was my ward;||br||It bore the storm for me.||br||||sp||||sp||Thy form was scarred, Thy visage marred;||br||Now cloudless peace for me.

For me, Lord Jesus, Thou hast died,||br||And I have died in Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou’rt risen: my bands are all untied;||br||And now Thou liv’st in me.||br||||sp||||sp||The Father’s face of radiant grace||br||Shines now in light on me.

Soft the voice of mercy sounded,||br||Sweet as music to the ear.||br||||sp||||sp||||i||“Grace abounds where sin abounded;”||br||||/i||This the word that soothed our fear.||br||||sp||||sp||Grace, the sweetest sound we know,||br||||sp||||sp||Grace to sinners here below.

Grace, we sing, God’s grace through Jesus;||br||Grace, the spring of peace to man;||br||||sp||||sp||Grace, that from each sorrow frees us;||br||Grace, too high for thought to scan;||br||||sp||||sp||Grace, the theme of God’s own love;||br||||sp||||sp||Grace, the theme, all themes above.
This world is a wilderness wide!||br||We have nothing to seek or to choose;||br||||sp||||sp||We’ve no thought in the waste to abide;||br||We’ve naught to regret nor to lose.
The Lord is Himself gone before;||br||He has marked out the path that we tread;||br||||sp||||sp||It’s as sure as the love we adore,||br||We have nothing to fear nor to dread.
There is but that one in the waste,||br||Which His footsteps have marked as His own;||br||||sp||||sp||And we follow in diligent haste||br||To the seats where He’s put on His crown.
For the path where our Saviour is gone||br||Has led up to our Father and God,||br||||sp||||sp||To the place where He’s now on the throne,||br||And His strength shall be ours on the road.
And with Him shall our rest be on high,||br||When in holiness bright we sit down,||br||||sp||||sp||In the joy of His love ever nigh,||br||In the peace that His presence shall crown.
’Tis the treasure we’ve found in His love||br||That has made us now pilgrims below,||br||||sp||||sp||And ’tis there, when we reach Him above,||br||As we’re known, all His fullness we’ll know.
And Saviour! ’tis Thee from on high||br||We await till the time Thou shalt come,||br||||sp||||sp||To take those Thou hast led by Thine eye||br||To Thyself in Thy heavenly home.
Till then ’tis the path Thou hast trod,||br||Our delight and our comfort shall be;||br||||sp||||sp||We’re content with Thy staff and Thy rod,||br||Till with Thee all Thy glory we see.

O Lord! our hearts are waiting,||br||Th’ archangel’s heaven-sent cry,||br||||sp||||sp||Which wakes the saints now sleeping,||br||And to Thee brings them nigh.||br||||sp||||sp||When we, with them ascending,||br||Shall meet Thee in the air,||br||||sp||||sp||To gaze upon Thy glory,||br||And all Thy likeness bear.

O hour! for which in patience||br||Thou’st waited through the night,||br||||sp||||sp||Whilst we Thy saints were gathered,||br||And brought into the light;||br||||sp||||sp||Then, then, the church completed,||br||God makes no more delay;||br||||sp||||sp||O Lord, with shouts of triumph,||br||We pass into the day.

O hour of richest blessing!||br||When brought to Thee so nigh,||br||||sp||||sp||To be Thy joy forever,||br||We share Thy throne on high;||br||||sp||||sp||To rest in all that brightness,||br||And ever there abide;||br||||sp||||sp||To find Thy heart delighting||br||In us, Thy ransomed bride.

O blessed, coming Saviour!||br||Speak, then, the joyous word,||br||||sp||||sp||To which our hearts responding,||br||“Forever with the Lord.”||br||||sp||||sp||Forever with Thee, Saviour—||br||Forevermore shall be—||br||||sp||||sp||In deepest, fullest blessing,||br||Forever one with Thee.

In deep, eternal counsel,||br||Before the world was made,||br||||sp||||sp||Before its deep foundations||br||On nothingness were laid;||br||||sp||||sp||God purposed us for blessing,||br||And chose us in His Son,||br||||sp||||sp||To Him to be conformèd,||br||When here our course was run.

In present, blest acceptance||br||In Him who came to die;||br||||sp||||sp||In Him who now is seated||br||At Thy right hand in high;||br||||sp||||sp||In grace, which is unchanging,||br||We stand from day to day,||br||||sp||||sp||And prove the boundless mercies||br||Which strew our pilgrim way.

And when the day of glory||br||Shall burst upon this scene,||br||||sp||||sp||Dispelling all the darkness||br||Which deepening still had been;||br||||sp||||sp||Oh, then He’ll come in brightness,||br||Whom every eye shall see,||br||||sp||||sp||Arrayed in power and glory,||br||And we shall with Him be.

For He who left His glory,||br||To die upon the tree,||br||||sp||||sp||Will soon complete the story||br||And come again, and we||br||||sp||||sp||Conformèd to His image||br||As known, be brought to know,||br||||sp||||sp||And with increasing fervor,||br||Our ceaseless praises flow.

“Glory to God on high!||br||||sp||||sp||Peace upon earth and joy,||br||||sp||||sp||Good will to man.”||br||||sp||||sp||We who God’s blessing prove||br||||sp||||sp||His name all names above,||br||||sp||||sp||Sing now the Saviour’s love,||br||||sp||||sp||Too vast to scan.

Mercy and truth unite,||br||||sp||||sp||Oh! ’tis a wondrous sight,||br||||sp||||sp||All sights above!||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus the curse sustains!||br||||sp||||sp||Guilt’s bitter cup He drains!||br||||sp||||sp||Nothing for us remains—||br||||sp||||sp||Nothing but love.

Love that no tongue can teach,||br||||sp||||sp||Love that no thought can reach,||br||||sp||||sp||No love like His.||br||||sp||||sp||God is its blessed source,||br||||sp||||sp||Death ne’er can stop its course,||br||||sp||||sp||Nothing can stay its force;||br||||sp||||sp||Matchless it is.

Blest in this love, we sing;||br||||sp||||sp||To God our praises bring;||br||||sp||||sp||All sins forgiven.||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus, our Lord, to Thee||br||||sp||||sp||Honor and majesty,||br||||sp||||sp||Now and forever be,||br||||sp||||sp||Here and in heaven.
King of glory, set on high,||br||||sp||||sp||Girt with strength and majesty,||br||||sp||||sp||We Thy holy name confess;||br||||sp||||sp||Thee with adoration bless.
Jesus, mighty Son of God!||br||||sp||||sp||Wondrous gift on man bestowed;||br||||sp||||sp||Many crowns are on Thy head,||br||||sp||||sp||Glorious Firstborn from the dead.
Gladly, Lord, we bow the knee,||br||||sp||||sp||By the Father’s just decree,||br||||sp||||sp||To His own anointed One;||br||||sp||||sp||To His well-belovèd Son.
Salvation! O the joyful sound!||br||What pleasure to our ears!||br||||sp||||sp||A sovereign balm for every wound,||br||A cordial for our fears.
Glory, honor, praise and power,||br||||sp||||sp||Be unto the Lamb forever;||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus Christ is our Redeemer,||br||||sp||||sp||Hallelujah, praise ye the Lord.
Salvation! O ascended Lamb,||br||To Thee the praise belongs!||br||||sp||||sp||Salvation shall inspire our hearts,||br||And dwell upon our tongues.

To God who gave His Son,||br||To save us from our sin;||br||||sp||||sp||To Christ Himself who died,||br||And made His people clean:||br||||sp||||sp||Eternal thanks and praise be given||br||||sp||||sp||By saints on earth, the heirs of heaven.
We bless our Saviour’s name,||br||Our sins are all forgiven;||br||||sp||||sp||To suffer once to earth He came:||br||He now is crowned in heaven.
Lord let us ne’er forget||br||Thy rich, Thy precious love;||br||||sp||||sp||Our theme of joy and wonder here,||br||Our endless song above.
O let Thy love constrain||br||Our souls to cleave to Thee!||br||||sp||||sp||And ever in our hearts remain||br||That word, ||i||Remember Me.||/i||

To Him that loved us, gave Himself,||br||And died to do us good,||br||||sp||||sp||Has washed us from our scarlet sins||br||In His most precious blood;||br||||sp||||sp||Who made us kings and priests to God||br||His Father infinite:||br||||sp||||sp||To Him eternal glory be,||br||And everlasting might!

Through Him to God—the God most high—||br||Praise for all grace be given;||br||||sp||||sp||Whose gifts through all eternity||br||We’ll gladly sing in heaven;||br||||sp||||sp||His Christ has loved us, given Himself,||br||And died to do us good,||br||||sp||||sp||Has washed us from our scarlet sins||br||In His own precious blood.

hymn.author: J.N.D., suggested by Miss C.L. Smith

stanza.text: Oh for the robe of whiteness,||br||To walk with Christ in light,||br||||sp||||sp||Oh for the glorious brightness||br||Of day without a night.
We would a name of favor,||br||Graved on the stone of white,||br||||sp||||sp||We’d taste that manna’s flavor,||br||Reserved for heaven’s delight.
’Tis sweet, the thought of rising||br||The risen Lord to meet;||br||||sp||||sp||Or changed, ourselves surprising,||br||Like Him for whom we wait.
What joy supreme in seeing||br||The Saviour face to face,||br||||sp||||sp||The peaceful joy of being||br||Forever in that place!
Jesus, Thou King of glory,||br||We soon shall dwell with Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||And sing Thy love’s bright story,||br||When we Thy glory see.
E’en now our souls would enter||br||The holiest on high,||br||||sp||||sp||That all our love might center||br||On Thee who cam’st to die.
At God’s right hand in glory||br||Thou sitt’st, Thy work complete,||br||||sp||||sp||Till perfected the story||br||That gives us too our seat.
Then o’er the wide creation||br||Thy power will stretch its arm;||br||||sp||||sp||Secure from all temptation,||br||Free from all human harm.

Lord Jesus! we remember||br||The travail of Thy soul,||br||||sp||||sp||When, through Thy love’s deep pity,||br||The waves did o’er Thee roll;||br||||sp||||sp||Baptized in death’s dark waters,||br||For us Thy blood was shed;||br||||sp||||sp||For us Thou (Lord of glory)||br||Wast numbered with the dead.

O Lord! Thou now art risen,||br||Thy travail all is o’er;||br||||sp||||sp||For sin Thou once hast suffered—||br||Thou liv’st to die no more;||br||||sp||||sp||Sin, death, and hell are vanquished||br||By Thee, the church’s Head;||br||||sp||||sp||And lo! we share thy triumphs,||br||Thou Firstborn from the dead.

Unto Thy death baptizèd,||br||We own with Thee we died:||br||||sp||||sp||With Thee, our Life, we’re risen,||br||And shall be glorified.||br||||sp||||sp||From sin, the world, and Satan,||br||We’re ransomed by Thy blood,||br||||sp||||sp||And here would walk as strangers,||br||Alive with Thee to God.

Thou art the everlasting Word,||br||The Father’s only Son;||br||||sp||||sp||God manifest, God seen and heard,||br||The heaven’s belovèd One;||br||||sp||||sp||Worthy, O Lamb of God, art Thou||br||||sp||||sp||That every knee to Thee should bow.

In Thee most perfectly expressed,||br||The Father’s self doth shine;||br||||sp||||sp||Fullness of Godhead, too: the Blest,||br||Eternally divine.||br||||sp||||sp||Worthy, O Lamb of God, art Thou||br||||sp||||sp||That every knee to Thee should bow.

Image of th’ infinite Unseen,||br||Whose being none can know;||br||||sp||||sp||Brightness of light no eye hath seen,||br||God’s love revealed below.||br||||sp||||sp||Worthy, O Lamb of God, art Thou||br||||sp||||sp||That every knee to Thee should bow.

The higher mysteries of Thy fame||br||The creature’s grasp transcend;||br||||sp||||sp||The Father only Thy blest name||br||Of Son can comprehend.||br||||sp||||sp||Worthy, O Lamb of God, art Thou||br||||sp||||sp||That every knee to Thee should bow.

Yet loving Thee, on whom His love||br||Ineffable doth rest,||br||||sp||||sp||The worshippers, O Lord, above,||br||As one with Thee, are blest:||br||||sp||||sp||Worthy, O Lamb of God, art Thou||br||||sp||||sp||That every knee to Thee should bow.

Of the vast universe of bliss,||br||The center Thou, and Sun;||br||||sp||||sp||Th’ eternal theme of praise is this,||br||To heaven’s belovèd One:||br||||sp||||sp||Worthy, O Lamb of God, art Thou||br||||sp||||sp||That every knee to Thee should bow.
Lord Jesus! when we think of Thee,||br||Of all Thy love and grace,||br||||sp||||sp||Our spirits long and fain would see||br||Thy beauty face to face.
And though the wilderness we tread,||br||A barren, thirsty ground,||br||||sp||||sp||With thorns and briers overspread,||br||Where foes and snares abound;
Yet in Thy love such depths we see,||br||Our souls o’erflow with praise—||br||||sp||||sp||Content ourselves, while, Lord, to Thee||br||A joyful song we raise.
Our Lord, our Life, our Rest, our Shield,||br||Our Rock, our Food, our Light;||br||||sp||||sp||Each thought of Thee doth constant yield||br||Unchanging, fresh delight.
Blest Saviour, keep our spirits stayed,||br||Hard following after Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Till we, in robes of white arrayed,||br||Thy face in glory see.

Thy name we love, Lord Jesus;||br||||sp||||sp||And lowly bow before Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||And while we live, to Thee we give||br||||sp||||sp||All blessing, worship, glory;||br||We sing aloud Thy praises,||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts and voices blending,||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis Thou alone we worthy own,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy beauty’s all transcending.

Thy name we love, Lord Jesus;||br||||sp||||sp||It tells God’s love unbounded||br||||sp||||sp||To ruined man ere time began,||br||||sp||||sp||Or heaven and earth were founded;||br||Thine is a love eternal,||br||||sp||||sp||That found in us its pleasure,||br||||sp||||sp||That brought Thee low to bear our woe,||br||||sp||||sp||And make us Thine own treasure.

Thy name we love, Lord Jesus;||br||||sp||||sp||It tells Thy birth so lowly,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy patience, grace, Thy gentleness,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy lonely path, so holy;||br||Thou wast the “Man of sorrows”;||br||||sp||||sp||Our grief, too, Thou didst bear it;||br||||sp||||sp||Our bitter cup Thou drankest up;||br||||sp||||sp||The thorny crown—didst wear it.

Thy name we love, Lord Jesus;||br||||sp||||sp||God’s Lamb—Thou wast ordainèd||br||||sp||||sp||To bear our sins (Thyself all clean),||br||||sp||||sp||And hast our guilt sustainèd:||br||We see Thee crowned in glory,||br||||sp||||sp||Above the heavens now seated,||br||||sp||||sp||The victory won, Thy work well done,||br||||sp||||sp||Our righteousness completed.
Whom have we, Lord, but Thee,||br||Soul-thirst to satisfy?||br||||sp||||sp||Exhaustless spring! the waters free!||br||All other streams are dry.
Our hearts by Thee are set||br||On brighter things above;||br||||sp||||sp||Strange that we ever should forget||br||Thine own most faithful love.
Yet oft we credit not||br||He freely gives as God,||br||||sp||||sp||Though well we know our happy lot||br||In trusting to His blood.
None like the ransomed host||br||That precious blood have known;||br||||sp||||sp||Redemption gives faith’s holy boast||br||To draw so near the throne.
Higher and higher yet!||br||Pleading that same life-blood;||br||||sp||||sp||We taste the love that knows no let,||br||Of Abba, as of God.

Our Father, we would worship||br||In Jesus’ holy name;||br||||sp||||sp||For He, whate’er our changes,||br||Forever is the same:||br||||sp||||sp||Through Him our childlike praises||br||As incense sweet will be;||br||||sp||||sp||The songs Thy Spirit raises||br||Can ne’er want melody.

The fire Thy love hath kindled||br||Shall never be put out;||br||||sp||||sp||The Spirit keeps it burning||br||(Though dimmed by things without):||br||||sp||||sp||O make it burn more brightly!||br||By faith more freely shine;||br||||sp||||sp||That we may value rightly||br||The grace that made us Thine.

What was it, blessed God,||br||Led Thee to give Thy son,||br||||sp||||sp||To yield Thy well-beloved||br||For us by sin undone?||br||||sp||||sp||’Twas love unbounded led Thee thus||br||||sp||||sp||To give Thy well-beloved for us.

What led Thy Son, O God!||br||To leave Thy throne on high,||br||||sp||||sp||To shed His precious blood,||br||To suffer and to die?||br||||sp||||sp||’Twas love, unbounded love to us,||br||||sp||||sp||Led Him to die and suffer thus.

What moved Thee to impart||br||Thy Spirit from above,||br||||sp||||sp||Therewith to fill our heart||br||With heavenly peace and love?||br||||sp||||sp||’Twas love, unbounded love to us,||br||||sp||||sp||Moved Thee to give Thy Spirit thus.

What love to Thee we owe,||br||Our God, for all Thy grace;||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts may well o’erflow||br||In everlasting praise!||br||||sp||||sp||Make us, O Lord, to praise Thee thus||br||||sp||||sp||For all Thy boundless love to us.
“Praise ye the Lord,” again, again,||br||The Spirit strikes the chord;||br||||sp||||sp||Nor toucheth He our hearts in vain;||br||We praise, we praise the Lord.
“Rejoice in Him,” again, again,||br||The Spirit speaks the word,||br||||sp||||sp||And faith takes up the happy strain;||br||Our joy is in the Lord.
“Stand fast in Christ”; ah! yet again||br||He teacheth all the band;||br||||sp||||sp||If human efforts are in vain,||br||In Christ it is we stand.
“Clean every whit”; Thou saidst it, Lord;||br||Shall one suspicion lurk?||br||||sp||||sp||Thine, surely is a faithful word,||br||And Thine a finished work.
Forever be the glory given||br||To Thee, O Lamb of God!||br||||sp||||sp||Our every joy on earth in heaven,||br||We owe it to Thy blood.

In all things more than conquerors||br||Through Him that lovèd us—||br||||sp||||sp||We know that neither death, nor life,||br||Nor angels, rulers, powers,||br||||sp||||sp||Nor present things, nor things to come,||br||Nor even height, nor depth,||br||||sp||||sp||Nor any other creature-thing,||br||Above, below, around,||br||||sp||||sp||Can part us from the love of God||br||In Jesus Christ our Lord.

Secured in Christ, their Head on high,||br||||sp||||sp||The saints below may boldly cry—||br||Praise to our God, Amen!||br||||sp||||sp||To God in Christ all praise be given—||br||||sp||||sp||Forevermore, on earth, in heaven.||br||Amen! Amen! Amen!
All things that God or man could wish,||br||In Jesus richly meet;||br||||sp||||sp||Not to our eyes is light so dear,||br||No earthly tie so sweet.
O may His name still cheer our hearts||br||And shed its fragrance there!||br||||sp||||sp||The sweetest balm of every wound,||br||The cure of every care.

Though troubles assail,||br||And dangers affright,||br||||sp||||sp||Though friends should all fail,||br||And foes all unite:||br||||sp||||sp||Yet one thing secures us||br||Whatever betide,||br||||sp||||sp||The scripture assures us||br||The Lord will provide.

The birds, without barn||br||Or storehouse, are fed;||br||||sp||||sp||From them let us learn||br||To trust for our bread:||br||||sp||||sp||His saints what is fitting||br||Shall ne’er be denied,||br||||sp||||sp||So long as ’tis written,||br||The Lord will provide.

We may, like the ships,||br||By tempests be tossed||br||||sp||||sp||On perilous deeps,||br||But cannot be lost;||br||||sp||||sp||Though Satan enrages||br||The wind and the tide,||br||||sp||||sp||The promise engages||br||The Lord will provide.

His call we obey,||br||Like Abram of old,||br||||sp||||sp||Not knowing our way,||br||But faith makes us bold;||br||||sp||||sp||For though we are strangers,||br||We have a sure guide,||br||||sp||||sp||And trust in all dangers||br||The Lord will provide.
“Forever with the Lord!”||br||Amen! so let it be:||br||||sp||||sp||Life from the dead is in that word,||br||’Tis immortality.
Here in the body pent,||br||Absent from Him we roam,||br||||sp||||sp||Yet nightly pitch our moving tent||br||A day’s march nearer home.
Our Father’s home on high,||br||Home to our souls so dear,||br||||sp||||sp||E’en now to faith’s transpiercing eye||br||Thy golden gates appear.
Our thirsty spirits faint||br||To reach the home we love;||br||||sp||||sp||The bright inheritance of saints,||br||Jerusalem above.
And though there intervene||br||Rough seas and stormy skies,||br||||sp||||sp||Though by no mortal vision seen||br||Thy glory fills our eyes.
There shall all clouds depart,||br||The wilderness shall cease;||br||||sp||||sp||And sweetly shall each gladdened heart||br||Enjoy eternal peace.

What rich, eternal bursts of praise||br||||sp||||sp||Shall fill yon courts through endless days,||br||When time shall cease to be!||br||||sp||||sp||Round and around the notes shall swell,||br||||sp||||sp||As each redeemed one joins to tell||br||Thy love, so vast and free.

Each shall the Saviour’s likeness bear,||br||||sp||||sp||A royal crown each brow shall wear,||br||With robes unsullied white.||br||||sp||||sp||The everlasting song shall be,||br||||sp||||sp||To Thee, O Lamb of God, to Thee,||br||’Mid scenes of purest light.

Our joy unhindered then with Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Our eyes undimmed Thy glory see,||br||Whilst worthy praise we give.||br||||sp||||sp||Through that eternal cloudless day,||br||||sp||||sp||Our burning hearts with rapture say||br||He died that we might live.

While created things are wasting,||br||Still our God abides the same;||br||||sp||||sp||All His words are everlasting,||br||All His works His love proclaim;||br||||sp||||sp||Blood-bought children,||br||Sing we praises to His name.

O Jesus Christ, most holy—||br||Head of the church, Thy bride,||br||||sp||||sp||In us each day more fully||br||Thy name be magnified!||br||||sp||||sp||O may, in each believer,||br||Thy love its power display,||br||||sp||||sp||And none among us ever||br||From Thee, our Shepherd, stray!

Head of the church triumphant!||br||||sp||||sp||We joyfully adore Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Till Thou appear, Thy members here||br||||sp||||sp||Would sing like those in glory!||br||We lift our hearts and voices,||br||||sp||||sp||In blest anticipation,||br||||sp||||sp||And cry aloud, and give to God||br||||sp||||sp||The praise of our salvation.

While in affliction’s furnace,||br||||sp||||sp||And passing through the fire,||br||||sp||||sp||The love we praise which tries our ways,||br||||sp||||sp||And ever brings us nigher.||br||We lift our hearts, exulting||br||||sp||||sp||In Thine almighty favor:||br||||sp||||sp||The love divine which made us Thine||br||||sp||||sp||Shall keep us Thine forever.

Thou dost conduct Thy people||br||||sp||||sp||Safely through all temptation;||br||||sp||||sp||Nor will we fear, since Thou art near,||br||||sp||||sp||The fire of tribulation.||br||The world with sin and Satan,||br||||sp||||sp||Display their strength before us;||br||||sp||||sp||By Thee we shall break through them all,||br||||sp||||sp||And join in the heavenly chorus.

By faith we see the glory||br||||sp||||sp||Of which Thou dost assure us;||br||||sp||||sp||The world despise, for that high prize||br||||sp||||sp||Which Thou hast set before us.||br||And may we, counted worthy||br||||sp||||sp||To meet the Son from heaven,||br||||sp||||sp||There see our Lord, by all adored,||br||||sp||||sp||To us in glory given.

Lord, Thou hast drawn us after Thee,||br||Now let us run and never tire;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy presence shall our comfort be,||br||Thyself our hope, our sole desire.||br||||sp||||sp||Our present Saviour, while nor fear||br||||sp||||sp||Nor sin can come if Thou art near.

What in Thy love possess we not?||br||Our star by night, our sun by day,||br||||sp||||sp||Our spring of life when parched with drought:||br||Our wine to cheer, our bread to stay,||br||||sp||||sp||Our strength, our shield, our safe abode,||br||||sp||||sp||Our robe before the throne of God!

Unchangeable, Thy gracious love||br||Our earthly path has ceaseless viewed;||br||||sp||||sp||Ere knew our beating heart to move,||br||Thy tender mercies still pursued;||br||||sp||||sp||Ever with us may They abide,||br||||sp||||sp||And close us in on every side.

Thy love we own, Lord Jesus;||br||||sp||||sp||In service unremitting,||br||||sp||||sp||Within the veil Thou dost prevail,||br||||sp||||sp||Each soul for worship fitting;||br||Encompassed here with failure,||br||||sp||||sp||Each earthly refuge fails us;||br||||sp||||sp||Without, within, in strife with sin—||br||||sp||||sp||Thy name alone avails us.

Thy love we own, Lord Jesus;||br||||sp||||sp||For though Thy toils are ended,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy tender heart doth take its part||br||||sp||||sp||With those Thy grace befriended.||br||Thy sympathy, how precious!||br||||sp||||sp||Thou succorest in sorrow,||br||||sp||||sp||And bidst us cheer, while pilgrims here,||br||||sp||||sp||And haste the hopeful morrow.

Thy love we own, Lord Jesus;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy way is traced before Thee:||br||||sp||||sp||Thou wilt descend, and we ascend,||br||||sp||||sp||To meet in heavenly glory;||br||Soon shall the blissful morning||br||||sp||||sp||Call forth Thy saints to meet Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Our only Lord, alone adored,||br||||sp||||sp||With gladness then we’ll greet Thee.

Thy love we own, Lord Jesus;||br||||sp||||sp||And wait to see Thy glory,||br||||sp||||sp||To know as known, and fully own||br||||sp||||sp||Thy perfect grace before Thee:||br||We plead Thy parting promise,||br||||sp||||sp||Come, Saviour, to release us,||br||||sp||||sp||Then endless praise our lips shall raise,||br||||sp||||sp||For love like Thine, Lord Jesus.

The night is far spent, and the day is at hand:||br||||sp||||sp||No sign to be looked for; the Star’s in the sky;||br||||sp||||sp||Rejoice then ye saints, ’tis your Lord’s own command;||br||||sp||||sp||Rejoice, for the coming of Jesus draws nigh.

What a day will that be when the Saviour appears!||br||||sp||||sp||How welcome to those who have shared in His cross!||br||||sp||||sp||A crown incorruptible then will be theirs,||br||||sp||||sp||A rich compensation for suffering and loss.

What is loss in this world when compared to that day,||br||||sp||||sp||To the glory that then shall from heaven be revealed?||br||||sp||||sp||“The Saviour is coming,” His people may say;||br||||sp||||sp||“The Lord whom we look for, our Sun and our Shield.”

O pardon us, Lord! that our love to Thy name||br||||sp||||sp||Is so faint, with so much our affections to move!||br||||sp||||sp||Our coldness might fill us with grief and with shame.||br||||sp||||sp||So much to be loved, and so little to love.

O kindle within us a holy desire,||br||||sp||||sp||Like that which was found in Thy people of old,||br||||sp||||sp||Who tasted Thy love and whose hearts were on fire,||br||||sp||||sp||While They waited in patience Thy face to behold.
Lord, we can see, by faith in Thee,||br||A prospect bright, unfailing;||br||||sp||||sp||Where God shall shine, in light divine,||br||In glory never fading.
A home above, of peace and love,||br||Close to Thy holy person;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy saints shall there see glory fair,||br||And shine as Thy reflection.
O how we thirst the chains to burst,||br||That weigh our spirits downward;||br||||sp||||sp||And there to flow in love’s full glow,||br||With hearts like Thine surrounded.
No more as here, ’mid snares to fear||br||A thought or wish unholy;||br||||sp||||sp||No more to pain the Lamb once slain,||br||But live to love Thee wholly!
No more to view Thy chosen few||br||In selfish strife divided;||br||||sp||||sp||But drink in peace the living grace||br||That gave them hearts united!
Lord, haste that day of cloudless ray,||br||That prospect bright, unfailing;||br||||sp||||sp||Where God shall shine in light divine,||br||In glory never fading.

hymn.author: V. 1, 4 & 6, C. Wesley, 1758; v. 2, J. Cennick, 1752; combined by Madan

stanza.text: Lo! He comes, from heaven descending,||br||Once for favored sinners slain!||br||||sp||||sp||Thousand thousand saints attending||br||Swell the triumph of His train!||br||||sp||||sp||Hallelujah!||br||Jesus comes and comes to reign!

See the Saviour, long expected,||br||Now in solemn pomp appear!||br||||sp||||sp||And His saints, by man rejected,||br||All His heavenly glory share:||br||||sp||||sp||Hallelujah!||br||See the Son of God appear!

Lo! the tokens of His passion,||br||Though in glory, still He bears;||br||||sp||||sp||Cause of endless exultation||br||To His ransomed worshippers;||br||||sp||||sp||Hallelujah!||br||Christ, the Lamb of God, appears.

Israel’s race shall now behold Him||br||Full of grace and majesty;||br||||sp||||sp||Though they set at naught and sold Him,||br||Pierced and nailed Him to the tree,||br||||sp||||sp||Now in glory||br||Shall their great Messiah see.

’Tis Thy heavenly bride and Spirit,||br||Jesus, Lord! that bid Thee come;||br||||sp||||sp||All the glory to inherit,||br||And to take Thy people home.||br||||sp||||sp||All creation||br||Travails, groans, till Thou shalt come.

Yea, Amen, let all adore Thee,||br||High on Thine exalted throne:||br||||sp||||sp||Saviour, take the power and glory;||br||Claim the kingdoms for Thine own:||br||||sp||||sp||Come Lord Jesus!||br||Hallelujah! come, Lord, come!

He bids us come; His voice we know,||br||||sp||||sp||And boldly on the waters go||br||To Him our God and Lord;||br||||sp||||sp||We walk on life’s tempestuous sea,||br||||sp||||sp||For He who died to set us free||br||Hath called us with His word.

Secure, on boisterous waves we tread,||br||||sp||||sp||Nor all the billows round us dread,||br||While on the Lord we look;||br||||sp||||sp||The tempter drives his vortex round,||br||||sp||||sp||We pass it as on solid ground;||br||The wave is firm as rock.

But if from Him we turn the eye,||br||||sp||||sp||We see the raging floods run high,||br||Our hearts are full of fear;||br||||sp||||sp||Our foes so strong, our flesh so frail,||br||||sp||||sp||Reason and unbelief prevail,||br||Forgetting He is near.

Lord! we our unbelief confess,||br||||sp||||sp||Do Thou our little faith increase,||br||That we may fail no more,||br||||sp||||sp||But fix on Thee a steady eye,||br||||sp||||sp||And on Thine outstretched arm rely,||br||Till all the storm is o’er.
O teach us more of Thy blest ways,||br||Thou holy Lamb of God!||br||||sp||||sp||And fix and root us in Thy grace,||br||As those redeemed by blood.
O tell us often of Thy love,||br||Of all Thy grief and pain;||br||||sp||||sp||And let our hearts with joy confess||br||That thence comes all our gain.
For this, O may we freely count||br||Whate’er we have but loss;||br||||sp||||sp||The dearest object of our love,||br||Compared with Thee, but dross.
Engrave this deeply on our hearts||br||With an eternal pen,||br||||sp||||sp||That we may, in some small degree,||br||Return Thy love again.

“A little while”—the Lord shall come,||br||And we shall wander here no more;||br||||sp||||sp||He’ll take us to His Father’s home,||br||Where He for us is gone before—||br||||sp||||sp||To dwell with Him, to see His face,||br||||sp||||sp||And sing the glories of His grace.

“A little while”—He’ll come again,||br||Let us the precious hours redeem;||br||||sp||||sp||Our only grief to give Him pain,||br||Our joy to serve and follow Him.||br||||sp||||sp||Watching and ready may we be,||br||||sp||||sp||As those that wait their Lord to see.

“A little while”—’twill soon be past,||br||Why should we shun the promised cross?||br||||sp||||sp||O let us in His footsteps haste,||br||Counting for Him all else but loss!||br||||sp||||sp||For how will recompense His smile,||br||||sp||||sp||The sufferings of this “little while.”

“A little while”—come, Saviour, come!||br||For Thee Thy bride has tarried long:||br||||sp||||sp||Take Thy poor waiting pilgrims home,||br||To sing the new eternal song,||br||||sp||||sp||To see Thy glory, and to be||br||||sp||||sp||In everything conformed to Thee!
O patient, spotless One!||br||Our hearts in meekness train,||br||||sp||||sp||To bear Thy yoke, and learn of Thee,||br||That we may rest obtain.
Jesus! Thou art enough||br||The mind and heart to fill;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy patient life—to calm the soul;||br||Thy love—its fear dispel.
O fix our earnest gaze||br||So wholly, Lord, on Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||That, with Thy beauty occupied,||br||We elsewhere none may see.
We sing the praise of Him who died,||br||||sp||||sp||Of Him who died upon the cross,||br||||sp||||sp||The sinner’s Hope—let men deride;||br||||sp||||sp||For this we count the world but loss.
Inscribed upon the cross we see,||br||||sp||||sp||In shining letters, “God is love!”||br||||sp||||sp||The Lamb who died upon the tree||br||||sp||||sp||Has brought us mercy from above.
The Cross! it took our guilt away,||br||||sp||||sp||It holds the fainting spirit up;||br||||sp||||sp||It cheers with hope the gloomy day,||br||||sp||||sp||And sweetens every bitter cup.
It makes the coward spirit brave,||br||||sp||||sp||And nerves the feeble arm for fight;||br||||sp||||sp||It takes its terror from the grave,||br||||sp||||sp||And guilds the bed of death with light.
The balm of life, the cure of woe,||br||||sp||||sp||The measure and the pledge of love,||br||||sp||||sp||The sinner’s refuge here below,||br||||sp||||sp||The theme of praise in heaven above.
Lord, we shall see Thee as Thou art||br||In yonder mansions fair,||br||||sp||||sp||We shall behold Thee face to face,||br||Thy glorious image bear.
With what delight, what wondering love,||br||Each thrilling heart shall swell,||br||||sp||||sp||When we, as sharers of Thy joy,||br||Are called in heaven to dwell!
O hasten, hasten on that hour,||br||And call us to Thy seat;||br||||sp||||sp||Lord, Thou without us ne’er wilt count||br||Thy joy and work complete.
Though in a foreign land,||br||We are not far from home;||br||||sp||||sp||And nearer to our rest above||br||We every moment come.
Secure within the veil,||br||Christ is our anchor strong;||br||||sp||||sp||While power supreme, and love divine,||br||Still guide us safe along.
And should the surges rise—||br||Should sore afflictions come,||br||||sp||||sp||Blest is the sorrow, kind the storm,||br||That drives us nearer home.
God’s grace will to the end||br||Clearer and brighter shine;||br||||sp||||sp||Nor present things, nor things to come,||br||Can change His love divine.
Soon shall our pains and fears||br||Forever pass away;||br||||sp||||sp||For we shall soon the Saviour see||br||In everlasting day.
Blest Father, infinite in grace,||br||Source of eternal joy;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou lead’st our hearts to that blest place||br||Where rest’s without alloy.
There will Thy love find perfect rest,||br||Where all around is bliss,||br||||sp||||sp||Where all in Thee supremely blest,||br||Thy praise their service is.
Eternal love their portion is,||br||Where love has found its rest;||br||||sp||||sp||And, filled with Thee, the constant mind||br||Eternally is blest.
There Christ, the center of the throng,||br||Shall in His glory shine;||br||||sp||||sp||But not an eye those hosts among||br||But sees His glory Thine.
Thy counsels too in all Thine own,||br||Fulfilled by power divine,||br||||sp||||sp||Spread wide the glory of Thy throne,||br||Where all in glory shine.
Yet deeper, if a calmer, joy||br||The Father’s love shall raise,||br||||sp||||sp||And every heart find sweet employ||br||In His eternal praise.
Nor is its sweetness now unknown,||br||Well proved in what it’s done;||br||||sp||||sp||Our Father’s love with joy we own,||br||Revealed in Christ the Son.
Brightness of th’ eternal glory,||br||Shall Thy praise unuttered lie?||br||||sp||||sp||Who would hush the heaven-sent story||br||Of the Lamb who came to die?
Came from Godhead’s fullest glory||br||Down to Calvary’s depth of woe,||br||||sp||||sp||Now on high, we bow before Thee;||br||Streams of praises ceaseless flow!
Sing His blest triumphant rising;||br||Sing Him on the Father’s throne;||br||||sp||||sp||Sing—till heaven and earth surprising,||br||Reigns the Nazarene alone.

We are but strangers here;||br||Heaven is our home!||br||||sp||||sp||Earth is a desert drear;||br||Heaven is our home!||br||||sp||||sp||Dangers and sorrows stand||br||||sp||||sp||Round us on every hand;||br||||sp||||sp||Heaven is our fatherland,||br||Heaven is our home!

What though the tempest rage,||br||Heaven is our home!||br||||sp||||sp||Short is our pilgrimage;||br||Heaven is our home!||br||||sp||||sp||This life’s wild wintery blast||br||||sp||||sp||Soon will be overpast;||br||||sp||||sp||We shall reach home at last;||br||Heaven is our home!

There at our Saviour’s side,||br||In heaven our home!||br||||sp||||sp||We shall be glorified;||br||Heaven is our home!||br||||sp||||sp||There with the good and blest||br||||sp||||sp||Those we love most and best||br||||sp||||sp||We shall forever rest,||br||In heaven our home!

Therefore we’ll murmur not,||br||Heaven is our home!||br||||sp||||sp||Whate’er our earthly lot;||br||Heaven is our home!||br||||sp||||sp||We shall yet surely stand,||br||||sp||||sp||There at our Lord’s right hand;||br||||sp||||sp||Heaven is our fatherland,||br||Heaven is our home!

When Satan appears||br||To stop up our path,||br||||sp||||sp||And fill us with fears,||br||We triumph by faith;||br||||sp||||sp||He cannot take from us,||br||Though oft he has tried,||br||||sp||||sp||The heart-cheering promise,||br||The Lord will provide.

He tells us we’re weak,||br||Our hope is in vain,||br||||sp||||sp||The good that we seek||br||We ne’er shall obtain;||br||||sp||||sp||But when such suggestions||br||Our spirits have tried,||br||||sp||||sp||This answers all questions,||br||The Lord will provide.

No strength of our own,||br||Or goodness we claim;||br||||sp||||sp||Yet since we have known||br||The Saviour’s great name,||br||||sp||||sp||In this, our strong tower,||br||For safety we hide,||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord is our power,||br||The Lord will provide.

Should life sink apace,||br||And death be in view,||br||||sp||||sp||This word of His grace||br||Shall comfort us through;||br||||sp||||sp||No fearing or doubting,||br||With Christ on our side,||br||||sp||||sp||Through faith we’ll die shouting,||br||The Lord will provide.
Our tongues shall spread the Saviour’s fame,||br||Whose grace we daily prove,||br||||sp||||sp||For since our souls have known His name,||br||His banner has been—Love.
When walking in the paths of sin,||br||We far from Him did rove,||br||||sp||||sp||By sweet constraint He drew us in,||br||And waved His banner—Love.
He spread the banquet, made us eat,||br||Bid all our fears remove;||br||||sp||||sp||Yea, o’er our guilty, rebel heads||br||He placed His banner—Love.
When weary of His rich repast,||br||We’ve sought, alas! to rove,||br||||sp||||sp||He has recalled His faithless guest,||br||And shown His banner—Love.
In every conflict we sustain,||br||Our enemies shall prove,||br||||sp||||sp||Through Him the victory we obtain,||br||Beneath His banner—Love.
And when He calls us home at length,||br||To feast with Him above,||br||||sp||||sp||Through all eternity we’ll sing||br||His never-changing love.

Saviour, come, Thy saints are waiting,||br||Waiting for the nuptial day,||br||||sp||||sp||Thence their promised glory dating;||br||Come, and bear Thy saints away.||br||||sp||||sp||Come, Lord Jesus,||br||Thus Thy waiting people pray.

Base, the wish, and vain th’ endeavor,||br||Here on earth to find our rest;||br||||sp||||sp||Till we see Thy face, we never||br||Shall or can be fully blest;||br||||sp||||sp||In Thy presence||br||Nothing shall our peace molest.

Lord, we wait for Thine appearing;||br||“Tarry not,” Thy people say;||br||||sp||||sp||Bright the prospect is, and cheering,||br||Of beholding Thee that day;||br||||sp||||sp||When our sorrow||br||Shall forever pass away.

Till it comes, O keep us steady,||br||Keep us walking in Thy ways;||br||||sp||||sp||At Thy call may we be ready,||br||On Thee, Lord, with joy to gaze;||br||||sp||||sp||And in glory||br||Sing Thine everlasting praise.
There is a name we love to hear,||br||We love to sing its worth;||br||||sp||||sp||It sounds like music in our ear,||br||The sweetest name on earth.
It tells us of a Saviour’s love,||br||Who died to set us free;||br||||sp||||sp||It tells us of His precious blood,||br||The sinner’s perfect plea.
Jesus! the name we love so well,||br||The name we love to hear!||br||||sp||||sp||No saint on earth its worth can tell,||br||No heart conceive how dear.
This name shall shed its fragrance still||br||Along this thorny road,||br||||sp||||sp||Shall sweetly smooth the rugged hill||br||That leads us up to God.
And there the whole triumphant throng,||br||Of blood-bought saints on high,||br||||sp||||sp||Shall sing the new eternal song||br||With Jesus ever nigh.
We have a home above,||br||From all defilement free;||br||||sp||||sp||A mansion which eternal love||br||Prepared our rest to be.
The Father’s gracious hand||br||Has built that blest abode;||br||||sp||||sp||From everlasting it was planned,||br||The dwelling place of God.
The Saviour’s precious blood||br||Has made our title sure;||br||||sp||||sp||He passed through death’s dark, raging flood,||br||To make our rest secure.
The Comforter is come,||br||The Earnest has been given;||br||||sp||||sp||He leads us onward to the home||br||Reserved for us in heaven.
Thy love, most gracious Lord,||br||Our joy and strength shall be;||br||||sp||||sp||Till Thou shalt speak the gladdening word||br||That bids us rise to Thee.
And then through endless days,||br||Where all Thy glories shine,||br||||sp||||sp||In happier, holier strains we’ll praise||br||The grace that made us Thine.
Jesus, of Thee we ne’er would tire;||br||The new and living food||br||||sp||||sp||Can satisfy our heart’s desire,||br||And life is in Thy blood.
If such the happy midnight song||br||Our prisoned spirits raise,||br||||sp||||sp||What are the joys that cause, ere long,||br||Eternal bursts of praise?
To look within and see no stain,||br||Abroad no curse to trace;||br||||sp||||sp||To shed no tears, to feel no pain,||br||But see Thee face to face.
To find each hope of glory gained,||br||Fulfilled each precious word;||br||||sp||||sp||And fully all to have attained||br||The image of our Lord.
For this we’re pressing onward still,||br||And in this hope would be||br||||sp||||sp||More subject to the Father’s will,||br||E’en now much more like Thee.

O Jesus, gracious Saviour,||br||Upon the Father’s throne—||br||||sp||||sp||Whose wondrous love and favor||br||Have made our cause Thine own;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy people to Thee ever||br||For grace and help repair,||br||||sp||||sp||For Thou, they know, wilt never||br||Refuse their griefs to share.

O Lord, through tribulation||br||Our pilgrim-journey lies,||br||||sp||||sp||Through scorn and sore temptation,||br||And watchful enemies;||br||||sp||||sp||Midst never-ceasing dangers||br||We through the desert roam;||br||||sp||||sp||As pilgrims here and strangers||br||We seek the rest to come.

O Lord, Thou too once hasted||br||This weary desert through,||br||||sp||||sp||Once fully tried and tasted||br||Its bitterness and woe;||br||||sp||||sp||And hence Thy heart is tender||br||In truest sympathy,||br||||sp||||sp||Though now the heavens render||br||All praise to Thee on high.

O by Thy Holy Spirit||br||Reveal in us Thy love,||br||||sp||||sp||The joy we shall inherit||br||With Thee, our Head above;||br||||sp||||sp||May all this consolation||br||Our trembling hearts sustain—||br||||sp||||sp||Sure—though through tribulation—||br||The promised rest to gain.

’Twas on that night of deepest woe,||br||When darkness round did thicken,||br||||sp||||sp||When through deep waters Thou didst go,||br||And for our sins wast stricken;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou, Lord, didst seek that we should be||br||||sp||||sp||With grateful hearts remembering Thee.

How deep the sorrow, who can tell,||br||Which was for us endurèd?||br||||sp||||sp||O love divine, which broke the spell||br||Which had our hearts allurèd.||br||||sp||||sp||With heart and conscience now set free,||br||||sp||||sp||It is our joy to think of Thee.

O Lord, how precious is Thy thought,||br||How wondrous Thy desire,||br||||sp||||sp||To win our hearts, once worse than naught,||br||Who now by grace aspire||br||||sp||||sp||To seek Thy glory, bear Thy shame,||br||||sp||||sp||To keep Thy word, and love Thy name.

We know Thee now exalted high,||br||Ourselves in Thee accepted;||br||||sp||||sp||We wait the hour which now draws nigh,||br||Thy coming long expected.||br||||sp||||sp||Till Thou dost come we still would be||br||||sp||||sp||With grateful hearts remembering Thee.

O God of matchless grace,||br||We sing unto Thy name!||br||||sp||||sp||We stand accepted in the place||br||That none but Christ could claim.||br||||sp||||sp||Our willing hearts have heard Thy voice,||br||||sp||||sp||And in Thy mercy we rejoice.

’Tis meet that Thy delight||br||Should center in the Son!||br||||sp||||sp||That Thou shouldst place us in Thy sight,||br||In Him, Thy Holy One!||br||||sp||||sp||Thy perfect love has cast out fear,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy favor shines upon us here!

Eternal is our rest,||br||O Christ of God, in Thee!||br||||sp||||sp||Now of Thy peace, Thy joy possessed,||br||We wait Thy face to see;||br||||sp||||sp||Now to the Father’s heart received,||br||||sp||||sp||We know in whom we have believed.

The stream that from the fountain flows,||br||The fountain of eternal love,||br||||sp||||sp||Imparts its virtue as it goes,||br||A gift all other gifts above;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis life and peace divinely given,||br||||sp||||sp||The love of God come down from heaven.

How blessed to enjoy the gift,||br||To taste of mercy here below;||br||||sp||||sp||In humble thankfulness to lift||br||Our hearts to Him whom now we know,||br||||sp||||sp||To know His love, how great it is,||br||||sp||||sp||To own and feel that we are His.

How blessed is the hope of good,||br||The good that without measure is,||br||||sp||||sp||Of seeing Him who shed His blood||br||To save us and to make us His.||br||||sp||||sp||Redeemed by blood and saved by grace,||br||||sp||||sp||We look to see the Saviour’s face.
Still in a land of drought and dearth,||br||Our longing spirits cry||br||||sp||||sp||To Thee, the Lord of heaven and earth,||br||Our thirst to satisfy.
O Thou with love more strong than death,||br||Unquenched by deepest waves;||br||||sp||||sp||We need throughout the walk of faith||br||The same free grace that saves.
We would not take from falsehood’s fire,||br||Though glittering be the spark;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou only art our heart’s desire,||br||Art light where all is dark.
Dark unbelief alone can shroud||br||A Sun that sets no more;||br||||sp||||sp||And when Thy grace removes the cloud,||br||We see Thee as before.
We soon shall join the white-robed throng,||br||We soon shall walk by sight;||br||||sp||||sp||Till then by faith we raise the song,||br||By faith in Thee delight.

Great Captain of salvation,||br||Now crowned with highest glory,||br||||sp||||sp||Joyful we raise,||br||||sp||||sp||Our songs of praise,||br||And lowly bow before Thee:||br||||sp||||sp||We worship and adore Thee,||br||Each heart and tongue confessing,||br||||sp||||sp||Worthy to reign,||br||||sp||||sp||The Lamb once slain,||br||Of honor, power, and blessing.

Thou hast the cross endured—||br||In love beyond all measure!||br||||sp||||sp||The curse, the grave,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy saints to save,||br||And have us as Thy treasure.||br||||sp||||sp||We see Thee as the Victim,||br||Our sins and sorrows bearing;||br||||sp||||sp||The Lamb once slain,||br||||sp||||sp||Alive again,||br||The crown of glory wearing.

Head of the new creation,||br||To God’s right hand ascended;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy saints rejoice,||br||||sp||||sp||With heart and voice,||br||Before Thy feet low bended:||br||||sp||||sp||We own Thee, Lord, exulting||br||In all Thy joy and glory;||br||||sp||||sp||And long to be||br||||sp||||sp||On high with Thee,||br||Where all shall bow before Thee.
Jesus, my Saviour! Thou art mine,||br||||sp||||sp||The Father’s gift of love divine;||br||||sp||||sp||All Thou hast done, and all Thou art,||br||||sp||||sp||Are now the portion of my heart.
Poor, feeble, wretched as I am,||br||||sp||||sp||I now can glory in Thy name;||br||||sp||||sp||Now cleansed in Thy most precious blood||br||||sp||||sp||And made the righteousness of God.
All that Thou hast Thou hast for me,||br||||sp||||sp||All my fresh springs are hid in Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||In Thee I live; while I confess||br||||sp||||sp||I nothing am, yet all possess.
O Saviour, teach me to abide||br||||sp||||sp||Close sheltered at Thy wounded side,||br||||sp||||sp||Each hour receiving “grace on grace,”||br||||sp||||sp||Until I see Thee face to face.
May the Saviour’s love and merit||br||Fill our hearts both night and day,||br||||sp||||sp||And the unction of His Spirit||br||All our thoughts and actions sway.
May we thus, in God confiding,||br||And from self-dependence free,||br||||sp||||sp||Find our rest—in Christ abiding—||br||Till with joy Himself we see.
Worthy of homage and of praise;||br||||sp||||sp||Worthy by all to be adored;||br||||sp||||sp||Exhaustless theme of heavenly lays!||br||||sp||||sp||Thou, Thou art worthy, Jesus, Lord.
Now seated on Jehovah’s throne,||br||||sp||||sp||The Lamb once slain in glory bright:||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis thence Thou watchest o’er Thine own,||br||||sp||||sp||Guarding us through the deadly fight.

To Thee, e’en now, our song we raise,||br||||sp||||sp||Though sure the tribute mean must prove;||br||||sp||||sp||No mortal tongue can tell Thy ways,||br||||sp||||sp||So full of life and light and love.

Yet, Saviour Thou shalt have ||i||full||/i|| praise:||br||||sp||||sp||We soon shall meet Thee on the cloud,||br||||sp||||sp||We soon shall see Thee face to face,||br||||sp||||sp||In glory praising as we would.

Come let us sing the matchless worth,||br||||sp||||sp||And sweetly sound the glories forth||br||Which in the Saviour shine:||br||||sp||||sp||To God and Christ our praises bring:||br||||sp||||sp||The song with which high heaven will ring,||br||“Praises for grace divine.”

How rich the precious blood He spilt,||br||||sp||||sp||Our ransom from the dreadful guilt||br||Of sin against our God;||br||||sp||||sp||How perfect is the righteousness,||br||||sp||||sp||In which unspotted, beauteous dress||br||His saints have ever stood!

How rich the character He bears,||br||||sp||||sp||And all the form of love He wears,||br||Exalted on the throne;||br||||sp||||sp||In songs of sweet, untiring praise,||br||||sp||||sp||We e’er would sing His perfect ways,||br||And make His glories known.

And soon the happy day shall come,||br||||sp||||sp||When we shall reach our destined home,||br||And see Him face to face;||br||||sp||||sp||Then with our Saviour, Lord and Friend,||br||||sp||||sp||The one unbroken day we’ll spend||br||In singing still His grace.
O God! what cords of love are Thine,||br||How gentle, yet how strong!||br||||sp||||sp||Thy truth and grace their strength combine||br||To draw our souls along.
The guilt of twice ten thousand sins||br||One moment takes away;||br||||sp||||sp||And when the fight of faith begins,||br||Our strength is as our day.
Comfort, through all this vale of tears,||br||In blest profusion flows;||br||||sp||||sp||And glory of unnumbered years||br||Eternity bestows.
Drawn by such cords we’ll onward move,||br||Till round the throne we meet,||br||||sp||||sp||And, captives in the chains of love,||br||Embrace our Saviour’s feet.
Lord, accept our feeble song!||br||||sp||||sp||Power and praise to Thee belong;||br||||sp||||sp||We would all Thy grace record,||br||||sp||||sp||Holy, holy, holy, Lord!
Rich in glory, Thou didst stoop,||br||||sp||||sp||Thence is all Thy people’s hope;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou wast poor, that we might be||br||||sp||||sp||Rich in glory, Lord, with Thee.
When we think of love like this,||br||||sp||||sp||Joy and shame our hearts possess;||br||||sp||||sp||Joy, that Thou couldst pity thus;||br||||sp||||sp||Shame, for such returns from us.
Yet we hope the day to see||br||||sp||||sp||When, from every hindrance free,||br||||sp||||sp||When to Thee, in glory, brought,||br||||sp||||sp||We shall serve Thee as we ought.

All praise and glory, Jesus,||br||Be Thine forevermore!||br||||sp||||sp||Thou didst from guilt release us,||br||Our souls Thou dost restore;||br||||sp||||sp||And oh! Thy grace transcending||br||Its fullness will declare,||br||||sp||||sp||When, from on high descending,||br||We meet Thee in the air.
Once we stood in condemnation,||br||Waiting thus the sinner’s doom,||br||||sp||||sp||Christ in death has wrought salvation,||br||God has raised Him from the tomb.
As strangers then to God we lived,||br||Filled with enmity and fear;||br||||sp||||sp||Our souls from death He has reprieved,||br||Love revealed and brought us near.
Now we see in Christ’s acceptance||br||But the measure of our own;||br||||sp||||sp||Him who lay beneath our sentence,||br||Seated high upon the throne.
Quickened, raised, and Him seated,||br||We a full deliverance know;||br||||sp||||sp||Every foe has been defeated,||br||Every enemy laid low.
Now we have a life in union||br||With the risen life above;||br||||sp||||sp||Now we drink in sweet communion||br||Some rich foretaste of His love.
Soon, O Lord, in brightest glory,||br||All its vastness we’ll explore;||br||||sp||||sp||Soon we’ll cast our crowns before Thee,||br||Whilst we worship and adore.

We fly not from that all-seeing eye,||br||Which once we shunned, to hide ourselves in night;||br||||sp||||sp||The blood that purged our sins has brought us nigh,||br||To dwell in God’s own love, and walk in light;||br||||sp||||sp||Thee, holy, holy, holy, Lord, we love,||br||||sp||||sp||Whose holy will we now delight to learn and prove.

Sin can’t condemn, for grace has justified;||br||Sin shall not reign, for grace has set us free;||br||||sp||||sp||Sin we abhor, since Christ our Surety died;||br||His grace now rules our souls in liberty;||br||||sp||||sp||The grace that has the wondrous work begun||br||||sp||||sp||Shall crown with glory when its mighty work is done.

What will it be to dwell above,||br||And with the Lord of glory reign,||br||||sp||||sp||Since the blest knowledge of His love||br||So brightens all this dreary plain?||br||||sp||||sp||No heart can think, no tongue can tell||br||||sp||||sp||What joy ’twill be with Christ to dwell.

When left this scene of faith and strife,||br||The flesh and sense deceive no more,||br||||sp||||sp||When we shall see the Prince of life,||br||And all His works of grace explore:||br||||sp||||sp||What heights and depths of love divine||br||||sp||||sp||Will there through endless ages shine!

And God has fixed the happy day||br||When the last tear shall dim our eyes;||br||||sp||||sp||When He will wipe these tears away,||br||And fill our hearts with glad surprise;||br||||sp||||sp||To hear His voice, and see His face,||br||||sp||||sp||And know the fullness of His grace.
O Jesus! Lamb of God,||br||Who us to save from loss,||br||||sp||||sp||Didst taste the bitter cup of death,||br||||sp||||sp||Upon the cross.
Most merciful High Priest,||br||Our Saviour, Shepherd, Friend,||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis in Thy love alone we trust||br||||sp||||sp||Until the end.
Thou wilt our souls sustain,||br||Our Guide and strength wilt be,||br||||sp||||sp||Until in glory, Lord, above,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy face we see.
’Tis sweet to think of those at rest,||br||Who sleep in Christ the Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||Whose spirits now with Him are blest,||br||According to His word.
They once were pilgrims here with us;||br||In Jesus now they sleep:||br||||sp||||sp||And we for them, while resting thus,||br||As hopeless cannot weep.
How bright the resurrection-morn||br||On all the saints will break!||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord Himself will then return,||br||His ransomed church to take.
Our Lord Himself we then shall see,||br||Whose blood for us was shed,||br||||sp||||sp||With Him forever we shall be,||br||Made like our glorious Head.
We cannot linger o’er the tomb;||br||The resurrection day||br||||sp||||sp||To faith shines bright beyond its gloom,||br||Christ’s glory to display.

Oh would we be as angels bright,||br||To stand before the throne in light,||br||||sp||||sp||And join the myriads that proclaim||br||The honor of th’ ascended Lamb?||br||||sp||||sp||Ah, no!—what losers were we thus;||br||||sp||||sp||We could not sing, He died for us!

We would not bear an angel’s name;||br||A sinner saved is what we claim.||br||||sp||||sp||We’d rather debtors be to grace||br||Than fill e’en Gabriel’s honored place,||br||||sp||||sp||And washed in Calvary’s precious flood,||br||||sp||||sp||Owe all to Christ’s atoning blood.
O Lord, we know it matters not||br||How sweet the song may be;||br||||sp||||sp||No heart but of the Spirit taught||br||Makes melody to Thee.
Then teach Thy gathered saints, O Lord,||br||To worship in Thy fear;||br||||sp||||sp||And let Thy grace mould every word||br||That meets Thy holy ear.
Thou hast by blood made sinners meet||br||As saints in light, to come||br||||sp||||sp||And worship at the mercy-seat,||br||Before th’ eternal throne.
Thy precious name is all we show,||br||Our only passport, Lord;||br||||sp||||sp||And full assurance now we know,||br||Confiding in Thy word.
O largely give, ’tis all Thy own,||br||The Spirit’s goodly fruit:||br||||sp||||sp||Praise, issuing forth in life, alone||br||Our living Lord can suit.
Now may the God of peace and love,||br||Who from the silent grave||br||||sp||||sp||Brought back the Shepherd of the sheep,||br||Omnipotent to save—
Through the rich merits of that blood||br||Which He on Calvary spilt,||br||||sp||||sp||To make the gracious work secure,||br||On which our hopes are built—
Perfect our souls in every grace,||br||To do His blessed will,||br||||sp||||sp||And all that’s pleasing in His sight||br||Inspire us to fulfill.
For His, the risen Shepherd’s sake,||br||We every blessing pray;||br||||sp||||sp||With glory let His name be crowned||br||Through heaven’s eternal day.

In hope we lift our wishful, longing eyes,||br||||sp||||sp||Waiting to see the Morning Star arise;||br||||sp||||sp||How bright, how gladsome will His advent be,||br||||sp||||sp||Before the Sun shines forth in majesty.

How will our eyes to see His face delight,||br||||sp||||sp||Whose love has cheered us through the darksome night!||br||||sp||||sp||How will our ears drink in His well-known voice,||br||||sp||||sp||Whose faintest whispers make our souls rejoice!

No stain within; no foes or snares around;||br||||sp||||sp||No jarring notes shall there discordant sound;||br||||sp||||sp||All pure without, all pure within the breast;||br||||sp||||sp||No thorns to wound, no toil to mar our rest.

If here on earth the thoughts of Jesus’ love||br||||sp||||sp||Lift our poor hearts this weary world above;||br||||sp||||sp||If even here the taste of heavenly springs||br||||sp||||sp||So cheers the spirit, that the pilgrim sings;

What will the sunshine of His glory prove?||br||||sp||||sp||What the unmingled fullness of His love?||br||||sp||||sp||What hallelujahs will His presence raise?||br||||sp||||sp||What but one loud eternal burst of praise?
Our times are in Thy hand,||br||Father, we wish them there;||br||||sp||||sp||Our life, our soul, our all, we leave||br||Entirely to Thy care.
Our times are in Thy hand,||br||Whatever they may be,||br||||sp||||sp||Pleasing or painful, dark or bright,||br||As best may seem to Thee.
Our times are in Thy hand,||br||Why should we doubt or fear?||br||||sp||||sp||A Father’s hand will never cause||br||His child a needless tear.
Our times are in Thy hand,||br||Jesus the crucified!||br||||sp||||sp||The hand our many sins had pierced||br||Is now our Guard and Guide.
Our times are in Thy hand,||br||Jesus the Advocate!||br||||sp||||sp||Nor can that hand be stretched in vain,||br||For us to supplicate.
Our times are in Thy hand;||br||We’d always trust in Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Till we have left this weary land,||br||And all Thy glory see.
