“One spirit with the Lord”;||br||O blessed, wondrous word!||br||||sp||||sp||What heavenly light, what power divine,||br||Doth that sweet word afford!
“One spirit with the Lord”;||br||Jesus, the glorified,||br||||sp||||sp||Esteems the church for which He bled,||br||His body and His bride.
And though by storms assailed,||br||And though by trials pressed,||br||||sp||||sp||Himself our life, He bears us up||br||Right onward to the rest.
There we shall drink the stream||br||Of endless bliss above:||br||||sp||||sp||There we shall know, without a cloud,||br||His full, unbounded love.

O Jesus Christ, the Saviour,||br||We only look to Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis in Thy love and favor||br||Our souls find liberty.||br||||sp||||sp||When Satan seeks to sift us,||br||And shipwreck we might fear,||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis this o’er all will lift us,||br||That ||i||Thou||/i|| art ever near.

Yes, though the tempest round us||br||Seems safety to defy;||br||||sp||||sp||Though rocks and shoals surround us,||br||And billows swell on high—||br||||sp||||sp||Thou dost from all protect us,||br||And cheer us by Thy love;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy counsels still direct us||br||Safe to the rest above.

There with what joy reviewing||br||Past conflicts, dangers, fears,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy hand our foes subduing,||br||And drying all our tears,||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts with rapture burning,||br||The path we shall retrace,||br||||sp||||sp||Where now our souls are learning||br||The riches of Thy grace.

Called from above, and heavenly men by birth||br||||sp||||sp||(Who once were but the citizens of earth),||br||||sp||||sp||As pilgrims here, we seek a heavenly home,||br||||sp||||sp||Our portion in the ages yet to come.

Where all the saints of every clime shall meet,||br||||sp||||sp||And each with all shall all the ransomed greet,||br||||sp||||sp||But oh! the height of bliss, my Lord, shall be||br||||sp||||sp||To owe it all, and share it all with Thee.

Thou wast “the image,” in man’s lowly guise,||br||||sp||||sp||Of the invisible to mortal eyes;||br||||sp||||sp||Come from His bosom, from the heavens above,||br||||sp||||sp||We see in Thee incarnate, “God is love.”

Thy lips the Father’s name to us reveal;||br||||sp||||sp||What burning power in all Thy words we feel,||br||||sp||||sp||When to our raptured hearts we hear Thee tell||br||||sp||||sp||The heavenly glories which Thou know’st so well.

No curse of law, in Thee was sovereign grace,||br||||sp||||sp||And now what glory in Thine unveiled face!||br||||sp||||sp||Thou didst attract the wretched and the weak,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy joy the wanderers and the lost to seek.

That precious stream of water and of blood||br||||sp||||sp||Which from Thy piercèd side so freely flowed,||br||||sp||||sp||Has put away our sins of scarlet dye,||br||||sp||||sp||Washed us from every stain, and brought us nigh.

We are but strangers here, we do not crave||br||||sp||||sp||A home on earth, which gave Thee but a grave:||br||||sp||||sp||Thy cross has severed ties which bound us here,||br||||sp||||sp||Thyself our treasure in a brighter sphere.

On Calvary we’ve adoring stood,||br||And gazed on that wondrous cross,||br||||sp||||sp||Where the holy, spotless Lamb of God||br||Was slain in His love for us;||br||||sp||||sp||How our hearts have stirred at that solemn cry,||br||While the sun was enwrapt in night,||br||||sp||||sp||“Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?”||br||Most blessed, most awful sight.

Our sins were laid on His sacred head,||br||The curse by our Lord was borne;||br||||sp||||sp||For us a victim our Saviour bled,||br||And endured that death of scorn;||br||||sp||||sp||Himself He gave our poor hearts to win—||br||(Was ever love, Lord, like Thine!)||br||||sp||||sp||From the paths of folly, and shame and sin,||br||And fill them with joys divine.

We’ve watched by the tomb where our Saviour lay||br||When He entered the gloomy grave;||br||||sp||||sp||And by death the power of death might slay||br||And His lambs from the lion save.||br||||sp||||sp||Oh! glorious time when the Victor rose!||br||He liveth no more to die;||br||||sp||||sp||He hath bruised the head of our mighty foes,||br||For us was His victory!

The gates of heaven are opened wide,||br||At His name all the angels bow;||br||||sp||||sp||The Son of man who was crucified||br||Is the King of glory now:||br||||sp||||sp||We love to look up and behold Him there,||br||The Lamb for His chosen slain;||br||||sp||||sp||And soon shall His saints all His glories share,||br||With their Head and their Lord shall reign.

And now we draw near to the throne of grace,||br||For His blood and the Priest are there;||br||||sp||||sp||And we joyfully seek God’s holy face,||br||With our censer of praise and prayer.||br||||sp||||sp||The burning mount and the mystic veil,||br||With our terrors and guilt are gone;||br||||sp||||sp||Our conscience has peace that can never fail,||br||’Tis the Lamb on high on the throne.

How blessed is our portion! when we look||br||Upward, within the veil, our life is there:||br||||sp||||sp||Our names are written in the Lamb’s own book,||br||For grace hath made us each with Him an heir||br||||sp||||sp||Of all those glories which by right belong||br||||sp||||sp||To Him, whose worthiness is heaven’s eternal song.

We have a Father in the heavens above,||br||We have a happy home prepared on high,||br||||sp||||sp||We have a Saviour whose surpassing love||br||Made Him content e’en for our sins to die;||br||||sp||||sp||He fought, and has our cruel foes o’ercome||br||||sp||||sp||And has engaged to guard, and bring us safely home.

Yes! blessed is our portion! blessed He,||br||Who, in His grace before the world began,||br||||sp||||sp||Did set on us His love, sovereign and free,||br||On us the sinful heirs of dying man:||br||||sp||||sp||And blest us with all blessings in His Son||br||||sp||||sp||Whose priceless love our hearts from sin and folly won.

O solemn hour! O hour alone||br||In solitary might,||br||||sp||||sp||When God the Father’s only Son,||br||||sp||||sp||As man for sinners to atone,||br||Expires—amazing sight!||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord of glory crucified!||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord of life has bled and died!

O mystery of mysteries!||br||Of life and death the tree;||br||||sp||||sp||Center of two eternities,||br||||sp||||sp||Which look with rapt adoring eyes,||br||Onward and back to Thee—||br||||sp||||sp||O cross of Christ, where all His pain||br||||sp||||sp||And death in our eternal gain.

O how our inmost hearts do move,||br||While gazing on that cross;||br||||sp||||sp||The death of the Incarnate Love!||br||||sp||||sp||What shame, what grief, what joy we prove,||br||That He should die for us!||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts were broken by that cry,||br||||sp||||sp||“Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?”

Worthy of death, O Lord we were;||br||That vengeance was our due;||br||||sp||||sp||In grace Thy spotless Lamb did bear||br||||sp||||sp||Himself our sins, and guilt and shame;||br||Justice our Surety slew,||br||||sp||||sp||With Him, our Surety we have died,||br||||sp||||sp||With Him we there were crucified.

Quickened with Him with life divine,||br||Raised with Him from the dead;||br||||sp||||sp||His own and all His own are Thine,||br||||sp||||sp||Shall with Him in His glories shine,||br||His church’s living Head!||br||||sp||||sp||We, who were worthy but to die,||br||||sp||||sp||Now with Him, “Abba, Father,” cry.
Lord, we rejoice that Thou art gone||br||||sp||||sp||To sit upon Thy Father’s throne;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy path of shame and suffering o’er,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy heart shall grieve and mourn no more.
With joy our wondering hearts retrace||br||||sp||||sp||Thy ways on earth of power and grace;||br||||sp||||sp||We sit as learners at Thy feet,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy words than honey far more sweet.
O cross of Christ! O glorious tree!||br||||sp||||sp||What place can be compared with thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Where God’s own Son was crucified,||br||||sp||||sp||And for our sins a ransom died?
We love to look within the tomb,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy death has robbed of all its gloom;||br||||sp||||sp||The stone forever rolled away;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy death the power of death did slay.
We joy to see Thee, Lord, arise||br||||sp||||sp||Triumphant through the opening skies;||br||||sp||||sp||And hear all heaven united own||br||||sp||||sp||Thee worthy to ascend the throne.
Lord, now we wait for Thee to come,||br||||sp||||sp||And take us to Thy Father’s home;||br||||sp||||sp||Oh what ecstatic joy ’twill be||br||||sp||||sp||To spend eternity with Thee!
Look, look, ye saints, within the veil||br||And raise your happy song;||br||||sp||||sp||Your joys can never, never fail,||br||For you to Christ belong.
O happy saints, forever freed||br||From guilt and every care;||br||||sp||||sp||Dwell, dwell with your exalted Head,||br||And let your life be there.
And glory in your Lord and God;||br||See, see Him as He is;||br||||sp||||sp||Your robes are spotless through His blood,||br||Your happiness is His.
O think not of this world of woe,||br||Though subject still to grief;||br||||sp||||sp||But seek your portion there to know,||br||For this will give relief.
Aye trust, forever trust in God,||br||For every promise given;||br||||sp||||sp||And dwell with Him through Jesus’ blood||br||Within the veil of heaven.

Soon will the Master come: soon pass away||br||Our times of conflict, grief, and suffering here;||br||||sp||||sp||Our night of weeping end in cloudless day||br||And sorrow’s moment like a dream appear;||br||||sp||||sp||Eternity—with Jesus—in the skies—||br||||sp||||sp||How soon that Sun of righteousness may rise!

We shall behold Him, whom not seen we love,||br||We shall be with Him, whom we long to see;||br||||sp||||sp||We shall be like Him, fit for realms above,||br||With Him, and like Him, for eternity!||br||||sp||||sp||Is now to sit at Jesus’ feet our choice?||br||||sp||||sp||How will fruition then our souls rejoice!

Lord, what is man? ’Tis He who died||br||And all Thy nature glorified;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy righteousness and grace displayed||br||When He for sin atonement made;||br||||sp||||sp||Obedient unto death, was slain—||br||||sp||||sp||Worthy is He o’er all to reign.

Thy counsels ’ere the world began,||br||All centered in the Son of man;||br||||sp||||sp||Him destined to the highest place,||br||Head of His church through sovereign grace||br||||sp||||sp||To Him enthroned in majesty,||br||||sp||||sp||Let every creature bend the knee.

Worthy, O Son of man, art Thou||br||Of every crown that decks Thy brow;||br||||sp||||sp||Worthy art Thou to be adored,||br||And owned as universal Lord;||br||||sp||||sp||O, hasten that long-promised day,||br||||sp||||sp||When all shall own Thy rightful sway!

Our hearts are full of Christ, and long||br||Their glorious matter to declare!||br||||sp||||sp||Of Him we make our loftier song—||br||We cannot from His praise forbear:||br||||sp||||sp||Our ready tongues make haste to sing||br||||sp||||sp||The glories of the heavenly King.

Fairer than all the earth-born race,||br||Perfect in comeliness Thou art;||br||||sp||||sp||Replenished are Thy lips with grace,||br||And full of love Thy tender heart.||br||||sp||||sp||God ever blest! we bow the knee,||br||||sp||||sp||And own all fullness dwells in Thee.

Happy they who trust in Jesus;||br||Sweet their portion is and sure||br||||sp||||sp||When the foe on others seizes,||br||He will keep His own secure.||br||||sp||||sp||Happy people!||br||Happy, though despised and poor.

Since His love and mercy found us,||br||We are precious in His sight;||br||||sp||||sp||Thousands now may fall around us,||br||Thousands more be put to flight,||br||||sp||||sp||But His presence||br||Keeps us safe by day and night.

Lo! our Saviour never slumbers,||br||Ever watchful is His care;||br||||sp||||sp||Though we cannot boast of numbers||br||In His strength secure we are.||br||||sp||||sp||Sweet their portion,||br||Who our Saviour’s kindness share.

As the bird beneath her feathers,||br||Guards the objects of her care,||br||||sp||||sp||So the Lord His children gathers,||br||Spreads His wings and hides them there:||br||||sp||||sp||Thus protected||br||All their foes they boldly dare.
Everlasting glory be,||br||||sp||||sp||God and Father, unto Thee!||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis with joy Thy children raise||br||||sp||||sp||Hearts and voice in Thy praise.
Thou the light that showed our sin,||br||||sp||||sp||Showed how guilty we had been:||br||||sp||||sp||Thine the love that us to save||br||||sp||||sp||Thine own Son for sinners gave.
Called to share the rest of God||br||||sp||||sp||In the Father’s blest abode,||br||||sp||||sp||God of love, and God of light,||br||||sp||||sp||In Thy praises we unite.
Gladly we Thy grace proclaim,||br||||sp||||sp||Knowing now the Father’s name:||br||||sp||||sp||God and Father, unto Thee||br||||sp||||sp||Everlasting glory be!

O God whose wondrous name is Love,||br||Whose grace has fashioned us anew,||br||||sp||||sp||Before Thy face now stands the Lamb,||br||Whom sinful man once pierced and slew;||br||||sp||||sp||For us Thy Son Thou didst not spare,||br||||sp||||sp||For us canst Thou cease to care?

O heavenly Father, grant us all||br||The newborn babe’s simplicity!||br||||sp||||sp||From us the doubtful mind remove;||br||We boast a God that cannot lie!||br||||sp||||sp||Taught to repose, through love divine,||br||||sp||||sp||On truth itself, on truth divine.

Thou art the Potter, we the clay,||br||Thy will be ours, Thy truth our light,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy love the fountain of our joy,||br||Thine arm a safeguard day and night,||br||||sp||||sp||Till Thou shalt wipe all tears away,||br||||sp||||sp||And bring forth everlasting day.

O that we never might forget||br||What Christ has suffered for our sake,||br||||sp||||sp||To save our souls and make us meet||br||Of all Thy glories to partake;||br||||sp||||sp||But keeping this in mind press on||br||||sp||||sp||To glory and the victor’s crown.

But, gracious Lord, when we reflect||br||How apt to turn the eye from Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Forget Thee, too, with sad neglect,||br||And listen to the enemy,||br||||sp||||sp||And yet to find Thee still the same—||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis this that humbles us with shame.

Astonished at Thy feet we fall,||br||Thy love exceeds our highest thought,||br||||sp||||sp||Henceforth be Thou our all in all,||br||Thou who our souls with blood hast bought;||br||||sp||||sp||May we henceforth more faithful prove,||br||||sp||||sp||And ne’er forget Thy ceaseless love.

’Mid scenes of confusion, and creature-complaints,||br||||sp||||sp||How sweet to the soul is communion with saints;||br||||sp||||sp||To find at the banquet of mercy there’s room,||br||||sp||||sp||To feel in communion a foretaste of ||i||home.||/i||

Sweet bonds that unite all the children of peace!||br||||sp||||sp||And thrice-blessed Saviour whose love cannot cease!||br||||sp||||sp||Though oft amid trials and dangers we roam,||br||||sp||||sp||With Thine we’re united, and hasting towards ||i||home.||/i||

While here, in the valley of conflict, we stay,||br||||sp||||sp||O give us submission and strength as the day:||br||||sp||||sp||Soon free from afflictions, to Thee we shall come,||br||||sp||||sp||And find with our Saviour a heavenly ||i||home.||/i||

Whate’er Thou deniest, O give us Thy grace,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy Spirit’s blest witness, the smiles of Thy face;||br||||sp||||sp||And grant us still patience to wait at Thy throne,||br||||sp||||sp||And find, never-ceasing, the foretaste of ||i||home.||/i||

We wait, blessed Lord in Thy beauties to shine,||br||||sp||||sp||To see Thee in glory—the glory divine;||br||||sp||||sp||With all Thy redeemed, from the earth, from the tomb,||br||||sp||||sp||To be to Thy praise, blessed Saviour at ||i||home.||/i||

And art Thou, gracious Master, gone||br||For us a mansion to prepare?||br||||sp||||sp||Shall we behold Thee on the throne,||br||And sit forever with Thee there?||br||||sp||||sp||Then let the world approve or blame,||br||||sp||||sp||We’ll triumph in Thy glorious name.

Should we to gain the world’s applause,||br||Or to escape its harmless frown,||br||||sp||||sp||Refuse to countenance Thy cause,||br||And make Thy people’s lot our own,||br||||sp||||sp||What shame would fill us in that day,||br||||sp||||sp||When Thou Thy glory wilt display.

No, let the world cast out our name,||br||And vile account us if it will,||br||||sp||||sp||If to confess our Lord be shame,||br||Oh, then would we be viler still;||br||||sp||||sp||For Thee, O Lord, we all resign,||br||||sp||||sp||Content that Thou dost call us Thine.

What transports then will fill our heart||br||When Thou our worthless names wilt own,||br||||sp||||sp||When we shall see Thee as Thou art||br||And know as we ourselves are known.||br||||sp||||sp||And then from sin and sorrow free||br||||sp||||sp||Find our eternal rest with Thee.

hymn.author: Dr. Rossier, tr. by Miss Wellesley

stanza.text: Lord, e’en to death Thy love could go,||br||A death of shame and loss,||br||||sp||||sp||To vanquish for us every foe,||br||And break the strong man’s force.
Oh! what a load was Thine to bear||br||Alone in that dark hour,||br||||sp||||sp||Our sins in all their terror there,||br||God’s wrath and Satan’s power.
The storm that bowed Thy blessed head||br||Is hushed forever now,||br||||sp||||sp||And rest divine is ours instead,||br||Whilst glory crowns Thy brow.
Within the Father’s house on high||br||We soon shall sing Thy praise,||br||||sp||||sp||But here where Thou didst bleed and die,||br||We learn that song to raise.

Join all the glorious names||br||Of wisdom, love and power,||br||||sp||||sp||That mortals ever knew,||br||That angels ever bore;||br||||sp||||sp||All are too mean to speak His worth,||br||||sp||||sp||Too mean to set the Saviour forth.

Great Prophet of our God!||br||Our tongues must bless Thy name,||br||||sp||||sp||By whom the joyful news||br||Of free salvation came;||br||||sp||||sp||The joyful news of sins forgiven,||br||||sp||||sp||Of hell subdued, of peace with heaven.

Thou art our Counsellor,||br||Our Pattern, and our Guide,||br||||sp||||sp||And Thou our Shepherd art;||br||Ah! keep us near Thy side;||br||||sp||||sp||Nor let our feet e’er turn astray,||br||||sp||||sp||To wander in the crooked way.

We love the Shepherd’s voice:||br||His watchful eyes shall keep||br||||sp||||sp||Our pilgrim souls among||br||The thousands of God’s sheep;||br||||sp||||sp||He feeds His flock, He calls their names,||br||||sp||||sp||And gently leads the tender lambs.

O happy morn! the Lord will come||br||||sp||||sp||And take His waiting people home||br||Beyond the reach of care;||br||||sp||||sp||Where guilt and sin are all unknown:||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord will come and claim His own,||br||||sp||||sp||And place them with Him in His throne,||br||The glory bright to share.

The resurrection morn will break,||br||||sp||||sp||And every sleeping saint awake,||br||Brought forth in light again;||br||||sp||||sp||O morn, too bright for mortal eyes!||br||||sp||||sp||When all the ransomed church shall rise||br||||sp||||sp||And wing their way to yonder skies—||br||Called up with Christ to reign.

O Lord! our pilgrim spirits long||br||||sp||||sp||To sing the everlasting song||br||Of glory, honor, power;||br||||sp||||sp||Till then when Thou all power shalt wield,||br||||sp||||sp||Blest Saviour, Thou wilt be our shield,||br||||sp||||sp||For Thou hast to our souls revealed||br||Thyself our strength and tower.
O Lord! when we the path retrace||br||Which Thou on earth hast trod,||br||||sp||||sp||To man Thy wondrous love and grace,||br||Thy faithfulness to God;
Thy love, by man so sorely tried,||br||Proved stronger than the grave;||br||||sp||||sp||The very spear that pierced Thy side||br||Drew forth the blood to save;
Faithful amidst unfaithfulness,||br||’Mid darkness only light,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou didst Thy Father’s name confess,||br||And in His will delight;
Unmoved by Satan’s subtle wiles,||br||Or suffering, shame and loss,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy path uncheered by earthly smiles,||br||Led only to the cross:—
We wonder at Thy lowly mind,||br||And fain would like Thee be,||br||||sp||||sp||And all our rest and pleasure find||br||In learning more of Thee.

We’re pilgrims in the wilderness;||br||Our dwelling is a camp;||br||||sp||||sp||Created things though pleasant,||br||Now bear to us death’s stamp.||br||||sp||||sp||But onward we are speeding,||br||Though often let and tried;||br||||sp||||sp||The Holy Ghost is leading||br||Home to the Lamb, His bride.

With fellow-pilgrims meeting,||br||As through the waste we roam,||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis sweet to sing together,||br||“We are not far from home!”||br||||sp||||sp||And when we’ve learned our lesson,||br||Our work, in suffering, done,||br||||sp||||sp||Our ever-loving Father||br||Will welcome every one.

We look to meet our brethren||br||From every distant shore;||br||||sp||||sp||Not one will seem a stranger,||br||Though never seen before:||br||||sp||||sp||With angel hosts attending,||br||In myriads, through the sky;||br||||sp||||sp||Yet ’midst them all Thou only,||br||O Lord, wilt fix the eye!

Lord, since we sing as pilgrims,||br||O give us pilgrims’ ways!||br||||sp||||sp||Low thoughts of self, befitting||br||Proclaimers of Thy praise;||br||||sp||||sp||O make us each more holy,||br||In spirit, pure and meek:||br||||sp||||sp||More like to heavenly citizens,||br||As more of heaven we speak.

Rock of Ages! cleft for sin,||br||||sp||||sp||Grace hath hid us safe within!||br||||sp||||sp||Where the water and the blood,||br||||sp||||sp||From Thy riven side hath flowed,||br||||sp||||sp||Are of sin the double cure;||br||||sp||||sp||Cleansing from its guilt and power.

Not the labor of our hands||br||||sp||||sp||Could fulfill the law’s demands;||br||||sp||||sp||Could our zeal no respite know,||br||||sp||||sp||Could our tears forever flow,||br||||sp||||sp||Naught for sin could e’er atone||br||||sp||||sp||But Thy blood and Thine alone!

Found by Thee before we sought,||br||||sp||||sp||Unto Thee in mercy brought;||br||||sp||||sp||We have Thee for righteousness,||br||||sp||||sp||From Thy fullness grace on grace:||br||||sp||||sp||Thou hast washed us in Thy blood,||br||||sp||||sp||Made us live and live to God.

While we draw this fleeting breath,||br||||sp||||sp||If our eyes are closed in death,||br||||sp||||sp||When we soar to worlds unknown,||br||||sp||||sp||Sit with Thee upon Thy throne:||br||||sp||||sp||Thou our joy shalt be in heaven,||br||||sp||||sp||Who for us Thyself hast given.
Hark! the choirs of angels crying,||br||Glory to the Lamb once slain,||br||||sp||||sp||None in heaven or earth denying||br||Tribute to the Saviour’s name.
Ye for whom His life was given,||br||Higher themes to you belong,||br||||sp||||sp||Wake then here the joy of heaven,||br||Raise the everlasting song.
See how God hath now enthroned Him||br||At His own right hand on high,||br||||sp||||sp||There the heavenly hosts have owned Him,||br||Filling with His praise the sky.
Filled with blest anticipation,||br||Chant as soon to be above;||br||||sp||||sp||Sweet the theme—a free salvation,||br||Fruit of everlasting love.
Endless life in Him possessing,||br||Let us praise His glorious name,||br||||sp||||sp||Glory, honor, power, and blessing||br||Be forever to the Lamb.

We’re not of the world which fadeth away,||br||||sp||||sp||We’re not of the night, but children of day;||br||||sp||||sp||The chains that once bound us by Jesus are riven,||br||||sp||||sp||We’re strangers on earth, our home is in heaven.

Our path is most rugged, and dangerous too,||br||||sp||||sp||A wide trackless waste our journey lies through;||br||||sp||||sp||But the pillar of cloud that shows us our way,||br||||sp||||sp||Is our sure light by night, and shades us by day.

Our Shepherd is still our Guardian and Guide,||br||||sp||||sp||Before us He goes to help and provide:||br||||sp||||sp||The springs that refresh us from heaven were given,||br||||sp||||sp||Our bread is the Manna that came down from heaven.

’Mid mightiest foes most feeble are we—||br||||sp||||sp||Yet, trembling before our great Leader they flee;||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord is our Banner, the battle is His,||br||||sp||||sp||The weakest of saints more than conqueror is.

And soon shall we enter our own promised land,||br||||sp||||sp||Around His bright throne in glory shall stand:||br||||sp||||sp||Our song then forever and ever shall be,||br||||sp||||sp||||i||All glory and blessing, Lord Jesus, to Thee!||/i||
We’ll praise Thee, glorious Lord,||br||Who died to set us free,||br||||sp||||sp||No earthly songs can joy afford||br||Like heavenly melody.
Love, that no suffering stayed,||br||We’ll praise, true love divine;||br||||sp||||sp||Love that for us atonement made,||br||Love that has made us Thine.
Love in Thy lonely life||br||Of sorrow here below;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy words of grace, with mercy rife,||br||Make grateful praises flow.
Love, that on death’s dark vale||br||Its sweetest odors spread,||br||||sp||||sp||Where sin o’er all seemed to prevail||br||Redemption’s glory shed.
And now we see Thee risen,||br||Who once for us hast died,||br||||sp||||sp||Seated above the highest heaven:||br||The Father’s glorified.
Soon wilt Thou take Thy throne,||br||Thy foes Thy footstool made,||br||||sp||||sp||And take us with Thee for Thine own,||br||In glory love displayed.
Jesus, we wait for Thee,||br||With Thee to have our part;||br||||sp||||sp||What can full joy and blessing be||br||But being where Thou art?
O gracious Father! God of love,||br||We own Thy power to save,||br||||sp||||sp||That power by which the Shepherd rose||br||Victorious o’er the grave.
Him from the dead Thou brought’st again,||br||When, by His sacred blood,||br||||sp||||sp||Confirmed and sealed forevermore,||br||Th’ eternal covenant stood.
O may Thy Spirit guide our souls,||br||And mould them to Thy will,||br||||sp||||sp||That from Thy paths we ne’er may stray,||br||But keep Thy precepts still!
That to the Saviour’s stature full||br||We nearer still may rise,||br||||sp||||sp||And all we think, and all we do||br||Be pleasing in Thy eyes.
Rejoice, ye saints, rejoice and praise||br||||sp||||sp||The blessings of redeeming grace;||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus, our everlasting tower,||br||||sp||||sp||Mocks at the angry tempest’s roar.
His love’s a refuge ever nigh,||br||||sp||||sp||His watchfulness, a mountain high;||br||||sp||||sp||His name’s a rock, which winds above||br||||sp||||sp||Nor waves below can ever move.
His faithfulness, forever sure,||br||||sp||||sp||For endless ages will endure;||br||||sp||||sp||His perfect work will ever prove||br||||sp||||sp||The depths of His unchanging love.
While all things change, He changes not,||br||||sp||||sp||Nor e’er forgets, though oft forgot;||br||||sp||||sp||His love’s unchangeably the same,||br||||sp||||sp||And as enduring as His name.

Our Shepherd is the Lord,||br||The living Lord who died;||br||||sp||||sp||With all His fullness can afford||br||||sp||||sp||We are supplied.||br||||sp||||sp||He richly feeds our souls||br||With blessings from above;||br||||sp||||sp||And leads us where the river rolls||br||||sp||||sp||Of endless love.

Our souls He doth restore,||br||And keeps us in His way;||br||||sp||||sp||He makes our cup of joy run o’er||br||||sp||||sp||From day to day;||br||||sp||||sp||Through love so full, so deep,||br||Anointed is our head;||br||||sp||||sp||Mercy and goodness us shall keep,||br||||sp||||sp||Where’er we tread.

When faith and hope shall cease,||br||And love abide alone,||br||||sp||||sp||Then shall we see Him face to face,||br||||sp||||sp||And know as known:||br||||sp||||sp||Still shall we lift our voice,||br||His praise our song shall be;||br||||sp||||sp||And we shall in His love rejoice||br||||sp||||sp||Who set us free.
To us our God His love commends,||br||When by our sins undone;||br||||sp||||sp||That He might spare His enemies,||br||He would not spare His Son;
His only Son, on whom was placed||br||His whole delight and love,||br||||sp||||sp||Before He formed the earth below,||br||Or spread the heavens above.
Our sorrows and our guilt to bear,||br||Our judgment to sustain;||br||||sp||||sp||He came, upon the tree to die,||br||That we might life obtain.
His word assures He’ll quickly come,||br||For this His brethren pray;||br||||sp||||sp||The whole creation for it groans,||br||Come, Lord, without delay!
The gloomy night will soon be past,||br||The morning will appear;||br||||sp||||sp||The harbinger of day at last||br||Each waiting eye will cheer.
Thou Bright and Morning Star, Thy light||br||Will to our joy be seen;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou, Lord, wilt meet our longing sight,||br||Without a cloud between.

Saviour, through the desert lead us,||br||Without Thee we cannot go;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou from cruel chains has freed us,||br||And hast laid the tyrant low:||br||||sp||||sp||Let Thy presence||br||Cheer us all our journey through.

Through a desert waste and cheerless,||br||Though our destined journey lie,||br||||sp||||sp||Rendered by Thy presence fearless,||br||We may every foe defy:||br||||sp||||sp||Naught shall move us,||br||While we see Thee, Saviour, nigh.

With a price Thy love has bought us,||br||(Saviour, what a love is Thine!)||br||||sp||||sp||Hitherto Thy power has brought us,||br||(Power and love in Thee combine):||br||||sp||||sp||Lord of glory,||br||Ever on Thy household shine.

||i||Sing aloud to God, our strength;||br||||/i||He has brought us hitherto:||br||||sp||||sp||He will bring us home at length;||br||This the Lord our God will do:||br||||sp||||sp||Doubt not, for His word is stable;||br||||sp||||sp||Fear not, for His arm is able.

||i||Sing aloud to God, our strength;||br||||/i||Sing with wonder of His love;||br||||sp||||sp||Who can tell its breadth or length,||br||Who below, or who above?||br||||sp||||sp||Who its depth and height can measure?||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis a rich unbounded treasure!

||i||Sing aloud to God, our strength;||br||||/i||He is with us where we go;||br||||sp||||sp||Fear we not the journey’s length,||br||Fear we not the mighty foe:||br||||sp||||sp||All our foes shall be defeated,||br||||sp||||sp||And our journey safe completed.
O Lord! we would delight in Thee,||br||And on Thy care depend;||br||||sp||||sp||To Thee in every trouble flee,||br||Our safe, unfailing Friend.
When human cisterns all are dried,||br||Thy fullness is the same;||br||||sp||||sp||May we with this be satisfied,||br||And glory in Thy name.
No good in creatures can be found,||br||All, all is found in Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||We must have all things and abound,||br||Through Thy sufficiency.
Thou that hast made our heaven secure,||br||Wilt here all good provide;||br||||sp||||sp||While Christ is rich, can we be poor?||br||Christ who for us has died!
O Lord! we cast each care on Thee,||br||And triumph and adore;||br||||sp||||sp||O that our great concern may be||br||To love and praise Thee more.

That bright and blessed morn is near||br||||sp||||sp||When He, the Bridegroom, shall appear,||br||And call His bride away.||br||||sp||||sp||Her blessing then shall be complete,||br||||sp||||sp||When with her Lord she takes her seat||br||In everlasting day.

The days and nights are gliding past,||br||||sp||||sp||Soon shall be heard the trumpet’s blast||br||Which wakes the sleeping saints.||br||||sp||||sp||The dead in Christ in glory rise,||br||||sp||||sp||When we with them shall reach the skies||br||Where Jesus for us waits.

What wonder, joy, and glad surprise||br||||sp||||sp||Shall fill our hearts as thus we rise||br||To meet Him in the air;||br||||sp||||sp||To see His face, to hear His voice,||br||||sp||||sp||And in His perfect love rejoice,||br||Whose glory then we’ll share.

No more deferred our hope shall be,||br||||sp||||sp||No longer through a glass we’ll see,||br||But clearly face to face.||br||||sp||||sp||We’ll dwell with Jesus then above,||br||||sp||||sp||Whom absent we have learned to love,||br||Blest samples of His grace.

O may this hope our spirits cheer,||br||||sp||||sp||While waiting for our Saviour here;||br||He’ll quickly come again.||br||||sp||||sp||O may our hearts look for that day,||br||||sp||||sp||And to His word responsive say,||br||“Come, Jesus, Lord, Amen.”

On that same night, Lord Jesus,||br||When all around Thee joined||br||||sp||||sp||To cast its darkest shadow||br||Across Thy holy mind,||br||||sp||||sp||We hear Thy voice, blest Saviour,||br||“This do, remember me:”||br||||sp||||sp||With joyful hearts responding,||br||We do remember Thee.

The depth of all Thy suffering||br||No heart could e’er conceive;||br||||sp||||sp||The cup of wrath o’erflowing||br||For us Thou didst receive;||br||||sp||||sp||And, oh! of God forsaken,||br||On the accursed tree.||br||||sp||||sp||With grateful hearts, Lord Jesus,||br||We now remember Thee.

We think of all the darkness||br||Which round Thy spirit pressed,||br||||sp||||sp||Of all those waves and billows||br||Which rolled across Thy breast.||br||||sp||||sp||Oh, there Thy grace unbounded||br||And perfect love we see;||br||||sp||||sp||With joy and sorrow mingling,||br||We would remember Thee.

We know Thee now as risen,||br||The Firstborn from the dead;||br||||sp||||sp||We see Thee now ascended,||br||The church’s glorious Head.||br||||sp||||sp||In Thee by grace accepted,||br||The heart and mind set free,||br||||sp||||sp||To think of all Thy sorrow,||br||And thus remember Thee.

Till Thou shalt come in glory,||br||And call us hence away,||br||||sp||||sp||To rest in all the brightness||br||Of that unclouded day,||br||||sp||||sp||We show Thy death, Lord Jesus,||br||And here would seek to be||br||||sp||||sp||More to Thy death conformèd,||br||Whilst we remember Thee.
From every stormy wind that blows,||br||||sp||||sp||From every swelling tide of woes,||br||||sp||||sp||There is a calm, a sweet retreat;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis found before the mercy-seat.
There is a place where mercy sheds||br||||sp||||sp||The oil of gladness on our heads;||br||||sp||||sp||A place than all beside more sweet—||br||||sp||||sp||It is the heavenly mercy-seat.
There is a place where souls unite,||br||||sp||||sp||And saint meets saint in heavenly light;||br||||sp||||sp||Though sundered far, by faith they meet||br||||sp||||sp||Before the common mercy-seat.
Ah! whither could we flee for aid||br||||sp||||sp||When tempted, desolate, dismayed?||br||||sp||||sp||Or how the hosts of hell defeat,||br||||sp||||sp||Had suffering saints no mercy-seat?
Thither by faith we upward soar,||br||||sp||||sp||And time and sense seem all no more,||br||||sp||||sp||For freely God our souls can greet||br||||sp||||sp||Where glory crowns the Mercy-seat.

Of Thy love some gracious token||br||Grant us, Lord, before we go;||br||||sp||||sp||Bless Thy word which has been spoken,||br||Life and peace on all bestow,||br||When we join the world again,||br||May our hearts with Thee remain:||br||||sp||||sp||O direct us and protect us,||br||Till we gain the heavenly shore,||br||Where Thy people want no more.

Henceforward, till the Lord shall come||br||||sp||||sp||To take His whole redeemèd home,||br||(With Him forever then);||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord send blessings from above,||br||||sp||||sp||The Father’s, Son’s, and Spirit’s love,||br||Be with us all. Amen.
O Lord, in Thee believing,||br||Our souls have peace with God,||br||||sp||||sp||Eternal life receiving,||br||The purchase of Thy blood.
Our curse and condemnation||br||Thou barest in our stead;||br||||sp||||sp||Secure is our salvation,||br||In Thee, our risen Head.
The Holy Ghost, revealing||br||Thy grace, hath given us rest,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy stripes have been our healing,||br||Thy love doth make us blest.
In Thee the Father sees us||br||Accepted and complete;||br||||sp||||sp||Grace which from evil frees us,||br||For glory makes us meet.

From various cares our hearts retire,||br||||sp||||sp||Though deep and boundless their desire,||br||We’ve now to please but One;||br||||sp||||sp||Him, before whom each knee shall bow,||br||||sp||||sp||With Him is all our business now,||br||And those that are His own.

With these our happy lot is cast,||br||||sp||||sp||Through the world’s deserts rude and waste,||br||Or through its gardens fair;||br||||sp||||sp||Whether the storms of trouble sweep,||br||||sp||||sp||Or all in dead supineness sleep,||br||T’ advance be all our care.

O Lord, the way, the truth, the life!||br||||sp||||sp||Henceforth let sorrow, doubt, and strife||br||Drop off like autumn leaves!||br||||sp||||sp||Henceforth, as privileged by Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Simple and undistracted be||br||Our souls, which to Thee cleave.

Let us our feebleness recline||br||||sp||||sp||On that eternal love of Thine,||br||And human thoughts forget;||br||||sp||||sp||Childlike attend what Thou wilt say,||br||||sp||||sp||Go forth and serve Thee while ’tis day,||br||Nor leave our sweet retreat.
Lord Jesus Christ, our Saviour Thou,||br||With joy we worship Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||We know Thou hast redeemèd us,||br||By dying on the tree.
We know the love that brought Thee down,||br||Down from that bliss in high,||br||||sp||||sp||To meet our ruined souls in need,||br||On Calvary’s cross to die.
Our Saviour Jesus—Lord Thou art,||br||Eternal is Thy love;||br||||sp||||sp||Eternal, too, our songs of praise||br||When with Thee, Lord, above.
E’en now we praise the grace divine,||br||The love that shines in Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||The rich One Thou—for us made poor,||br||By death to set us free.
We praise, we worship, we adore,||br||As round Thyself we meet;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy beauty, Lord, our souls transports,||br||While bowing at Thy feet.
Our theme of praise art Thou alone,||br||Thy cross, Thy work, Thy word:||br||||sp||||sp||Oh! who can fathom all Thy love,||br||Thou living blessed Lord?
Sweet the moments which, in blessing,||br||Musing o’er the cross we spend;||br||||sp||||sp||Life and health and peace possessing||br||From the dying sinner’s Friend.
Here we rest—in wonder viewing||br||All our guilt on Jesus laid!||br||||sp||||sp||And a full redemption flowing||br||From the sacrifice He made.
Here we find the dawn of heaven,||br||While upon the Lamb we gaze,||br||||sp||||sp||See our trespasses forgiven,||br||And our songs of triumph raise.
Oh! that strong in faith abiding,||br||We may to the Saviour cleave,||br||||sp||||sp||Naught with Him our hearts dividing,||br||All for Him content to leave.
May we still, God’s mind discerning,||br||To the Lamb for wisdom go:||br||||sp||||sp||There new wonders daily learning,||br||All the depths of mercy know.
Since Christ and we are one,||br||What room for doubt or fear?||br||||sp||||sp||He sits upon the Father’s throne,||br||And we are in Him there.
The Spirit doth unite||br||Our souls to Him our Head,||br||||sp||||sp||And forms us to His image bright||br||While in His steps we tread.
And grace it is—free grace—||br||Which keeps us on the road,||br||||sp||||sp||Till we behold the Saviour’s face,||br||And city of our God.
Death and judgment are behind us,||br||Grace and glory are before;||br||||sp||||sp||All the billows rolled o’er Jesus,||br||There they spent their utmost power.
“First fruits” of the resurrection,||br||He is risen from the tomb;||br||||sp||||sp||Now we stand in new creation,||br||Free, because beyond our doom.
Jesus died, and we died with Him,||br||“Buried” in His grave we lay,||br||||sp||||sp||One with Him in resurrection,||br||Now “in Him” in heaven’s bright day.
The Prince of Life, once slain for us,||br||Is now gone up on high;||br||||sp||||sp||Captivity was captive led,||br||And Christ no more can die.
His word is faithfulness and truth—||br||“Behold, I quickly come;”||br||||sp||||sp||And faith, that counts the promise sure,||br||Can pierce the midnight gloom.
Far spent already in the night,||br||In hope we hail the day||br||||sp||||sp||Of the belovèd Lord’s return,||br||To wipe all tears away.
Jesus, at the appointed hour,||br||In glory shall appear;||br||||sp||||sp||Then, fashioned by His mighty hand,||br||We shall His image bear.
Soon shall the saints with glory crowned||br||Dwell in that cloudless light,||br||||sp||||sp||And see their Lord in glory owned,||br||Heaven’s constant, sweet delight.
Praise the Saviour, ye who know Him,||br||||sp||||sp||Who can tell how much we owe Him?||br||||sp||||sp||Gladly let us render to Him||br||||sp||||sp||All we have and are.
Jesus is the name that charms us,||br||||sp||||sp||He for conflict fits and arms us,||br||||sp||||sp||Nothing moves and nothing harms us||br||||sp||||sp||While we trust in Him.
Trust in Him, ye saints forever,||br||||sp||||sp||He is faithful, changing never;||br||||sp||||sp||Neither force nor guile can sever||br||||sp||||sp||Those He loves from Him.
Keep us Lord, O keep us cleaving||br||||sp||||sp||To Thyself and still believing,||br||||sp||||sp||Till the hour of our receiving||br||||sp||||sp||Promised joys with Thee.
Then we shall be where we would be,||br||||sp||||sp||Then we shall be what we should be;||br||||sp||||sp||Things that are not now nor could be||br||||sp||||sp||Soon shall be our own.

Himself He could not save,||br||He on the cross must die,||br||||sp||||sp||Or mercy cannot come||br||To ruined sinners nigh;||br||||sp||||sp||Yes, Christ the Son of God must bleed,||br||||sp||||sp||That sinners might from sin be freed.

Himself He could not save,||br||For justice must be done;||br||||sp||||sp||Our sin’s full weight must fall||br||Upon the sinless One;||br||||sp||||sp||For nothing less can God accept||br||||sp||||sp||In payment of that fearful debt.

Himself He could not save,||br||For He the Surety stood||br||||sp||||sp||For all who now rely||br||Upon His precious blood;||br||||sp||||sp||He bore the penalty of guilt||br||||sp||||sp||When on the cross His blood was spilt.

Himself He could not save,||br||Love’s stream too deeply flowed,||br||||sp||||sp||In love Himself He gave,||br||To pay the debt we owed.||br||||sp||||sp||Obedience to His Father’s will,||br||||sp||||sp||And love to Him did all fulfill.

And now exalted high—||br||A Prince and Saviour He,||br||||sp||||sp||That sinners might draw nigh||br||And drink of mercy free,||br||||sp||||sp||Of mercy now so richly shed,||br||||sp||||sp||For Jesus liveth who was dead.

From Egypt lately come,||br||Where death and darkness reign,||br||||sp||||sp||We seek our new, our better home,||br||Where we our rest shall gain:||br||||sp||||sp||Hallelujah!||br||We are on our way to God.

There sin and sorrow cease,||br||And, every conflict o’er,||br||||sp||||sp||There we shall dwell in endless peace,||br||And never hunger more.||br||||sp||||sp||Hallelujah!||br||We are on our way to God.

How sweet the prospect is!||br||It cheers the pilgrim’s breast;||br||||sp||||sp||We’re journeying through the wilderness,||br||But soon shall gain our rest;||br||||sp||||sp||Hallelujah!||br||We are on our way to God.
Ah, yes, Lord Jesus (Thou whose heart||br||Still for Thy saints doth care),||br||||sp||||sp||We shall behold Thee as Thou art,||br||And Thy full image bear.
Thy love sustains us by the way,||br||While pilgrims here below;||br||||sp||||sp||Thou dost, O Saviour, day by day,||br||Thy suited grace bestow.
But oh! the more we learn of Thee,||br||And Thy rich mercy prove,||br||||sp||||sp||The more we long Thy face to see,||br||And fully prove Thy love.
Then, shine, Thou Bright and Morning Star,||br||Dispel the dreary gloom;||br||||sp||||sp||O take, from sin and grief afar,||br||Thy blood-bought people home!
Lord Jesus, come,||br||And take Thy rightful place||br||||sp||||sp||As Son of man, of all the theme!||br||||sp||||sp||Come, Lord, to reign o’er all supreme,||br||||sp||||sp||Lord Jesus, come!
Lord Jesus, come!||br||The Man of sorrows once,||br||||sp||||sp||The Man of patience waiting now—||br||||sp||||sp||The Man of joy, forever, Thou,||br||||sp||||sp||Come, Saviour, come!
Lord Jesus, come!||br||Crowned with Thy many crowns—||br||||sp||||sp||The Crucified, the Lamb once slain,||br||||sp||||sp||To wash away sin’s crimson stain,||br||||sp||||sp||Lord Jesus, come!
Lord Jesus, come,||br||And take Thy Father’s gift,||br||||sp||||sp||The people by Thy cross made Thine,||br||||sp||||sp||The trophy of Thy love divine!||br||||sp||||sp||Lord Jesus, come!
Lord Jesus, come,||br||That, lost in Thee, our souls||br||||sp||||sp||May bow and worship and adore,||br||||sp||||sp||In Thy blest presence evermore!||br||||sp||||sp||Lord Jesus, come!
Lord Jesus, come,||br||And let Thy glory shine,||br||||sp||||sp||That quickly these changed bodies may||br||||sp||||sp||Each one reflect a living ray,||br||||sp||||sp||Lord Jesus, come!
Lord Jesus, come!||br||Let every knee bow down,||br||||sp||||sp||And every tongue to Thee confess,||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord of all come forth to bless,||br||||sp||||sp||Lord Jesus, come!

Spirit and Bride,||br||With longing voice, say, Come;||br||||sp||||sp||Yea, Lord, Thy word from that bright home||br||||sp||||sp||Is, “Surely, I will quickly come!”||br||||sp||||sp||E’en so, Lord, come.

The holy One who knew no sin,||br||God made Him sin for us;||br||||sp||||sp||The Saviour died our souls to win,||br||Upon the shameful cross.||br||||sp||||sp||His precious blood alone availed||br||To wash our sins away;||br||||sp||||sp||Through weakness He o’er hell prevailed,||br||Through death He won the day.

His beauty shineth far above||br||Our feeble power of praise;||br||||sp||||sp||And we shall live and learn His love||br||Through everlasting days.||br||||sp||||sp||The knowing this, that us He loves,||br||Hath made our cup run o’er;||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus, Thy name our spirit moves,||br||Today and evermore.

To wait for that important day,||br||||sp||||sp||When Christ His glorious power’ll display,||br||Be this our one great care:||br||||sp||||sp||To do His will, our business here;||br||||sp||||sp||No toil to shun, no danger fear;||br||Resolved our cross to bear.

And though He should prolong His stay,||br||||sp||||sp||And sinners mock at the delay,||br||His people need not fear;||br||||sp||||sp||The Man who wore the crown of thorns,||br||||sp||||sp||Whose claim the world rejects and scorns,||br||In glory will appear.

In patience, then, we now may rest||br||||sp||||sp||(Assured the Father’s time is best),||br||And all His word obey:||br||||sp||||sp||We wait till that blest day shall come||br||||sp||||sp||When Jesus will convey us home,||br||And all His power display.

The night is now far spent,||br||The day is drawing nigh,||br||||sp||||sp||Soon will the morning break||br||In radiance through the sky:||br||||sp||||sp||O let the thought our spirits cheer,||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord Himself will soon appear!

Though men our hopes deride,||br||Nor will the truth believe,||br||||sp||||sp||We in His word confide,||br||And it will ne’er deceive:||br||||sp||||sp||Soon all that grieves shall pass away,||br||||sp||||sp||And saints shall see a glorious day.

For us the Lord intends||br||A bright abode on high,||br||||sp||||sp||The place where sorrow ends,||br||And naught is known but joy:||br||||sp||||sp||With such a hope let us rejoice,||br||||sp||||sp||We soon shall hear the Saviour’s voice.
Thou sit’st on high, eternal Word,||br||||sp||||sp||As Son of man, as sovereign Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||And now by faith on Thee we rest,||br||||sp||||sp||Till all Thy title have confessed.

Thou hast our souls from sin made clean,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy Spirit gives us strength within;||br||||sp||||sp||Whilst Thou for us in all our need,||br||||sp||||sp||At God’s right hand dost ever plead.
O keep us in the narrow way,||br||||sp||||sp||That ne’er from Thee our footsteps stray;||br||||sp||||sp||Sustain our weakness, calm our fear,||br||||sp||||sp||And to Thy presence keep us near.
Oh be it thus till that blest day,||br||||sp||||sp||When God shall wipe all tears away;||br||||sp||||sp||Quickly, ’tis promised in the word,||br||||sp||||sp||E’en so, Amen. Come quickly, Lord.

O God of grace, our Father,||br||We bless Thy holy name,||br||||sp||||sp||We who enjoy Thy favor,||br||Made holy, without blame;||br||||sp||||sp||In love, which sought and found us,||br||And brought us nigh to Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||And won the rest of glory,||br||Our heavenly home shall be.

Thy deep eternal counsel||br||Chose us in Christ the Son,||br||||sp||||sp||Before the earth’s foundation,||br||Or sin had yet begun;||br||||sp||||sp||That we might all the nearness||br||Of the Belovèd know,||br||||sp||||sp||And brought to Thee as children||br||Our children’s praises flow.

We worship Thee, our Father,||br||Soon shall Thy children be||br||||sp||||sp||At home in heavenly glory,||br||Thy house their home shall be;||br||||sp||||sp||We worship Thee, our Father,||br||And praise Thy perfect love,||br||||sp||||sp||Soon shall we chant Thy glory||br||In better strains above.
Christ the Lord will come again,||br||||sp||||sp||None shall wait for Him in vain;||br||||sp||||sp||We shall then His glory see;||br||||sp||||sp||His who died to set us free.
Then, when the archangel’s voice||br||||sp||||sp||Calls the sleeping saints to rise,||br||||sp||||sp||Rising millions shall proclaim||br||||sp||||sp||Blessings on the Saviour’s name.
“This is our redeeming God!”||br||||sp||||sp||Ransomed hosts will shout aloud:||br||||sp||||sp||“Praise, eternal praise be given||br||||sp||||sp||To the Lord of earth and heaven!”

A fullness resides in Jesus our Head||br||||sp||||sp||A fullness abides to answer all need:||br||||sp||||sp||The Father’s good pleasure has laid up a store,||br||||sp||||sp||A plentiful treasure, to give to the poor.

Whatever distress awaits us below,||br||||sp||||sp||Such plentiful grace the Lord will bestow,||br||||sp||||sp||As still shall support us and silence our fear,||br||||sp||||sp||And nothing can hurt us while Jesus is near.

When sorrows assail us, or terrors draw nigh,||br||||sp||||sp||His love will not fail us, He’ll guard with His eye;||br||||sp||||sp||And when we are fainting and ready to fail,||br||||sp||||sp||He’ll give what is wanting, and make us prevail.

We trust His protection; we’ll lean on His might;||br||||sp||||sp||We’re sure His direction will guide us aright:||br||||sp||||sp||We know ||i||who||/i|| surrounds us, almighty to save;||br||||sp||||sp||And no one confounds us the Saviour who have.

Salvation’s Captain, and the Guide||br||Of all that seek the rest above,||br||||sp||||sp||Beneath Thy shadow we abide,||br||The cloud of Thy protecting love;||br||||sp||||sp||Our strength Thy grace, our rule Thy word,||br||||sp||||sp||Our end the glory of the Lord.

Lord, by Thy word and Spirit led,||br||We shall not in the desert stray,||br||||sp||||sp||Or light for our direction need,||br||Or lose, if dark and drear, our way;||br||||sp||||sp||Still kept from danger and from fear,||br||||sp||||sp||Since Thy almighty love is near.
O God, the spring of all our joys,||br||The life of our delights:||br||||sp||||sp||The glory of our brightest days,||br||The comfort of our nights.
The opened heaven around us throws||br||Fresh beams of sacred bliss,||br||||sp||||sp||The Saviour shows that He is ours,||br||And whispers we are His.
Our souls would leave this cumbrous clay,||br||At that transporting word;||br||||sp||||sp||And brightened hope brings near the day,||br||To meet and see the Lord.
And shall we see Thy face,||br||And hear Thy heavenly voice,||br||||sp||||sp||Well known to us in present grace?||br||Well may our hearts rejoice.
With Thee in garments white,||br||Lord Jesus, we shall walk;||br||||sp||||sp||And spotless in that heavenly light,||br||Of all Thy sufferings talk.
Close to Thy trusted side,||br||In fellowship divine;||br||||sp||||sp||No cloud, no distance, e’er shall hide||br||Glories that then shall shine.
Fruit of Thy boundless love,||br||That gave Thyself for us;||br||||sp||||sp||Forever we shall with Thee prove||br||That Thou still lov’st us thus.
And we love Thee, blest Lord,||br||E’en now, though feeble here,||br||||sp||||sp||The sorrow and Thy cross record||br||What makes us know Thee near.
We wait to see Thee, Lord,||br||Yet now within our hearts||br||||sp||||sp||Thou dwell’st in love that doth afford||br||The joy ||i||that||/i|| love imparts.
Yet still we wait for Thee,||br||To see Thee as Thou art;||br||||sp||||sp||Be with Thee, like Thee, Lord, and free||br||To love with all our heart.

Lord of the worlds above,||br||How pleasant and how fair||br||||sp||||sp||The dwellings of Thy love—||br||The heavenly mansions are!||br||||sp||||sp||To Thine abode||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts aspire,||br||||sp||||sp||With warm desire,||br||||sp||||sp||To see our God.

There is Thy throne of grace,||br||And there the sprinkled blood;||br||||sp||||sp||There lives, before Thy face,||br||Our great High Priest, O God!||br||||sp||||sp||His name our plea,||br||||sp||||sp||We now draw near,||br||||sp||||sp||In holy fear,||br||||sp||||sp||To worship Thee.

We go from strength to strength,||br||Through this dark vale of tears,||br||||sp||||sp||Till each arrives at length,||br||And safe in heaven appears:||br||||sp||||sp||O glorious seat!||br||||sp||||sp||Where God the King||br||||sp||||sp||Shall shortly bring||br||||sp||||sp||Our willing feet.

Ah! who upon earth can conceive||br||The bliss that with Jesus we’ll share?||br||||sp||||sp||Or who this dark world would not leave||br||And earnestly long to be there?||br||||sp||||sp||There Christ is the light and the sun,||br||His glories unhinderedly shine;||br||||sp||||sp||Already our joy is begun,||br||Our rest is the glory divine.

’Tis good, at His word, to be here,||br||Yet better e’en now to be gone,||br||||sp||||sp||And there in His presence appear,||br||And rest where He rests on the throne;||br||||sp||||sp||Yet, ah! what the joy ’twill afford,||br||When Him we shall see in the air:||br||||sp||||sp||And enter the joy of the Lord,||br||Forever to be with Him there.
O Lord! how does Thy mercy throw||br||Its guardian shadow o’er us,||br||||sp||||sp||Preserving us while here below,||br||Safe to the rest before us.
As weaker than a bruisèd reed,||br||We cannot do without Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||We want Thee here each hour of need,||br||Shall want Thee too in glory.
And though our efforts now to praise,||br||Are often cold and lowly,||br||||sp||||sp||A nobler, sweeter song we’ll raise||br||With all Thy saints, in glory.
We’ll lay our trophies at Thy feet,||br||We’ll worship and adore Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Whose precious blood has made us meet||br||To dwell with Thee in glory.

hymn.author: Paul Gerhardt, tr. by J. Wesley

stanza.text: O Lord! Thy rich, Thy boundless love||br||No thought can reach, no tongue declare;||br||||sp||||sp||O give our hearts its depth to prove,||br||And reign without a rival there!||br||||sp||||sp||From thee, O Lord, we all receive,||br||||sp||||sp||Thine, wholly Thine, alone we’d live.

O Lord! how cheering is Thy way!||br||How blest, how gracious in our eyes!||br||||sp||||sp||Care, anguish, sorrow, pass away,||br||And fear before Thy presence flies.||br||||sp||||sp||Lord Jesus! nothing would we see,||br||||sp||||sp||Nothing desire, apart form Thee!

’Mid conflict be Thy love our peace!||br||In weakness be Thy love our strength!||br||||sp||||sp||And when the storms of life shall cease,||br||And Thou to meet us com’st at length,||br||||sp||||sp||O Jesus, then these hearts shall be||br||||sp||||sp||Forever satisfied with Thee.
Our God is light: and though we go||br||Across a trackless wild,||br||||sp||||sp||Our Jesus’ footsteps ever show||br||The path for every child.
At every step afresh we prove||br||How sure our heavenly Guide;||br||||sp||||sp||The faithful and forbearing love||br||That never turns aside.
Thou weariest not, most gracious Lord,||br||Though we may weary grow;||br||||sp||||sp||In season the sustaining word||br||Thou giv’st our hearts to know.
Death’s bitter waters met our thirst,||br||Thy cross has made them sweet;||br||||sp||||sp||Then on our gladdened vision burst||br||God’s shady, cool retreat.
Through scenes of strife, by graves of lust,||br||Our desert path has been;||br||||sp||||sp||But here, O Lord, we’ve learned to trust||br||And love Thee, though unseen.
The manna and the springing well||br||Suffice for every need;||br||||sp||||sp||And Eschol’s grapes the story tell||br||Of where Thy path doth lead.

Guide us, O Thou gracious Saviour,||br||Pilgrims through this barren land;||br||||sp||||sp||We are weak, but Thou art mighty;||br||Hold us with Thy powerful hand.||br||||sp||||sp||Bread of heaven!||br||Feed us now and evermore.

While we tread this vale of sorrow,||br||May we in Thy love abide:||br||||sp||||sp||Keep us ever, gracious Saviour,||br||Cleaving closely to Thy side,||br||||sp||||sp||Still relying||br||On the Father’s changeless love.

Saviour, come, we long to see Thee,||br||Long to dwell with Thee above,||br||||sp||||sp||And to know in full communion||br||All the sweetness of Thy love.||br||||sp||||sp||Come, Lord Jesus,||br||Take Thy waiting people home.
The Lamb of God our Shepherd is,||br||And He who doth us feed;||br||||sp||||sp||While He is ours and we are His,||br||What can we want or need?
He leads us to the tender grass,||br||And there we feed and rest;||br||||sp||||sp||Then to the streams that gently pass,||br||In both we have the best.
And if we stray, He doth convert||br||And bring our minds in frame;||br||||sp||||sp||And all this not for our desert,||br||But for His holy name.
Yea, in death’s shady black, abode,||br||Well may we walk, nor fear||br||||sp||||sp||While Thou art with us, and Thy rod||br||To guide, Thy staff to bear.
If through the darksome vale of death||br||We pass, we need not fear;||br||||sp||||sp||Our Saviour, He who gave us breath,||br||Brings light and triumph there.
Yea, in the face of deadliest foes||br||He spreads our board in peace;||br||||sp||||sp||In Him secure may we repose,||br||While all our joys increase.
Surely Thy sweet and wondrous love||br||Shall measure all our days;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy Father’s house, our home above,||br||Where dwells eternal praise.
Saviour, we long to follow Thee,||br||Daily Thy cross to bear,||br||||sp||||sp||And count all else, whate’er it be,||br||Unworthy of our care.
We are not now our own, but Thine,||br||The purchase of Thy blood,||br||||sp||||sp||And made, by grace and love divine,||br||The sons and heirs of God.
Thy Spirit, too, the present seal||br||Of all The Father’s love,||br||||sp||||sp||Dwells in our souls and does reveal||br||The glorious rest above.
Thy life is now beyond the grave;||br||Our souls Thou hast set free;||br||||sp||||sp||Life, strength, and grace in Thee we have,||br||For we are one with Thee.
O teach us so the power to know||br||Of risen life with Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Not we may live while here below,||br||But Christ our life may be.
Come, saints, your grateful voices raise,||br||For grace’s boundless store;||br||||sp||||sp||Dwell on the Lamb’s unchanging love,||br||And praise Him evermore.
His mercy who our ransom paid,||br||And all our sorrows bore,||br||||sp||||sp||Sing with a note of loftiest joy,||br||And praise Him evermore.
Soon the redeeming Lord shall come||br||For us whose sins He bore,||br||||sp||||sp||To see the glories of the Lamb,||br||And praise Him evermore.
Then endless praise our lips shall move,||br||And joy our spirits fill;||br||||sp||||sp||The objects of His love divine,||br||Oh who that joy can tell?

O joyful day! O glorious hour!||br||||sp||||sp||When Jesus, by almighty power,||br||Revived and left the grave;||br||||sp||||sp||In all His works behold Him great,||br||||sp||||sp||Before, almighty to create,||br||Almighty now to save!

The First-begotten from the dead,||br||||sp||||sp||He’s risen now, His people’s Head,||br||And thus their life’s secure;||br||||sp||||sp||And if, like Him, they yield their breath,||br||||sp||||sp||Like Him they’ll burst the bonds of death,||br||Their resurrection sure.

Why should His people, then, be sad?||br||||sp||||sp||None have such reason to be glad||br||As those redeemed to God;||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus, the mighty Saviour, lives,||br||||sp||||sp||To them eternal life He gives,||br||The purchase of His blood.

Then let our gladsome praise resound,||br||||sp||||sp||And let us in His work abound,||br||Whose blessed name is Love;||br||||sp||||sp||We’re sure our labor’s not in vain,||br||||sp||||sp||For we with Him ere long shall reign—||br||With Jesus dwell above.
With joy we meditate the grace||br||Of God’s High Priest above;||br||||sp||||sp||His heart is filled with tenderness,||br||His very name in Love.
Touched with a sympathy within,||br||He knows our feeble frame:||br||||sp||||sp||He knows what sorest trials mean,||br||For He has felt the same.
But spotless, undefiled, and pure,||br||The great Redeemer stood,||br||||sp||||sp||While Satan’s fiery darts He bore,||br||And did resist to blood.
He, in the days of feeble flesh,||br||Poured out His cries and tears,||br||||sp||||sp||And, though ascended, feels afresh||br||What every member bears.
Then boldly let our faith address||br||The throne of grace and power;||br||||sp||||sp||We shall obtain delivering grace||br||In every needed hour.

Master! we would no longer be||br||At home in that which hated Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||But patient in Thy footsteps go,||br||Thy sorrow as Thy joy to know;||br||||sp||||sp||We would—and O confirm the power—||br||With meekness meet the darkest hour,||br||||sp||||sp||By shame, contempt, however tried,||br||For Thou wast scorned and crucified.

We welcome still Thy faithful word—||br||“The cross shall meet its sure reward;”||br||||sp||||sp||For soon must pass the “little while,”||br||Then joy shall crown Thy servants’ toil:||br||||sp||||sp||And we shall hear Thee, Saviour, say,||br||“Arise, my love, and come away;||br||||sp||||sp||Look up, for thou shalt weep no more,||br||But rest on heaven’s eternal shore.”
When we survey the wondrous cross||br||||sp||||sp||On which the Lord of glory died,||br||||sp||||sp||Our richest gain we count but loss,||br||||sp||||sp||And pour contempt on all our pride.

Forbid it, Lord, that we should boast,||br||||sp||||sp||Save in the death of Christ, our God;||br||||sp||||sp||All the vain things that charm us most,||br||||sp||||sp||We’d sacrifice them to His blood.

There from His head, His hands, His feet,||br||||sp||||sp||Sorrow and love flowed mingled down;||br||||sp||||sp||Did e’er such love and sorrow meet,||br||||sp||||sp||Or thorns compose so rich a crown?

Were the whole realm of nature ours,||br||||sp||||sp||That were an offering far too small;||br||||sp||||sp||Love that transcends our highest powers,||br||||sp||||sp||Demands our soul, our life, our all.

Thou hidden Source of calm repose!||br||Thou all-sufficient Love divine!||br||||sp||||sp||Our help and refuge from our foes,||br||Secure we are, for we are Thine;||br||||sp||||sp||And, lo! from guilt and grief and shame||br||||sp||||sp||We’re hidden, Saviour, by Thy name.

Thy mighty name Salvation is,||br||And keeps our happy souls above;||br||||sp||||sp||Comfort it brings, and power and peace||br||And joy and everlasting love;||br||||sp||||sp||To us, with Thy dear name, are given||br||||sp||||sp||Pardon and holiness and heaven.

Jesus, our all in all Thou art,||br||Our rest in toil, our ease in pain;||br||||sp||||sp||The medicine of a broken heart;||br||’Mid storms, our peace; in loss, our gain;||br||||sp||||sp||Our smile beneath the tyrant’s frown:||br||||sp||||sp||In shame, our glory and our crown.

In want our plentiful supply;||br||In weakness, our almighty power;||br||||sp||||sp||In bonds our perfect liberty;||br||Our refuge in temptation’s hour;||br||||sp||||sp||Our comfort, ’midst all grief and thrall,||br||||sp||||sp||Our life in death, our all in all.
Jesus, Thy head, once crowned with thorns,||br||Is crowned with glory now;||br||||sp||||sp||Heaven’s royal diadem adorns||br||The mighty Victor’s brow.
Thou glorious light of courts above,||br||Joy of the saints below,||br||||sp||||sp||To us still manifest Thy love,||br||That we its depths may know.
To us Thy cross with all its shame,||br||With all its grace be given;||br||||sp||||sp||Though earth disowns Thy lowly name,||br||God honors it in heaven.
Who suffer with Thee, Lord, below,||br||Shall reign with Thee above;||br||||sp||||sp||Then let it be our joy to know||br||This way of peace and love.
To us Thy cross is life and health;||br||’Twas shame and death to Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Our present glory, joy, and wealth,||br||Our everlasting stay.

Soon Thou wilt come again,||br||Jesus, our Lord!||br||||sp||||sp||We shall be happy then,||br||Jesus, our Lord!||br||||sp||||sp||Then we Thy face shall see,||br||||sp||||sp||Then we shall like Thee be,||br||||sp||||sp||Then evermore with Thee,||br||Jesus, our Lord!
’Tis not far off—the hour||br||When Christ will claim His own!||br||||sp||||sp||We soon shall hear that voice of power,||br||The Lord Himself shall come!
The days are passing by,||br||The years flow on apace,||br||||sp||||sp||Lord Jesus! Thy return draws nigh,||br||We long to see Thy face.
Eternal in the heavens,||br||Is our prepared abode—||br||||sp||||sp||Radiant and pure, in light divine,||br||The building of our God.
Rest, Lord in serving Thee,||br||As none have served below;||br||||sp||||sp||Oh, through that blest eternity||br||What tides of praise shall flow!
Come quickly, blessed Lord!||br||Like exiles here we roam;||br||||sp||||sp||Fulfill to us Thy gracious word,||br||Lord Jesus, take us home.

O Thou, whose mercies far exceed||br||All we can do or say,||br||||sp||||sp||As in Thy people Thou indeed||br||Dost daily more display;||br||||sp||||sp||Let, for our happiness, O God,||br||On us while here below,||br||||sp||||sp||By virtue of Christ’s death and blood,||br||Thy richest blessings flow.

Preserve Thy flock most graciously,||br||Within Thy sheltering fold;||br||||sp||||sp||Move them from every harm away,||br||And in Thy safeguard hold;||br||||sp||||sp||Till Thou shalt fully have obtained||br||In us the fruits of grace,||br||||sp||||sp||And we, in joys that never end,||br||Shall see Thee face to face.

Do Thou, the very God of peace,||br||Us wholly sanctify,||br||||sp||||sp||And grant us such a rich increase||br||Of power from on high,||br||||sp||||sp||That spirit, soul, and body may,||br||Preservèd free from stain,||br||||sp||||sp||Be blameless until that great day;||br||Lord Jesus Christ, Amen!
“No condemnation!”—precious word!||br||Consider it, my soul!||br||||sp||||sp||Thy sins were all on Jesus laid;||br||His stripes have made thee whole.
In heaven the blood forever speaks||br||In God’s omniscient ear;||br||||sp||||sp||The saints, as jewels on His heart,||br||Jesus doth ever bear.
“No condemnation!”—O my soul,||br||’Tis God that speaks the word,||br||||sp||||sp||Perfect in comeliness art thou||br||In Christ, the risen Lord.
Teach me, O God, to fix mine eyes||br||On Christ, the spotless Lamb,||br||||sp||||sp||So shall I love Thy precious will,||br||And glorify His name.

Why those fears? Behold, ’tis Jesus||br||Holds the helm and guides the ship;||br||||sp||||sp||Spread the sails, and catch the breezes||br||Sent to waft us through the deep||br||||sp||||sp||To the regions||br||Where the mourners cease to weep.

Though the shore we hope to land on||br||Only by report is known,||br||||sp||||sp||Yet we freely all abandon,||br||Led by that report alone,||br||||sp||||sp||And with Jesus||br||Through the trackless deep move on.

Led by faith, we brave the ocean;||br||Led by faith, the storm defy;||br||||sp||||sp||Calm amidst tumultuous motion,||br||Knowing that the Lord is nigh:||br||||sp||||sp||Waves obey Him,||br||And the storms before Him fly.

Rendered safe by His protection,||br||We shall pass the watery waste,||br||||sp||||sp||Trusting to His wise direction,||br||We shall gain the port at last;||br||||sp||||sp||And with wonder||br||Think on toils and dangers past.

O what pleasures there await us!||br||There the tempests cease to roar:||br||||sp||||sp||There it is that those who hate us||br||Can molest our peace no more:||br||||sp||||sp||Trouble ceases||br||On that tranquil, happy shore.
O Saviour! whom absent we love,||br||||sp||||sp||Whom having not seen we adore,||br||||sp||||sp||Whose name is exalted above||br||||sp||||sp||All glory dominion and power;
O come, and display us as Thine,||br||||sp||||sp||And leave us no longer to roam;||br||||sp||||sp||May we in Thy glory, Lord, shine,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy presence soon summon us home.

O when shall the mists be removed,||br||||sp||||sp||And round us Thy brightness be poured?||br||||sp||||sp||When meet Thee, whom absent we’ve loved,||br||||sp||||sp||When see, whom unseen we’ve adored?
O then never more shall the fears,||br||||sp||||sp||The trials, temptations and woes,||br||||sp||||sp||Which darken this valley of tears,||br||||sp||||sp||Intrude on our blissful repose.
Or if yet remembered above,||br||||sp||||sp||Remembrance no sadness shall raise,||br||||sp||||sp||They will bring but new thoughts of Thy love,||br||||sp||||sp||New themes for our wonder and praise.
Hark, the glad sound! the Saviour comes!||br||The Saviour promised long:||br||||sp||||sp||Take up the word, ye savèd saints,||br||Renew the gladsome song.
He comes! creation to release,||br||In Satan’s bondage held;||br||||sp||||sp||The tyrant’s thraldom to destroy,||br||And make th’ usurper yield.
He comes! the mighty foe to bind,||br||The groaning earth to free,||br||||sp||||sp||While (chief of all His goodness gives)||br||Himself its Lord shall be.
Hosannas glad, Thou Prince of Peace,||br||Thy welcome shall proclaim;||br||||sp||||sp||And all creation shall rejoice||br||In Thy belovèd name.
From all that dwell below the skies||br||||sp||||sp||Let the Creator’s praise arise;||br||||sp||||sp||Let the Redeemer’s name be sung,||br||||sp||||sp||Through every land, by every tongue.
Eternal are Thy mercies, Lord!||br||||sp||||sp||Eternal truth attends Thy word;||br||||sp||||sp||And praise shall sound from shore to shore,||br||||sp||||sp||Till suns shall rise and set no more.

O come, Thou stricken Lamb of God!||br||||sp||||sp||Who shed’st for us Thine own life blood,||br||||sp||||sp||And teach us all Thy love:—then pain||br||||sp||||sp||In life were sweet, and death were gain.
Take Thou our hearts, and let them be||br||||sp||||sp||Forever closed to all but Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy willing servants, let us wear||br||||sp||||sp||The seal of love forever there.

How blest are they who still abide,||br||||sp||||sp||Close sheltered by Thy watchful side;||br||||sp||||sp||Who life and strength from Thee receive,||br||||sp||||sp||And with Thee move, and in Thee live.
Ah, Lord! enlarge our scanty thought,||br||||sp||||sp||To know the wonders Thou hast wrought;||br||||sp||||sp||Unloose our stammering tongues to tell||br||||sp||||sp||Thy love, immense, unsearchable.

Firstborn of many brethren, Thou!||br||||sp||||sp||To whom both heaven and earth must bow;||br||||sp||||sp||Heirs of Thy shame and of Thy throne,||br||||sp||||sp||We bear Thy cross and seek Thy crown.

Holy Saviour, we adore Thee,||br||Seated on the throne of God;||br||||sp||||sp||Soon in glory, all before Thee||br||Shall proclaim Thy praise abroad||br||||sp||||sp||“Thou art worthy,”||br||We were ransomed by Thy blood.

Saviour, though the world despised Thee,||br||Though Thou here wast crucified,||br||||sp||||sp||Yet the Father’s glory raised thee,||br||Lord of all creation wide.||br||||sp||||sp||“Thou art worthy,”||br||We shall live, for Thou hast died.

And though here on earth rejected,||br||’Tis but fellowship with Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Should we not with joy expect it—||br||Here like Thee, our Lord, to be?||br||||sp||||sp||“Thou art worthy,”||br||Thou from earth hast set us free.

Haste the day of Thine appearing||br||With Thy ransomed saints to reign;||br||||sp||||sp||Then shall end all days of mourning,||br||We shall sing with triumph then.||br||||sp||||sp||“Thou art worthy,”||br||Come, Lord Jesus, come, Amen.

Love divine, all praise excelling,||br||Joy of heaven, to earth come down!||br||||sp||||sp||Bless us with Thy rich indwelling,||br||All Thy faithful mercies crown!||br||||sp||||sp||Saviour, Thee we’d still be blessing,||br||Serve Thee here, as soon above,||br||||sp||||sp||Praise Thee, Saviour, without ceasing,||br||Glory in Thy dying love.

Firstfruits of Thy new creation,||br||Faithful, holy, may we be,||br||||sp||||sp||Joyful in Thy full salvation,||br||More and more conformed to Thee!||br||||sp||||sp||Changed from glory into glory,||br||Till in heaven we take our place,||br||||sp||||sp||Then to worship and adore Thee,||br||Lost in wonder, love and praise!
When all Thy mercies, O my God,||br||My rising soul surveys,||br||||sp||||sp||Transported with the view, I’m lost||br||In wonder, love, and praise.
Unnumbered comforts to my soul||br||Thy tender care bestowed,||br||||sp||||sp||Before my infant heart conceived||br||From whom those comforts flowed.
Ten thousand thousand precious gifts||br||My daily thanks employ;||br||||sp||||sp||Nor is the least a cheerful heart||br||To taste those gifts with joy.
Through every period of my life||br||The goodness I’ll pursue;||br||||sp||||sp||The desert past, in glory bright,||br||The precious theme renew.
Through all eternity to Thee||br||A joyful song I’ll raise;||br||||sp||||sp||But, oh! eternity’s too short||br||To utter all Thy praise.

O haste away, my brethren dear,||br||And come to Canaan’s shore;||br||||sp||||sp||We’ll meet and sing forever there,||br||When all our toils are o’er.||br||||sp||||sp||O that will be joyful, joyful, joyful!||br||O that will be joyful!||br||To meet to part no more,||br||To meet to part no more,||br||On Canaan’s happy shore.||br||||sp||||sp||And then sing Hallelujah,||br||||sp||||sp||With the saints that have gone before.

In bridal robes, all clothed in white,||br||Will all His saints appear:||br||||sp||||sp||And, shining in His glory bright,||br||We’ll see our Jesus there.||br||||sp||||sp||O that will be joyful, joyful, joyful!||br||O that will be joyful!||br||To meet to part no more,||br||To meet to part no more,||br||On Canaan’s happy shore.||br||||sp||||sp||And then sing Hallelujah,||br||||sp||||sp||With the saints that have gone before.

In heaven triumphant joy is found||br||When sons to God are born;||br||||sp||||sp||How will its vaults with praise resound||br||On the millennial morn!||br||||sp||||sp||O that will be joyful, joyful, joyful!||br||O that will be joyful!||br||To meet to part no more,||br||To meet to part no more,||br||On Canaan’s happy shore.||br||||sp||||sp||And then sing Hallelujah,||br||||sp||||sp||With the saints that have gone before.

In Canaan’s happy land we’ll meet||br||To chant this glorious lay;||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts well tuned will sing so sweet,||br||Through one eternal day.||br||||sp||||sp||O that will be joyful, joyful, joyful!||br||O that will be joyful!||br||To meet to part no more,||br||To meet to part no more,||br||On Canaan’s happy shore.||br||||sp||||sp||And then sing Hallelujah,||br||||sp||||sp||With the saints that have gone before.

Through one eternal day we’ll sing,||br||And bless His sacred name,||br||||sp||||sp||With “Hallelujahs to the King!”||br||And “Worthy is the Lamb!”||br||||sp||||sp||O that will be joyful, joyful, joyful!||br||O that will be joyful!||br||To meet to part no more,||br||To meet to part no more,||br||On Canaan’s happy shore.||br||||sp||||sp||And then sing Hallelujah,||br||||sp||||sp||With the saints that have gone before.
Let earthly themes now cease,||br||And joyful let us dwell||br||||sp||||sp||On our sweet theme of heavenly peace:||br||O we’ve enough to tell.
We worship at Thy feet,||br||We wonder and adore;||br||||sp||||sp||The coming glory scarce more sweet||br||Than sweet the peace before.

Ye servants of God, your Master proclaim,||br||||sp||||sp||And publish abroad His wonderful name;||br||||sp||||sp||The name, all victorious, of Jesus extol,||br||||sp||||sp||His kingdom is glorious—He’ll reign over all.

God ruleth on high, almighty to save,||br||||sp||||sp||But still He is nigh, His presence we have;||br||||sp||||sp||The great congregation His triumph shall sing,||br||||sp||||sp||Ascribing salvation to Jesus, their King.

Salvation to God, who sits on the throne,||br||||sp||||sp||Let all shout aloud, and honor the Son;||br||||sp||||sp||The praises of Jesus God’s saints will proclaim,||br||||sp||||sp||They’ll fall on their faces to worship the Lamb.

Our rest is in heaven, our rest is not here;||br||||sp||||sp||Then why should we tremble when trials are near?||br||||sp||||sp||Be hushed our sad spirits, the worst that can come||br||||sp||||sp||But shortens the journey, and hastens us home.

It is not for us to be seeking our bliss,||br||||sp||||sp||And building our hopes in a region like this:||br||||sp||||sp||We look for a city which hands have not piled—||br||||sp||||sp||We pant for a country by sin undefiled.

The thorn and the thistle around us may grow—||br||||sp||||sp||We would not lie down, e’en on roses, below:||br||||sp||||sp||We ask not our portion, we seek not a rest,||br||||sp||||sp||Till we find them forever where Jesus is blest.

Let trial and danger our progress oppose,||br||||sp||||sp||They’ll only make heaven more sweet at the close;||br||||sp||||sp||Come joy or come sorrow, whate’er may befall,||br||||sp||||sp||A home with our God will make up for it all.

With a scrip on the back, and a staff in the hand,||br||||sp||||sp||We march on in haste through an enemy’s land;||br||||sp||||sp||The road may be rough, but it cannot be long,||br||||sp||||sp||And we’ll smooth it with hope, and we’ll cheer it with song.
O blessed Lord, what hast Thou done?||br||How vast a ransom given?||br||||sp||||sp||Thyself of God th’ eternal Son;||br||The Lord of earth and heaven.
Thy Father, in His gracious love,||br||Did spare Thee from His side;||br||||sp||||sp||And Thou didst stoop to bear above,||br||At such a cost, Thy bride.
Lord, while our souls in faith repose||br||Upon Thy precious blood,||br||||sp||||sp||Peace like an even river flows,||br||And mercy, like a flood.
But boundless joy shall fill our hearts,||br||When gazing on Thy face,||br||||sp||||sp||We fully see what faith imparts,||br||And glory crowns Thy grace.
Unseen, we love Thee; dear Thy name;||br||But when our eyes behold,||br||||sp||||sp||With joyful wonder we’ll exclaim,||br||“The half has not been told!”
For Thou exceedest all the fame||br||Our ears have ever heard;||br||||sp||||sp||How happy we who know Thy name,||br||And trust Thy faithful word!
When Israel, by divine command,||br||The pathless desert trod,||br||||sp||||sp||They found, throughout the barren land,||br||A sure resource in God.
A cloudy pillar marked the road,||br||And screened them from the heat;||br||||sp||||sp||From the hard rock the water flowed,||br||And manna was their meat.
Like them, we have a rest in view,||br||Secure from hostile powers:||br||||sp||||sp||Like them, we pass a desert too,||br||But Israel’s God is ours.
His word a light before us spreads,||br||By which our path we see;||br||||sp||||sp||His love, a banner o’er our heads,||br||From harm preserves us free.
Jesus, the Bread of life, is given||br||To be our daily food;||br||||sp||||sp||Within us dwells that well from heaven,||br||The Spirit of our God.
Lord, ’tis enough, we ask no more;||br||Thy grace around us pours||br||||sp||||sp||Its rich and unexhausted store,||br||And all its joy is ours.
Soon the saints in glory singing,||br||Will with joy exalt the Lamb;||br||||sp||||sp||All in heaven their tribute bringing,||br||Raising high the Saviour’s name.
To us, now the earnest’s given,||br||Here by grace these themes belong;||br||||sp||||sp||Let us sing the song of heaven,||br||’Tis our everlasting song.
See how God has now enthroned Him||br||At His own right hand in heaven,||br||||sp||||sp||There the heavenly hosts have owned Him||br||Lord, to whom all power is given.
