Endless life in Him possessing,||br||Let us praise His glorious name,||br||||sp||||sp||Glory, honor, power, and blessing,||br||Be forever to the Lamb.
That we are seen, O God, by Thee—||br||This is our happy lot—||br||||sp||||sp||Presented faultless to Thine eye,||br||And all our sins forgot.
Each hour of joy, this is the light||br||Which shines on all our ways;||br||||sp||||sp||And in affliction’s deepest gloom||br||Its power it still displays.
Then cheerfully through life we pass;||br||And if we’re called to die,||br||||sp||||sp||The valley’s shade we will not dread,||br||For Thou wilt still be nigh.
And art Thou with us, gracious Lord,||br||To dissipate our fear?||br||||sp||||sp||Dost Thou proclaim Thyself our God,||br||Our Father ever near?
With such support our souls may rest,||br||And banish every care;||br||||sp||||sp||The darkest path is cheered with smiles,||br||Since Thou art with us there.
Poor and feeble though we be,||br||||sp||||sp||Saviour, we belong to Thee!||br||||sp||||sp||Thine we are, Thou Son of God,||br||||sp||||sp||Thine, the purchase of Thy blood.
Boundless wisdom, power divine,||br||||sp||||sp||Love unspeakable, are Thine;||br||||sp||||sp||Praise by all to Thee be given,||br||||sp||||sp||Son of God, and Heir of heaven!
Saviour divine, whose name we know,||br||In whom alone we trust,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou art the Lord our Righteousness,||br||Thou art Thy people’s boast.
The guilty soul, by sin defiled,||br||The conscience sore opprest,||br||||sp||||sp||In Thee believing stands approved,||br||And finds abiding rest.
To Thee, our great redeeming Lord,||br||What lasting thanks we owe,||br||||sp||||sp||For raising sinners to such joys||br||From depths of endless woe.
Jesus! before Thy face we fall,||br||||sp||||sp||Our Lord, our life, our hope, our all;||br||||sp||||sp||For we have nowhere else to flee;||br||||sp||||sp||No Sanctuary, Lord, but Thee.
In Thee we every glory view,||br||||sp||||sp||Of safety, strength, and beauty too;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis all our rest and peace to see||br||||sp||||sp||Our Sanctuary, Lord, in Thee.
Whatever foes or fears betide,||br||||sp||||sp||In Thy blest presence let us hide;||br||||sp||||sp||And while we rest our souls on Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou shalt our Sanctuary be.
Through time, with all its changing scenes,||br||||sp||||sp||And all the grief that intervenes,||br||||sp||||sp||Let this support each fainting heart,||br||||sp||||sp||That Thou our Sanctuary art.
Father, O how vast the blessing,||br||When Thy Son returns again!||br||||sp||||sp||Then the church, its rest possessing,||br||O’er the earth with Him shall reign.
For the fathers’ sakes belovèd,||br||Israel, in Thy grace restored,||br||||sp||||sp||Shall on earth, the curse removèd,||br||Be the people of the Lord.
Then, too, countless myriads, wearing||br||Robes made white in Jesus’ blood,||br||||sp||||sp||Palms (like rested pilgrims) bearing,||br||Stand before the throne of God:—
These, redeemed from every nation,||br||Shall in triumph bless Thy name;||br||||sp||||sp||Every voice shall cry, “Salvation||br||To our God and to the Lamb.”

While to several paths dividing,||br||We our pilgrimage pursue,||br||||sp||||sp||May our Shepherd, safely guiding,||br||Still be kept in constant view.||br||||sp||||sp||May the bond of blest communion||br||Every distant soul embrace,||br||||sp||||sp||Till, in everlasting union,||br||We attain our resting-place.
Lead on, almighty Lord,||br||Lead on to victory:||br||||sp||||sp||Encouraged by Thy blessed word,||br||With joy we follow Thee.
We follow Thee, our Guide,||br||Who didst salvation bring:||br||||sp||||sp||We follow Thee, through grace supplied||br||From heaven’s eternal spring:
Till of the prize possessed,||br||We hear of war no more,||br||||sp||||sp||And, O sweet thought! forever rest||br||On yonder peaceful shore.
Soon righteousness shall rule,||br||All Satan’s power restrain:||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus Jehovah be the King,||br||O’er Jews and Gentiles reign.
Jesus Himself shall come,||br||The world receive His word;||br||||sp||||sp||And all creation own His sway—||br||The universal Lord.

||i||Let sinners saved give thanks and sing,||br||||sp||||sp||||/i||Salvation’s theirs and of the Lord;||br||||sp||||sp||They draw from heaven’s eternal spring,||br||||sp||||sp||The living God, their great reward.

||i||Let sinners saved give thanks and sing,||br||||sp||||sp||||/i||Whom grace has kept in dangers past,||br||||sp||||sp||And, O sweet truth! the Lord will bring||br||||sp||||sp||His people safe to heaven at last.

||i||Let sinners saved give thanks and sing,||br||||sp||||sp||||/i||Of Jesus sing, through all their days,||br||||sp||||sp||In heaven above their harps they’ll string,||br||||sp||||sp||And there forever sing His praise.

Jesus! life-giving sound,||br||The joy of earth and heaven;||br||||sp||||sp||No other help is found,||br||No other name is given,||br||||sp||||sp||In which the sons of man can boast,||br||||sp||||sp||But His who seeks and saves the lost.

His name the sinner hears,||br||And is from guilt set free;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis music in his ears,||br||’Tis life and victory:||br||||sp||||sp||His heart o’erflows with sacred joy,||br||||sp||||sp||And songs of praise his lips employ.

Jesus! all praise above:||br||We sing Thy blessed name,||br||||sp||||sp||We sing Thy dying love,||br||Thy rising power proclaim:||br||||sp||||sp||But soon, to give Thee worthy praise,||br||||sp||||sp||Both heaven and earth their songs shall raise.

We are by Christ redeemed:||br||The cost—His precious blood;||br||||sp||||sp||Be nothing by our souls esteemed||br||||sp||||sp||Like this great good.||br||||sp||||sp||Were the vast world our own,||br||With all its varied store,||br||||sp||||sp||And Thou, Lord Jesus, wert unknown,||br||||sp||||sp||We still were poor.

Our earthen vessels break;||br||The world itself grows old;||br||||sp||||sp||But Christ our precious dust will take||br||||sp||||sp||And freshly mould:||br||||sp||||sp||He’ll give these bodies vile||br||A fashion like His own;||br||||sp||||sp||He’ll bid the whole creation smile,||br||||sp||||sp||And hush its groan.

Thus far by grace preserved,||br||Each moment speeds us on;||br||||sp||||sp||The crown and kingdom are reserved||br||||sp||||sp||Where Christ is gone.||br||||sp||||sp||When cloudless morning shines,||br||We shall His glory share;||br||||sp||||sp||In pleasant places are the lines;||br||||sp||||sp||The home how fair!

To Him our weakness clings||br||Through tribulation sore,||br||||sp||||sp||And seeks the covert of His wings||br||||sp||||sp||Till all be o’er.||br||||sp||||sp||And when we’ve run the race,||br||And fought the faithful fight,||br||||sp||||sp||We then shall see Him face to face,||br||||sp||||sp||With saints in light.
How pleasant is the sound of praise!||br||||sp||||sp||It well becomes the saints of God:||br||||sp||||sp||Should we refuse our songs to raise,||br||||sp||||sp||The stones might tell our shame abroad.
For Him who washed us in His blood,||br||||sp||||sp||Let us our sweetest songs prepare;||br||||sp||||sp||He sought us wandering far from God,||br||||sp||||sp||And now preserves us by His care.
One string there is of sweetest tone,||br||||sp||||sp||Reserved for sinners saved by grace;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis sacred to one class alone,||br||||sp||||sp||And touched by one peculiar race.
Though angels may with rapture see||br||||sp||||sp||How mercy flows in Jesus’ blood,||br||||sp||||sp||It is not theirs to prove, as we,||br||||sp||||sp||The cleansing virtue of this flood.
Though angels praise the heavenly King,||br||||sp||||sp||And Him their Lord adoring own,||br||||sp||||sp||We can with exultation sing,||br||||sp||||sp||“He wears our nature on the throne.”
Lord, we adore the wondrous love||br||||sp||||sp||Which brought Thee here to bleed and die;||br||||sp||||sp||Soon may we meet in heaven above,||br||||sp||||sp||To sing Thy praises in the sky.

O Lamb of God, still keep us||br||Close to Thy piercèd side;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis only there in safety||br||And peace we can abide;||br||||sp||||sp||With foes and snares around us,||br||And lusts and fears within,||br||||sp||||sp||The grace that sought and found us,||br||Alone can keep us clean.

’Tis only in Thee hiding||br||We feel ourselves secure;||br||||sp||||sp||Only in Thee abiding||br||The conflict can endure;||br||||sp||||sp||Thine arm the victory gaineth||br||O’er every hateful foe;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy love our hearts sustaineth,||br||In all their cares and woe.

Soon shall our eyes behold Thee||br||With rapture face to face;||br||||sp||||sp||And, resting there in glory,||br||We’ll sing Thy power and grace:||br||||sp||||sp||Thy beauty, Lord, and glory,||br||The wonders of Thy love,||br||||sp||||sp||Shall be the endless story||br||Of all Thy saints above.

Our sins were borne by Jesus,||br||The holy Lamb of God;||br||||sp||||sp||He took them all, and freed us||br||From that condemning load.||br||||sp||||sp||Our guilt was borne by Jesus,||br||Who washed the crimson stains||br||||sp||||sp||White in His blood most precious,||br||Till not a spot remains.

Our wants are known to Jesus;||br||All fullness dwells in Him:||br||||sp||||sp||He healeth all diseases||br||Who did our souls redeem.||br||||sp||||sp||We tell our griefs to Jesus,||br||Our burdens and our cares||br||||sp||||sp||He from them all releases,||br||Who all our sorrow shares.

We love the name of Jesus,||br||The Christ of God, the Lord;||br||||sp||||sp||Like fragrance on the breezes||br||His name is spread abroad.||br||||sp||||sp||We long to be with Jesus,||br||With all the ransomed throng,||br||||sp||||sp||To sing for aye His praises,||br||The one eternal song.
Farewell to this world’s fleeting joys,||br||Our home is not below;||br||||sp||||sp||There was no home for Jesus here,||br||And ’tis to Him we go.
To Him in yonder home of love,||br||Where He has gone before:||br||||sp||||sp||The home He changed for Calvary’s cross,||br||Where all our sins He bore.
He bore our sins that we might be||br||His partners on the throne!||br||||sp||||sp||The throne He’ll shortly share with those||br||For whom He did atone.
Up to our Father’s house we go,||br||To that sweet home of love:||br||||sp||||sp||Many the mansions that are found||br||Where Jesus dwells above!
And He who left that home above,||br||To be a sufferer here,||br||||sp||||sp||Has left this world again for us||br||A mansion to prepare.
His errand to the earth was love,||br||To wretches such as we!||br||||sp||||sp||To pluck us from the jaws of death,||br||Nailed to th’ accursèd tree.
Th’ accursèd tree was the reward||br||Which this sad world did give||br||||sp||||sp||To Him who gave His precious life||br||That this lost world might live.
And has this world a charm for us,||br||Where Jesus suffered thus?||br||||sp||||sp||No! we have died to all its charms||br||Through Jesus’ wondrous cross.
The cross on which our Lord expired||br||Has won the crown for us!||br||||sp||||sp||In thankful fellowship with Him||br||We bear our daily cross.
Set free in grace—He vanquished him||br||Who held us in his chains—||br||||sp||||sp||But more than this, He shares with us||br||The fruit of all His pains.
To all His ransomed ones He’ll give||br||(To us amongst the rest),||br||||sp||||sp||With Him to dwell, with Him to reign,||br||With Him forever blest.
Farewell, farewell, poor faithless world,||br||With all thy boasted store;||br||||sp||||sp||We’d not have joy where ||i||He||/i|| had woe—||br||Be rich where ||i||He||/i|| was poor.
Behold the Lamb, whose precious blood||br||Drawn from His riven side,||br||||sp||||sp||Had power to make our peace with God,||br||Nor lets one spot abide.
The dying thief beheld that Lamb||br||Expiring by His side,||br||||sp||||sp||And proved the value of the name||br||Of Jesus crucified.
His soul, by virtue of the blood,||br||To paradise received,||br||||sp||||sp||Redemption’s earliest trophy stood,||br||From sin and death retrieved.
We, too, the cleansing power have known||br||Of the atoning blood,||br||||sp||||sp||By grace have learnt His name to own,||br||Which brings us back to God.
To Him, then let our songs ascend,||br||Who stooped in grace so low:||br||||sp||||sp||To Christ, the Lamb, the sinner’s Friend,||br||Let ceaseless praises flow.
There is a stream of precious blood||br||Which flowed from Jesus’ veins;||br||||sp||||sp||And sinners washed in that blest flood||br||Lose all their guilty stains.
The dying thief rejoiced to see||br||That Saviour in his day;||br||||sp||||sp||And by that blood, though vile as he,||br||Our sins are washed away.
Blest Lamb of God, Thy precious blood||br||Shall never lose its power,||br||||sp||||sp||Till every ransomed saint of God||br||Be saved to sin no more.
E’er since by faith, we saw the stream||br||Thy wounds supplied for sin,||br||||sp||||sp||Redeeming love has been our theme,||br||Our joy and peace has been.
Soon in a nobler, sweeter song||br||We’ll sing Thy power to save;||br||||sp||||sp||No more with lisping, stammering tongue,||br||But conquerors o’er the grave.
Lord, we believe Thou hast prepared||br||(Unworthy though we be)||br||||sp||||sp||For us a blood-bought, free reward,||br||And harps of minstrelsy.
Harps strung and tuned for endless years||br||And formed by power divine,||br||||sp||||sp||To sound in God the Father’s ears,||br||No other name but Thine.
The Lord Himself shall come,||br||And shout a quickening word;||br||||sp||||sp||Thousands shall answer from the tomb:||br||||i||“Forever with the Lord!”||/i||
Then, as we upward fly,||br||That resurrection-word||br||||sp||||sp||Shall be our shout of victory:||br||||i||“Forever with the Lord!”||/i||
There with unwearied gaze||br||Our eyes on Him we’ll rest,||br||||sp||||sp||And satisfy with endless praise||br||A heart supremely blest.
“Knowing as we are known!”—||br||How shall we love that word,||br||||sp||||sp||How oft repeat before the throne:||br||||i||“Forever with the Lord!”||/i||
That resurrection word,||br||That shout of victory—||br||||sp||||sp||Once more: ||i||“Forever with the Lord!”||br||||/i||Amen, so let it be!
Lord Jesus, come!||br||Nor let us longer roam||br||||sp||||sp||Afar from Thee and that bright place||br||||sp||||sp||Where we shall see Thee face to face.||br||||sp||||sp||Lord Jesus, come!
Lord Jesus, come!||br||Thine absence here we mourn,||br||||sp||||sp||No joy we know apart from Thee||br||||sp||||sp||No sorrow in Thy presence see.||br||||sp||||sp||Come, Jesus, come!
Lord Jesus, come!||br||And claim us as Thine own,||br||||sp||||sp||With longing hearts the path we tread,||br||||sp||||sp||Which Thee on high to glory led||br||||sp||||sp||Come, Saviour, come!
Lord Jesus, come!||br||And take Thy people home||br||||sp||||sp||That all Thy flock so scattered here,||br||||sp||||sp||With Thee in glory may appear.||br||||sp||||sp||Lord Jesus, come!

hymn.author: Tr. by H.K. Burlingham, from German

stanza.text: We wait for Thee, O Son of God!||br||And long for Thine appearing;||br||||sp||||sp||“A little while” Thou’lt come, O Lord,||br||Thy waiting people cheering.||br||||sp||||sp||Thus hast Thou said: we lift the head||br||In joyful expectation,||br||For Thou wilt bring salvation.

We wait for Thee, content to share,||br||In patience, days of trial;||br||||sp||||sp||So meekly Thou the cross didst bear,||br||Our sin, reproach, denial.||br||||sp||||sp||How should not we receive with Thee||br||The cup of shame and sorrow,||br||Until the promised morrow?

We wait for Thee, for Thou, e’en here||br||Hast won our hearts’ affection,||br||||sp||||sp||In spirit still we find Thee near,||br||Our solace and protection.||br||||sp||||sp||In cloudless light, and glory bright,||br||We soon with joy shall greet Thee,||br||And in the air shall meet Thee.

We wait for Thee—Thou wilt arise||br||Whilst hope her watch is keeping||br||||sp||||sp||Forgotten then, in glad surprise,||br||Shall be our years of weeping.||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts beat high, the dawn is nigh||br||That ends our pilgrim story||br||In Thine eternal glory!

As debtors to mercy alone,||br||Of heavenly mercy we sing;||br||||sp||||sp||Nor fear to draw near to the throne,||br||Our person and offerings to bring:||br||||sp||||sp||The wrath of a sin-hating God||br||With us can have nothing to do;||br||||sp||||sp||The Saviour’s obedience and blood||br||Hide all our transgressions from view.

The work which ||i||His||/i|| goodness began,||br||The arm of ||i||His||/i|| strength will complete;||br||||sp||||sp||His promise is Yea and Amen,||br||And never was forfeited yet:||br||||sp||||sp||Things future, not things that are now,||br||Nor all things below nor above,||br||||sp||||sp||Can make Him His purpose forego,||br||Or sever our souls from His love.

Our names, from the palms of His hands||br||Eternity will not erase:||br||||sp||||sp||Impressed on His heart they remain,||br||In marks of indelible grace:||br||||sp||||sp||And we to the end shall endure,||br||As sure as the earnest is given;||br||||sp||||sp||More happy, but not more secure,||br||The spirits departed to heaven.
Lord Jesus! are we one with Thee?||br||O height! O depth of love!||br||||sp||||sp||And crucified and dead with Thee,||br||Now one in heaven above.
Such was Thy grace, that for our sake||br||Thou didst from heaven come down;||br||||sp||||sp||With us of flesh and blood partake,||br||And make our guilt Thine own.
Our sins, our guilt, in love divine,||br||Confessed and borne by Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||The gall, the curse, the wrath were Thine,||br||To set Thy ransomed free.
Ascended now, in glory bright,||br||Life-giving Head Thou art;||br||||sp||||sp||Nor life, nor death, nor depth, nor height,||br||Thy saints and Thee can part.
And soon shall come that glorious day,||br||When, seated on Thy throne,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou shalt to wondering worlds display||br||That we with Thee are one.

Lord Jesus! to tell of Thy love||br||Our souls shall forever delight,||br||||sp||||sp||And sing of Thy glories above,||br||In praises by day and by night.||br||||sp||||sp||Wherever we follow Thee, Lord,||br||Admiring, adoring, we see||br||||sp||||sp||That love which was stronger than death||br||Flow out without limit and free.

Descending from glory on high,||br||With men Thy delight was to dwell,||br||||sp||||sp||Contented, our Surety to die,||br||Nor e’er didst the vilest repel.||br||||sp||||sp||Enduring the grief and the shame,||br||Thou barest our sins on the cross,||br||||sp||||sp||Oh! who would not boast of this love,||br||And count the world’s glory but loss?
God’s sovereign grace to us has given,||br||While pilgrims here below,||br||||sp||||sp||A share in all the joys of heaven,||br||And that blest heaven to know.
With thankful hearts we now can bid||br||Farewell to pleasure here!||br||||sp||||sp||With Christ in God our life is hid,||br||And all its springs are there.
’Tis now concealed and lodged secure||br||In God’s eternal Son,||br||||sp||||sp||And there, as He, it shall endure,||br||Though to the world unknown.
Then, Lord, remove whate’er divides||br||Our longing souls from Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis fit that where the Head resides,||br||The members’ hearts should be.
What raised the wondrous thought;||br||Or who did it suggest?||br||||sp||||sp||That we, the church, to glory brought,||br||Should with the Son be blest.
O God! the thought was Thine||br||(Thine only it could be)||br||||sp||||sp||Fruit of the wisdom, love divine||br||Peculiar unto Thee:
For, sure, no other mind,||br||For thoughts so bold, so free,||br||||sp||||sp||Greatness or strength, could ever find||br||Thine only it could be.
The motives, too, Thine own,||br||The plan, the counsel, Thine!||br||||sp||||sp||Made for Thy Son, bone of His bone||br||In glory bright to shine.
O God! with great delight||br||Thy wondrous thought we see,||br||||sp||||sp||Upon ||i||His||/i|| throne, in glory bright,||br||The bride of Christ shall be.
Sealed with the Holy Ghost,||br||We triumph in that love,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy wondrous thought has made our boast||br||“Glory with Christ above.”

Father, Thy sovereign love has sought||br||||sp||||sp||Captives to sin, gone far from Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||The work that Thine own Son hath wrought||br||||sp||||sp||Has brought us back in peace and free.
And now as sons before Thy face,||br||||sp||||sp||With joyful steps the path we tread,||br||||sp||||sp||Which leads us on to that blest place||br||||sp||||sp||Prepared for us by Christ our Head.
Thou gav’st us, in eternal love,||br||||sp||||sp||To Him to bring us home to Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Suited to Thine own thought above,||br||||sp||||sp||As sons like Him, with Him to be

In Thine own house. There love divine||br||||sp||||sp||Fills the bright courts with cloudless joy;||br||||sp||||sp||But ’tis the love that made us Thine,||br||||sp||||sp||Fills all that house without alloy.
O boundless grace! what fills with joy||br||||sp||||sp||Unmingled all that enter there,||br||||sp||||sp||God’s nature, love without alloy,||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts are given e’en now to share.

God’s righteousness with glory bright,||br||||sp||||sp||Which with its radiance fills that sphere,||br||||sp||||sp||E’en Christ, of God the power and light,||br||||sp||||sp||Our title is that light to share.
O mind divine, so must it be||br||||sp||||sp||That glory all belongs to God:||br||||sp||||sp||O love divine, that did decree||br||||sp||||sp||We should be part, through Jesus’ blood.
O keep us, love divine, near Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||That we our nothingness may know||br||||sp||||sp||And ever to Thy glory be||br||||sp||||sp||Walking in faith while here below.
Just as I was—without one plea,||br||||sp||||sp||But that Thy blood was shed for me,||br||||sp||||sp||And that Thou bad’st me come to Thee||br||||sp||||sp||O Lamb of God, I came!
Just as I was—poor, wretched, blind||br||||sp||||sp||Sight, riches, healing of the mind,||br||||sp||||sp||Yea, all I need in Thee to find,||br||||sp||||sp||O Lamb of God, I came!
Just as I am—Thy love, I own,||br||||sp||||sp||Has broken every barrier down;||br||||sp||||sp||Now to be Thine, yea, Thine alone||br||||sp||||sp||O Lamb of God, I come!
Just as I am—of that free love,||br||||sp||||sp||The fullness and the depth to prove||br||||sp||||sp||Here for a season, then above—||br||||sp||||sp||O Lamb of God, I come!

To Thee, O God, our hearts we raise||br||In solemn songs of thankful praise||br||||sp||||sp||Thee as our God and Father own,||br||And bow our souls before Thy throne||br||||sp||||sp||While here below we seek to sound||br||||sp||||sp||Thy praise to earth’s remotest bound.

Worship and praise we render Thee||br||Father of endless majesty;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy true and only Son adore,||br||One with Thyself in bliss and power||br||||sp||||sp||And God the Holy Ghost declare||br||||sp||||sp||The saints’ eternal Comforter.

Through the love of God our Saviour,||br||||sp||||sp||All will be well;||br||||sp||||sp||Free and changeless is His favor,||br||||sp||||sp||All, all is well.||br||||sp||||sp||Precious is the blood that healed us,||br||||sp||||sp||Perfect is the grace the sealed us,||br||||sp||||sp||Strong the hand stretched forth to shield us,||br||||sp||||sp||All must be well.

Though we pass through tribulation,||br||||sp||||sp||All will be well;||br||||sp||||sp||Ours is such a full salvation,||br||||sp||||sp||All, all is well.||br||||sp||||sp||Happy still in God confiding;||br||||sp||||sp||Fruitful, if in Christ abiding;||br||||sp||||sp||Holy, through the Spirit’s guiding||br||||sp||||sp||All must be well.

We expect a bright tomorrow;||br||||sp||||sp||All will be well.||br||||sp||||sp||Faith can sing through days of sorrow||br||||sp||||sp||All, all is well.||br||||sp||||sp||On our Father’s love relying,||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus every need supplying;||br||||sp||||sp||Or in living, or in dying,||br||||sp||||sp||All must be well.
O God, how wide Thy glory shines,||br||How high Thy wonders rise!||br||||sp||||sp||Known through the earth by thousand signs,||br||By thousands through the skies.
Those mighty orbs proclaim Thy power||br||Their motions speak Thy skill:||br||||sp||||sp||And on the wings of every hour,||br||We read Thy patience still.
Part of Thy name divinely stands||br||On every work impressed;||br||||sp||||sp||Each is the labor of Thy hands,||br||By each Thy power’s confessed.
But when we view Thy strange design||br||To save rebellious worms,||br||||sp||||sp||Where vengeance and compassion join||br||In their divinest forms:
Here Thy bright character is known,||br||Nor dares a creature guess||br||||sp||||sp||Which of the glories brightest shone—||br||The justice or the grace.
Now the full glories of the Lamb||br||Adorn the heavenly throne,||br||||sp||||sp||While saints on earth that know His name,||br||Their Lord and Saviour own.
How blest are we, who have a part||br||In the immortal song;||br||||sp||||sp||Wonder and joy become our heart,||br||And praise and thanks, our tongue.

Behold, what wondrous love and grace!||br||When we were wretched and undone,||br||||sp||||sp||To save a ruined, helpless race,||br||The Father gave His only Son!||br||||sp||||sp||Of twice ten thousand gifts divine,||br||||sp||||sp||No gift like this could ever shine.

O gift of love unspeakable!||br||O gift of mercy all divine!||br||||sp||||sp||We once were slaves of death and hell,||br||But in Christ’s image we shall shine:||br||||sp||||sp||For every gift a song we raise,||br||||sp||||sp||But this demands eternal praise.

Praise shall employ these tongues of ours,||br||Till we with all the saints above,||br||||sp||||sp||Extol His name with nobler powers,||br||And see the ocean of His love:||br||||sp||||sp||Then, while we look and wondering gaze,||br||||sp||||sp||We’ll fill the heavens with endless praise.
The God who dwells above, we call||br||Our Father and our Friend;||br||||sp||||sp||And, blessed thought! His children all||br||Shall see Him in the end.
Though now dispersed, the day will come||br||When He who made us His||br||||sp||||sp||Will call us hence, and take us home||br||To see Him as He is.
Though now unknown, we then shall be||br||The sons of God confessed,||br||||sp||||sp||Those who disown us then shall see||br||How richly we are blest.
Then let us, brethren, while on earth,||br||With foes and strangers mixed,||br||||sp||||sp||Be mindful of our heavenly birth,||br||Our thoughts on glory fixed.
That we should glorify Him here||br||Our Father’s purpose is:||br||||sp||||sp||Whene’er the Saviour shall appear||br||He’ll fully own us His.
Since Thou, the everlasting God,||br||Our Father art become;||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus, our Guardian and Friend,||br||And heaven our final home:
We welcome all Thy sovereign will,||br||For all that will is love;||br||||sp||||sp||And when we know not what Thou dost,||br||We wait the light above.
Thy gracious love, in all our need,||br||Shall heavenly light impart;||br||||sp||||sp||And be our theme of endless praise||br||When all things else depart.
Our God is our salvation,||br||Our refuge in distress,||br||||sp||||sp||What earthly tribulation||br||Can shake our steadfast peace?
The ground of our profession||br||Is Jesus and His blood:||br||||sp||||sp||He gives us the possession||br||Of everlasting good.
We know no condemnation,||br||No law that speaks despair:||br||||sp||||sp||And Satan’s accusation,||br||With Christ, we need not fear.
For us there is provided||br||A city fair and new,||br||||sp||||sp||To it we shall be guided—||br||Jerusalem’s in view;
Our portion there is lying,||br||A destined heavenly lot;||br||||sp||||sp||And though we’re daily dying,||br||Our portion withers not.
The heart within us leapeth,||br||And cannot down be cast,||br||||sp||||sp||Since with our God it keepeth||br||Its never-ending feast.
The sun which, smiling, lights us,||br||Is Jesus Christ alone:||br||||sp||||sp||And what to song incites us,||br||Is heaven on earth begun.
Father, we commend our spirits||br||To Thy love, in Jesus’ name,||br||||sp||||sp||Love which His atoning merits||br||Give us confidence to claim.
O how sweet, how real a pleasure||br||Flows from love so full and free!||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis a vast exhaustless treasure,||br||Saviour, we possess in Thee!
From the world and its confusion,||br||Here we turn and find our rest,||br||||sp||||sp||From its care and its delusion,||br||Turn to Thee, in whom we’re blest.
By the Holy Ghost anointed,||br||May we do the Father’s will,||br||||sp||||sp||Walk the path by Him appointed,||br||All His pleasure to fulfill.
’Twas past and o’er, that deathful pain||br||When forth the life-blood flowed||br||||sp||||sp||That washed our souls from every stain,||br||That paid the debt we owed.
Cleansed from our sins, renewed by grace,||br||Thy royal throne above,||br||||sp||||sp||Blest Saviour, is our destined place,||br||Our portion there, Thy love.
Thine eye in that bright cloudless day,||br||Shall, with supreme delight,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy fair and glorious bride survey,||br||Unblemished in Thy sight.
Forgiveness! ’twas a joyful sound||br||||sp||||sp||To guilty sinners doomed to die:||br||||sp||||sp||We’d publish it the world around,||br||||sp||||sp||And gladly shout it through the sky.
’Twas the rich gift of love divine;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis full, effacing every crime;||br||||sp||||sp||Unbounded shall its glory shine,||br||||sp||||sp||And know no change by changing time.
For this stupendous gift of heaven,||br||||sp||||sp||What grateful honors shall we show!||br||||sp||||sp||Where much transgression is forgiven,||br||||sp||||sp||May love with fervent ardor glow.
By love inspired, may all our days||br||||sp||||sp||With every heavenly grace be crowned;||br||||sp||||sp||May truth and goodness, joy and praise,||br||||sp||||sp||In all abide, in all abound.
O Lord, Thy love’s unbounded,||br||So sweet, so full, so free—||br||||sp||||sp||My soul is all transported,||br||Whene’er I think on Thee!
Yet, Lord, alas! what weakness||br||Within myself I find,||br||||sp||||sp||No infant’s changing pleasure||br||Is like my wandering mind.
And yet Thy love’s unchanging,||br||And doth recall my heart||br||||sp||||sp||To joy in all its brightness,||br||The peace its beams impart.
Yet, sure, if in Thy presence||br||My soul still constant were,||br||||sp||||sp||Mine eye would, more familiar,||br||Its brighter glories bear.
And thus Thy deep perfections||br||Much better should I know,||br||||sp||||sp||And with adoring fervor||br||In this Thy nature grow.
Still sweet ’tis to discover,||br||If clouds have dimmed my sight,||br||||sp||||sp||When passed, Eternal Lover,||br||Towards me, as e’er, Thou’rt bright.
O keep my soul, then Jesus,||br||Abiding still with Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||And if I wander, teach me||br||Soon back to Thee to flee.
That all Thy gracious favor||br||May to my soul be known;||br||||sp||||sp||And, versed in this Thy goodness,||br||My hopes Thyself shalt crown.
The wanderer no more will roam,||br||||sp||||sp||The lost one to the fold hath come,||br||||sp||||sp||The prodigal is welcomed home,||br||||sp||||sp||O Lamb of God, to Thee!
Though clothed in rags, by sin defiled,||br||||sp||||sp||The Father did embrace His child;||br||||sp||||sp||And I am pardoned, reconciled,||br||||sp||||sp||O Lamb of God, in Thee!
It is the Father’s joy to bless;||br||||sp||||sp||His love has found for me a dress,||br||||sp||||sp||A robe of spotless righteousness,||br||||sp||||sp||O Lamb of God, in Thee!
And now my famished soul is fed,||br||||sp||||sp||A feast of love for me is spread,||br||||sp||||sp||I feed upon the children’s bread,||br||||sp||||sp||O Lamb of God, in Thee!
Yea, in the fullness of His grace,||br||||sp||||sp||God put me in the children’s place,||br||||sp||||sp||Where I may gaze upon His face,||br||||sp||||sp||O Lamb of God, in Thee!
Not half His love can I express,||br||||sp||||sp||Yet, Lord, with joy my lips confess||br||||sp||||sp||This blessed portion I possess,||br||||sp||||sp||O Lamb of God, in Thee!
Thy precious name it is I bear,||br||||sp||||sp||In Thee I am to God brought near,||br||||sp||||sp||And all the Father’s love I share,||br||||sp||||sp||O Lamb of God, in Thee!
His be “the Victor’s name,”||br||Who fought the fight alone;||br||||sp||||sp||Triumphant saints no honor claim,||br||His conquest was their own.
By weakness and defeat,||br||He won the meed and crown;||br||||sp||||sp||Trod all our foes beneath His feet||br||By being trodden down.
Bless, bless the Conqueror slain,||br||Slain in His victory;||br||||sp||||sp||Who lived, who died, who lives again—||br||For thee, His church, for thee!
Come, Thou fount of every blessing,||br||Tune my heart to sing Thy grace;||br||||sp||||sp||Streams of mercy, never ceasing,||br||Call for ceaseless songs of praise.
Jesus sought me when a stranger,||br||Wandering from the fold of God;||br||||sp||||sp||He, to rescue me from danger,||br||Interposed His precious blood.
O to grace how great a debtor||br||Daily I’m constrained to be!||br||||sp||||sp||Let that grace, Lord, like a fetter,||br||Bind my wandering heart to Thee.
Prone to wander, Lord, I feel it;||br||Prone to leave the God I love:||br||||sp||||sp||Yet Thou, Lord, hast deigned to seal it||br||With Thy Spirit from above.
Rescued thus from sin and danger,||br||Purchased by the Saviour’s blood,||br||||sp||||sp||May I walk on earth a stranger,||br||As a son and heir of God.

Gracious Lord! my heart is fixèd||br||Sing I will, and sing of Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Since the cup that justice mixèd||br||Thou hast drunk, and drunk for me:||br||||sp||||sp||Great Deliverer!||br||Thou hast set the prisoner free.

Many were the chains that bound me,||br||But the Lord has loosed them all:||br||||sp||||sp||Arms of mercy now surround me,||br||Favors these, nor few, nor small:||br||||sp||||sp||Saviour keep me!||br||Keep Thy servant, lest he fall.

Fair the scene that lies before me,||br||Life eternal Jesus gives;||br||||sp||||sp||While He waves His banner o’er me,||br||Peace and joy my soul receives:||br||||sp||||sp||Sure His promise!||br||I shall live because He lives.

When the world would bid me leave Thee,||br||Telling me of shame and loss,||br||||sp||||sp||Saviour, guard me, lest I grieve Thee,||br||Lest I cease to love Thy cross:||br||||sp||||sp||This is treasure;||br||All the rest I count but dross.

Blest be the God and Father||br||Of Jesus Christ the Son,||br||||sp||||sp||Who chose us for all blessing||br||Ere time had yet begun,||br||||sp||||sp||That we redeemed—His children—||br||Might dwell with Him above,||br||||sp||||sp||And know the depth and fullness||br||Of His unbounded love.

Where all those deep affections,||br||Which fill the Father’s heart,||br||||sp||||sp||Shall find their satisfaction,||br||Their joy to us impart;||br||||sp||||sp||Where we, His throne surrounding,||br||Shall Abba, Father, say,||br||||sp||||sp||Within those many mansions||br||Preparèd for that day.

E’en whilst we here are waiting,||br||His rest on high to share,||br||||sp||||sp||We know our blest relation||br||As children to Him there,||br||||sp||||sp||And by His Spirit’s leading,||br||We Abba, Father, cry;||br||||sp||||sp||With ever-growing longing||br||We seek our home on high.
My soul, repeat His praise||br||Whose mercies are so great;||br||||sp||||sp||Whose anger is so slow to rise,||br||So ready to abate.
High as the heavens are raised||br||Above the earth we tread,||br||||sp||||sp||So far the riches of God’s grace||br||Our highest thoughts exceed.
His power subdues our sin;||br||And His forgiving love,||br||||sp||||sp||Far as the east is from the west,||br||Did all our guilt remove.
Man’s life is as the grass,||br||Or like the morning flower;||br||||sp||||sp||If one sharp blast sweep o’er the field,||br||It withers in an hour.
But Thy compassions, Lord,||br||To endless years endure;||br||||sp||||sp||And all Thy people ever find||br||Thy word of promise sure.
We cannot always trace the way||br||||sp||||sp||Where Thou, our gracious Lord, dost lead,||br||||sp||||sp||But we can always surely say,||br||||sp||||sp||That God is love.
When fear its gloomy cloud will fling||br||||sp||||sp||O’er earth—our souls, to heaven above,||br||||sp||||sp||As to their sanctuary, spring,||br||||sp||||sp||For God is love.
When clouds hang o’er our darkened path,||br||||sp||||sp||We’ll check our dread, each doubt reprove;||br||||sp||||sp||For here each saint sweet comfort hath,||br||||sp||||sp||That God is love.
Yes, Thou art love—a truth like this||br||||sp||||sp||Can every gloomy thought remove,||br||||sp||||sp||And turn our tears and woes to bliss;||br||||sp||||sp||Our God is love.

Though dark be our way, since God is our Guide,||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis ours to obey; ’tis His to provide:||br||||sp||||sp||Though cisterns be broken, and creatures all fail,||br||||sp||||sp||The word He hath spoken shall surely prevail.

His love in times past forbids us to think||br||||sp||||sp||He’ll leave us at last in trouble to sink:||br||||sp||||sp||The Lamb in His glory is ever in view,||br||||sp||||sp||The pledge and the proof He will help us quite through.

And since all we meet must work for our good,||br||||sp||||sp||The bitter is sweet, the medicine is food:||br||||sp||||sp||Though painful at present, ’twill cease before long,||br||||sp||||sp||And then how triumphant the conqueror’s song!
What cheering words are these!||br||Their sweetness who can tell?||br||||sp||||sp||In time and to eternal days—||br||“’Tis with believers well!”
In every state secure,||br||Watched by the Saviour’s eye,||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis well with them should life endure,||br||And well if called to die.
Well in affliction’s ways,||br||Or on the mount with God;||br||||sp||||sp||Well when they joy and sing and praise,||br||Or buffet with the flood.
’Tis well when joys arise,||br||’Tis well when sorrows flow,||br||||sp||||sp||Or darkness seems to veil the skies,||br||And strong temptations grow.
’Tis well when on the mount||br||They feast and joy in love;||br||||sp||||sp||And ’tis as well, in God’s account,||br||When they the furnace prove.
But above all, how well||br||When Jesus speaks the word,||br||||sp||||sp||And, at the trumpet’s sounding swell,||br||They rise to meet their God!
What though th’ accuser roar||br||Of ills that I have done!||br||||sp||||sp||I know them well, and thousands more:||br||Jehovah findeth none.
Sin, Satan, death appear||br||To harass and appall;||br||||sp||||sp||Yet since the gracious Lord is near,||br||Backward they go and fall.
Before, behind, around,||br||They set their fierce array,||br||||sp||||sp||To fight and force me from the ground,||br||Along life’s narrow way.
I meet them face to face,||br||Through Jesus’ conquest blest;||br||||sp||||sp||March in the triumph of His grace||br||Right onward to my rest.
There, in His book, I bear||br||More than a conqueror’s name,||br||||sp||||sp||Of soldier, son, and fellow-heir,||br||Who fought and overcame.

Child of God, by Christ’s salvation,||br||Rise o’er sin, and fear, and care—||br||||sp||||sp||Joy to find in every station||br||Something still to do or bear;||br||||sp||||sp||Think what Spirit dwells within thee—||br||Think what Father’s smiles are thine—||br||||sp||||sp||Think that Jesus died to win thee—||br||Child of God! wilt thou repine?

Haste thee on from grace to glory,||br||Armed by faith and winged by prayer,||br||||sp||||sp||Heaven’s eternal day’s before thee,||br||God’s right hand shall guide thee there;||br||||sp||||sp||Soon shall close thine earthly mission,||br||Soon shall pass thy pilgrim days,||br||||sp||||sp||Hope shall change to glad fruition,||br||Faith to sight, and prayer to praise.
Asleep in Jesus, blessed sleep||br||||sp||||sp||From which none ever wakes to weep;||br||||sp||||sp||A calm and undisturbed repose,||br||||sp||||sp||Where powerless is the last of foes.
Asleep in Jesus: oh, how sweet||br||||sp||||sp||To be for such a slumber meet,||br||||sp||||sp||With holy confidence to sing,||br||||sp||||sp||That death has lost its venomed sting.
Asleep in Jesus, peaceful rest,||br||||sp||||sp||Whence waking we’re supremely blest;||br||||sp||||sp||No fear, no woe, shall dim that hour||br||||sp||||sp||That manifests the Saviour’s power.

The Lamb was slain, His precious blood||br||On Calvary’s awful tree was shed;||br||||sp||||sp||He for the guilty sinner stood,||br||And bore the judgment in his stead.||br||||sp||||sp||He has made peace,||br||And now He lives who once was dead.

Proclaimer of that peace to all,||br||He tells of full, unmingled grace;||br||||sp||||sp||To high and low—who hear the call—||br||To old and young of Adam’s race,||br||||sp||||sp||He preaches peace,||br||And love divine shines in His face.

Behold Him now, exalted high,||br||Upon the throne He took His seat,||br||||sp||||sp||Oh, wondrous grace, that we brought nigh||br||And in Him seated are complete,||br||||sp||||sp||He is our peace,||br||For light divine He’s made us meet.

O Jesus, Friend unfailing,||br||How dear art Thou to me!||br||||sp||||sp||Are cares or fears assailing?||br||I find my strength in Thee!||br||||sp||||sp||Why should my feet grow weary||br||Of this my pilgrim way?||br||||sp||||sp||Rough though the path and dreary,||br||It ends in perfect day!

Naught, naught I court as pleasure,||br||Compared, O Christ with Thee!||br||||sp||||sp||Thy sorrow, without measure,||br||Earned peace and joy for me.||br||||sp||||sp||I love to own, Lord Jesus,||br||Thy claims o’er me divine,||br||||sp||||sp||Bought with Thy blood most precious,||br||Whose can I be but Thine!

What fills my heart with gladness?||br||’Tis Thine abounding grace!||br||||sp||||sp||Where can I look in sadness,||br||But, Jesus, on Thy face?||br||||sp||||sp||My all is Thy providing,||br||Thy love can ne’er grow cold;||br||||sp||||sp||In Thee, my Refuge hiding,||br||No good wilt Thou withhold.

Why should I droop in sorrow?||br||Thou’rt ever by my side!||br||||sp||||sp||Why trembling dread the morrow?||br||What ills can e’er betide?||br||||sp||||sp||If I my cross have taken,||br||’Tis but to follow Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||If scorned, despised, forsaken,||br||Naught severs Thee from me!

O worldly pomp and glory,||br||Your charms are spread in vain!||br||||sp||||sp||I’ve heard a sweeter story!||br||I’ve found a truer gain!||br||||sp||||sp||Where Christ a place prepareth,||br||There is my loved abode;||br||||sp||||sp||There shall I gaze on Jesus:||br||There shall I dwell with God.

For every tribulation,||br||For every sore distress,||br||||sp||||sp||In Christ I’ve full salvation,||br||Sure help and quiet rest.||br||||sp||||sp||No fear of foes prevailing!||br||I triumph, Lord, in Thee!||br||||sp||||sp||O Jesus! Friend unfailing,||br||How dear art Thou to me!

Son of the Father, Hail!||br||||sp||||sp||Son of God eternal!||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus! the sinner’s Friend,||br||||sp||||sp||Whose favor knows no end;||br||||sp||||sp||Love made Thee condescend,||br||||sp||||sp||With men to make abode,||br||||sp||||sp||And, through Thy precious blood,||br||||sp||||sp||We’re now brought nigh to God.||br||Thee, Saviour-Lord, we bless—||br||||sp||||sp||Our Lord Jesus!||br||Full of truth and power:||br||||sp||||sp||Highly blessed,||br||Blessed evermore.

And is it so! I shall be like Thy Son,||br||||sp||||sp||Is this the grace which He for me has won?||br||||sp||||sp||Father of glory, thought beyond all thought,||br||||sp||||sp||In glory, to His own blest likeness brought.

Oh, Jesus, Lord, who loved me like to Thee?||br||||sp||||sp||Fruit of Thy work, with Thee, too, there to see||br||||sp||||sp||Thy glory, Lord, while endless ages roll,||br||||sp||||sp||Myself the prize and travail of Thy soul.

Yet it must be, Thy love had not its rest||br||||sp||||sp||Were Thy redeemed not with Thee fully blest;||br||||sp||||sp||That love that gives not as the world but shares||br||||sp||||sp||All it possesses with its loved co-heirs.

Nor I alone, Thy loved ones all, complete||br||||sp||||sp||In glory, round Thee there with joy shall meet,||br||||sp||||sp||All like Thee, for Thy glory like Thee, Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||Object supreme of all, by all adored.

In heavenly love abiding,||br||No change my heart shall fear,||br||||sp||||sp||And safe is such confiding,||br||For nothing changes here.||br||||sp||||sp||The storm may roar without me,||br||My heart may low be laid,||br||||sp||||sp||But God is round about me,||br||And can I be dismayed?

Wherever He may guide me,||br||No want shall turn me back;||br||||sp||||sp||My Shepherd is beside me,||br||And nothing can I lack.||br||||sp||||sp||His wisdom ever waketh,||br||His sight is never dim;||br||||sp||||sp||He knows the way He taketh||br||And I will walk with Him.

Green pastures are before me,||br||Which yet I have not seen,||br||||sp||||sp||Bright skies will soon be o’er me,||br||Where the dark clouds have been.||br||||sp||||sp||My hope I cannot measure,||br||My path to life is free,||br||||sp||||sp||My Saviour has my treasure,||br||And He will walk with me.

Ere yet another morning||br||My spirit may be free,||br||||sp||||sp||As absent from the body,||br||At home, O Lord, with Thee.||br||||sp||||sp||O sleep, O rest, how precious!||br||As, guarded by Thy care,||br||||sp||||sp||I’m waiting for Thy promise||br||To meet Thee in the air.

The Lord Himself, e’en Jesus,||br||Amid the ransomed throng,||br||||sp||||sp||Its glory, joy, and beauty,||br||Its never-ending song.||br||||sp||||sp||O day of wondrous promise!||br||The Bridegroom and the bride||br||||sp||||sp||Are seen in glory ever:||br||Forever satisfied.

“Stricken, smitten, and afflicted,”||br||See Him dying on the tree!||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis the Christ by man rejected!||br||Yes, my soul, ’tis He, ’tis He!||br||||sp||||sp||Mark the sacrifice appointed!||br||See who bears the awful load!||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis the Word, ’tis God’s Anointed,||br||Son of man and Son of God.

Here we have a firm foundation;||br||Here’s the refuge of the lost;||br||||sp||||sp||Christ’s the Rock of our salvation—||br||His the name of which we boast.||br||||sp||||sp||Lamb of God! for sinners wounded—||br||Sacrifice to cancel guilt,||br||||sp||||sp||None shall ever be confounded||br||Who on Thee their hope have built.

Oh! what a Saviour is Jesus the Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||Well might His name by His saints be adored!||br||||sp||||sp||He has redeemed them from hell by His blood,||br||||sp||||sp||Saved them forever, and brought them to God.

Now in the glory He waits to impart||br||||sp||||sp||Peace to the conscience and joy to the heart—||br||||sp||||sp||Waits to be gracious, to pardon and heal||br||||sp||||sp||All who their sin and their wretchedness feel.

Thousands have fled to His spear-piercèd side,||br||||sp||||sp||Welcome they all have been, none are denied;||br||||sp||||sp||Weary and laden, they all have been blest,||br||||sp||||sp||Joyfully now in the Saviour they rest.
Thou holy One and true,||br||Our hearts in Thee confide,||br||||sp||||sp||And in the circle of Thy love,||br||As brethren we abide.
In Thee the Father rests,||br||His own anointed One,||br||||sp||||sp||In Thee alone He finds delight,||br||His well-belovèd Son.
In Thee we find delight,||br||Firstborn ’mongst brethren Thou;||br||||sp||||sp||To Thy dear name alone we cling,||br||To Thy sure word we bow.
Teach us that name to own,||br||Whilst waiting, Lord, for Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Unholiness and sin to shun,||br||From all untruth to flee.
O Jesus, precious Saviour,||br||O when wilt Thou return?||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts with woe familiar,||br||To Thee, our Master turn.
Our woe is thine, Lord Jesus,||br||Our joy is in Thy love,||br||||sp||||sp||But woe and joy all lead us||br||To Thee in heaven above.
To Thee we look, Lord Jesus,||br||To Thee whose love we know,||br||||sp||||sp||We wait the power that frees us||br||From bondage, sin, and woe.
We look for Thine appearing,||br||Thy presence here to bless,||br||||sp||||sp||We greet the day that’s nearing,||br||When all this woe shall cease.
But, oh, for us, blest Saviour,||br||How brighter far the lot,||br||||sp||||sp||To be with Thee forever,||br||Where evil enters not!
To see Thee who’st so loved us,||br||Then face to face above,||br||||sp||||sp||Whose grace at first had moved us||br||To taste and know Thy love.
With Thee, O Lord, forever,||br||Our souls shall be content,||br||||sp||||sp||No act nor thought shall ever||br||Full joy with Thee prevent.
O come, then, soon, Lord Jesus,||br||In patience still we wait,||br||||sp||||sp||Await the power that frees us—||br||Our longed-for heavenly seat.

Nothing but Christ, as on we tread,||br||||sp||||sp||The Gift unpriced—God’s living Bread,||br||||sp||||sp||With staff in hand and feet well shod,||br||||sp||||sp||Nothing but Christ—the Christ of God.
Everything loss for Him below,||br||||sp||||sp||Taking the cross where’er we go;||br||||sp||||sp||Showing to all where once He trod,||br||||sp||||sp||Nothing but Christ—the Christ of God.
Nothing save Him, in all our ways,||br||||sp||||sp||Giving the theme for ceaseless praise;||br||||sp||||sp||Our whole resource along the road,||br||||sp||||sp||Nothing but Christ—the Christ of God.

O Thou who hast redeemed of old,||br||||sp||||sp||And make us of Thy grace take hold,||br||With God at peace through Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Help me these blessings now to own,||br||||sp||||sp||And tell aloud what Thou hast done,||br||O holy Lamb for me.

Out of myself for help I go,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy power alone resolved to know,||br||Thy love’s the plea I make;||br||||sp||||sp||Give me the power, ’tis this I claim,||br||||sp||||sp||With heart and life to praise Thy name,||br||Give, for Thy mercy’s sake.

Love, only love, Thy heart inclined,||br||||sp||||sp||And brought Thee, Saviour of mankind,||br||Down from the throne above;||br||||sp||||sp||Love made Thee here a Man of grief,||br||||sp||||sp||Distressed Thee sore for our relief,||br||O mystery of love!

Lord, I am Thine, Thy love to me||br||||sp||||sp||Constrains my soul to cleave to Thee,||br||And gladly to resign||br||||sp||||sp||Whate’er I have, whate’er I am;||br||||sp||||sp||My life be all with Thine the same,||br||And all Thy shame be mine.

I heard the voice of Jesus say,||br||“Come unto Me and rest;||br||||sp||||sp||Lay down, thou weary one, lay down||br||Thy head upon My breast.”||br||||sp||||sp||I came to Jesus as I was,||br||Weary, and worn, and sad;||br||||sp||||sp||I found in Him a resting-place,||br||And He has made me glad.

I heard the voice of Jesus say,||br||“Behold I freely give||br||||sp||||sp||The living water—thirsty one,||br||Stoop down, and drink, and live.”||br||||sp||||sp||I came to Jesus, and I drank||br||Of that life-giving stream;||br||||sp||||sp||My thirst was quenched, my soul revived,||br||And now I live in Him.

I heard the voice of Jesus say,||br||“I am this dark world’s light;||br||||sp||||sp||Look unto Me: thy morn shall rise||br||And all thy day be bright.”||br||||sp||||sp||I looked to Jesus, and I found||br||In Him my Star, my Sun;||br||||sp||||sp||And in that light of life I’ll walk||br||Till traveling days are done.
A mind at “perfect peace” with God:||br||Oh, what a word is this!||br||||sp||||sp||A sinner reconciled through blood:||br||This, this indeed is peace!
By nature and by practice far,||br||How very far from God!||br||||sp||||sp||Yet now by grace brought nigh to Him,||br||Through faith in Jesus’ blood.
So nigh, so very nigh to God,||br||I cannot nearer be;||br||||sp||||sp||For in the person of His Son,||br||I am as near as He.
So dear, so very dear to God,||br||More dear I cannot be;||br||||sp||||sp||The love wherewith He loves the Son,||br||Such is His love to me.
Why should I ever careful be,||br||Since such a God is mine?||br||||sp||||sp||He watches o’er me night and day,||br||And tells me, “Thou art Mine.”
There is no other name than Thine,||br||||sp||||sp||Jehovah-Jesus! name divine;||br||||sp||||sp||On which to rest for sins forgiven,||br||||sp||||sp||For peace with God, for hope of heaven.
Name above every name, Thy praise||br||||sp||||sp||Shall fill yon courts through endless days,||br||||sp||||sp||Jehovah-Jesus! name divine,||br||||sp||||sp||Rock of Salvation—Thou art mine.

Lead, light divine, amid th’ encircling gloom—||br||||sp||||sp||Lead Thou me on;||br||||sp||||sp||The night is dark and I am far from home,||br||||sp||||sp||Lead Thou me on.||br||||sp||||sp||Keep Thou my feet; I do not ask to see||br||||sp||||sp||The distant path; one step’s enough for me.

I was not ever thus, nor prayed that Thou||br||||sp||||sp||Shouldst lead me on;||br||||sp||||sp||I loved to choose and seek my path; but now,||br||||sp||||sp||Lead Thou me on.||br||||sp||||sp||I loved the garish day, and, spite of fears||br||||sp||||sp||Pride ruled my will: remember not past years.

Thus far Thy power hath blessed me, and it still||br||||sp||||sp||Will lead me on,||br||||sp||||sp||O’er moor and fen, through tangled brakes, on till||br||||sp||||sp||The night is gone;||br||||sp||||sp||And with the morn the everlasting joy,||br||||sp||||sp||Which led me on, is mine without alloy.

Rest of the saints in glory,||br||The laborer’s bright reward,||br||||sp||||sp||How constant sounds before me,||br||“Forever with the Lord.”||br||||sp||||sp||Rest, through the toil of Jesus,||br||For saints there doth remain;||br||||sp||||sp||An endless rest and precious;||br||A rest from sin and pain.

My longing heart, now pillowed||br||On Jesus’ breast of love,||br||||sp||||sp||Hath oft to me foreshadowed,||br||That blissful rest above;||br||||sp||||sp||But, O my soul, remember,||br||None shall be weary there;||br||||sp||||sp||The ransomed without number||br||God’s blessed rest will share.

His face in radiant glory,||br||With rapture they will see;||br||||sp||||sp||His wounds will tell the story,||br||To swell the jubilee!||br||||sp||||sp||The subjects of salvation||br||Will praise Him ever there;||br||||sp||||sp||While all the new creation||br||God’s endless rest will share.

Lord, Thy love has sought and found us||br||Wandering in this desert wide,||br||||sp||||sp||Thou hast thrown Thine arms around us,||br||For us suffered, bled, and died:||br||||sp||||sp||Sing, my soul! He lovèd thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus gave Himself for me.

Hark! what sounds of bitter weeping,||br||From yon lonesome garden sweep,||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis the Lord His vigil keeping,||br||Whilst His followers sink in sleep.||br||||sp||||sp||Ah, my soul, He lovèd thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Yea, He gave Himself for me.

He is speaking to His Father,||br||Tasting deep that bitter cup||br||||sp||||sp||Yet He takes it willing rather||br||For our sakes to drink it up.||br||||sp||||sp||Oh what love! He loved me!||br||||sp||||sp||Gave Himself, my soul for thee.

Then that closing scene of anguish;||br||All God’s waves and billows roll||br||||sp||||sp||Over Him, there left to languish||br||On the cross to save my soul.||br||||sp||||sp||Matchless love! how vast, how free,||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus gave Himself for me.

Hark again! His cries are waking||br||Echoes on dark Calvary’s hill;||br||||sp||||sp||God, my God, art Thou forsaking||br||Him who always did Thy will?||br||||sp||||sp||Ah, my soul! it was for thee,||br||||sp||||sp||Yes! He gave Himself for me.

Lord, we joy, Thy toils are ended,||br||Glad Thy suffering time is o’er,||br||||sp||||sp||To Thy Father’s throne ascended,||br||There Thou liv’st to die no more.||br||||sp||||sp||Yes, my soul! He lives for thee,||br||||sp||||sp||He who gave Himself for me.

Lord, we worship and adore Thee||br||For Thy rich, Thy matchless grace,||br||||sp||||sp||Perfect soon in joy before Thee,||br||We shall see Thee face to face.||br||||sp||||sp||Yet e’en now our song shall be,||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus gave Himself for me.

In weakness and trial,||br||With God we may plead;||br||||sp||||sp||No fear of denial,||br||We’re sure to succeed:||br||||sp||||sp||For, though we oft grieve Him,||br||His promise is clear,||br||||sp||||sp||And love will believe Him:||br||||i||Our Father will hear.||/i||

’Gainst the giant like-might||br||Of our foes we can bring,||br||||sp||||sp||As our weapons of fight,||br||But a stone and a sling.||br||||sp||||sp||Should this have dismayed us,||br||Our souls it may cheer,||br||||sp||||sp||That, called on to aid us,||br||||i||Our Father will hear.||/i||

Our calls may be faint||br||As a child’s timid cry,||br||||sp||||sp||Our hearts’ feeble plaint||br||Scarce venture on high;||br||||sp||||sp||Yet Christ for us pleading,||br||We may persevere;||br||||sp||||sp||Through Him interceding,||br||||i||Our Father will hear.||/i||
Rest my soul, the work is done,||br||||sp||||sp||Done by God’s almighty Son;||br||||sp||||sp||This to faith is now so clear,||br||||sp||||sp||There’s no place for torturing fear.
Not through works of weary toil,||br||||sp||||sp||Comes the sunshine of God’s smile;||br||||sp||||sp||Won by Christ, if found in Him,||br||||sp||||sp||Brightly falls the glorious beam.
With belief in Jesus blest,||br||||sp||||sp||We are entering into rest;||br||||sp||||sp||He who full salvation brought,||br||||sp||||sp||In us all our works hath wrought.
Come, my soul, take up the cross,||br||||sp||||sp||Count the gain, despise the loss;||br||||sp||||sp||Labor for and with the Lord||br||||sp||||sp||Brings exceeding great reward.
Free from every fear of wrath,||br||||sp||||sp||Choose the laborer’s happy path,||br||||sp||||sp||Tread the way which Christ hath trod,||br||||sp||||sp||Till the sabbath of thy God.
Ye trembling saints who love the Lord,||br||Chase all your fears away;||br||||sp||||sp||For lo! the tomb is empty now—||br||The place where Jesus lay.
Thus low the Lord of life was brought,||br||Such wonders love can do;||br||||sp||||sp||There cold in death that bosom lay||br||Which throbbed and bled for you.
Then raise your eyes, and tune your songs,||br||For Jesus lives again;||br||||sp||||sp||Not all the powers of death and hell||br||The Saviour could detain.
Exalted far above the skies,||br||Behold your living Head,||br||||sp||||sp||The Lord upon the Father’s throne,||br||Who dwelt among the dead.

All the path the saints are treading,||br||Trodden by the Son of God||br||||sp||||sp||All the sorrows they are feeling,||br||Felt by Him along the road:||br||||sp||||sp||All the darkness and the sorrow||br||From around and from within,||br||||sp||||sp||All the joy and all the triumph,||br||He passed through apart from sin.

Now come forth in resurrection,||br||Passing onward to the throne;||br||||sp||||sp||Having suffered all the judgment,||br||Borne the storm of wrath alone:||br||||sp||||sp||He is able thus to succor||br||Those who tread the desert sand,||br||||sp||||sp||Pressing on to resurrection,||br||Where He sits at God’s right hand.

Now He praises in th’ assembly,||br||Now the sorrow all is passed;||br||||sp||||sp||His the earnest of our portion,||br||We must reach the goal at last.||br||||sp||||sp||Yes, He praises! grace recounting||br||All the path already trod—||br||||sp||||sp||We associated with Him—||br||God, our Father and our God.

Join the singing that He leadeth,||br||Loud to God our voices raise;||br||||sp||||sp||Every step that we have trodden||br||Is a triumph of His grace;||br||||sp||||sp||Whether joy, or whether trial,||br||All can only work for good,||br||||sp||||sp||For He healeth all—who loves us,||br||And hath bought us with His blood.

It is finished! It is finished!||br||Who can tell redemption’s worth?||br||||sp||||sp||He who knows it leads the singing—||br||Full the joy as fierce the wrath.||br||||sp||||sp||Taken up in resurrection,||br||Desert ways rehearsed above,||br||||sp||||sp||Tell the power of God’s salvation,||br||And His never-failing love.

We go to meet the Saviour,||br||His glorious face to see;||br||||sp||||sp||What manner of behavior||br||Doth with this hope agree?||br||||sp||||sp||May God’s illumination||br||Guide heart and walk aright;||br||||sp||||sp||That so our preparation||br||Be pleasing in His sight.

We’d gladly while the hours,||br||Till night shall pass away,||br||||sp||||sp||And chant with all our powers||br||The blessings of that day;||br||||sp||||sp||To Thee, the Lord of glory,||br||We’d raise the happy song,||br||||sp||||sp||And make Thy love’s bright story||br||The theme of every tongue.

Not sinful man’s endeavor,||br||Nor any mortal’s care,||br||||sp||||sp||Could draw Thy sovereign favor||br||To sinners in despair;||br||||sp||||sp||Uncalled, Thou cam’st with gladness,||br||Us from the fall to raise,||br||||sp||||sp||And change our grief and sadness||br||To songs of joy and praise.

The Lord of life is risen,||br||Has left the darksome grave,||br||||sp||||sp||And, death by Him abolished,||br||He’s mighty now to save;||br||||sp||||sp||And we with Him are risen,||br||The fruit of all His toil,||br||||sp||||sp||The firstfruits of His harvest,||br||His suffering’s richest spoil.

The Lord of life is seated||br||At God’s right hand on high—||br||||sp||||sp||God’s just and righteous answer||br||To grace which stooped to die;||br||||sp||||sp||In Him we too are seated,||br||Oh blessed, wondrous grace!||br||||sp||||sp||Accepted and belovèd,||br||In Him, in sonship’s place.

The Lord of life is coming||br||To perfect all His grace;||br||||sp||||sp||To take His blood-bought people||br||To fill their heavenly place;||br||||sp||||sp||Oh! with what joy ascending||br||We’ll meet Him in the air,||br||||sp||||sp||To dwell with Him in glory,||br||And His blest image bear.

We adore Thee evermore; Hallelujah!||br||||sp||||sp||Saviour, for Thy boundless grace; Hallelujah!||br||||sp||||sp||For the cross, whereby to us, Hallelujah!||br||||sp||||sp||Sure is made eternal bliss; Hallelujah!

For Thy death which set us free, Hallelujah!||br||||sp||||sp||From sin’s cruel slavery; Hallelujah!||br||||sp||||sp||For Thine all-atoning blood, Hallelujah!||br||||sp||||sp||Which hath brought us nigh to God; Hallelujah!
How can we sink with such a prop,||br||As the eternal God,||br||||sp||||sp||Who bears the earth’s huge pillars up||br||And spread the heavens abroad?
How can we die if Jesus lives,||br||As risen from the dead,||br||||sp||||sp||Since life and grace our souls receive||br||In our exalted Head?
All that we are, and all we have,||br||Shall be forever Thine;||br||||sp||||sp||And all a cheerful heart could give,||br||Our willing hands resign.
And could we yet make some reserve,||br||And duty did not call,||br||||sp||||sp||We love Thee, Lord, with such a love,||br||That we would give it all.

Hail to the Lord’s anointed!||br||Great David’s greater Son:||br||||sp||||sp||When to the time appointed||br||The rolling years shall run,||br||||sp||||sp||He comes to break oppression,||br||To set the captive free;||br||||sp||||sp||To take away transgression,||br||And rule in equity.

The heavens—which now conceal Him||br||In counsels deep and wise—||br||||sp||||sp||In glory shall reveal Him||br||To our adoring eyes;||br||||sp||||sp||He who with hands uplifted||br||Went from the earth below,||br||||sp||||sp||Shall come again all gifted,||br||His blessings to bestow.

He shall come down like showers||br||Upon the new-mown grass,||br||||sp||||sp||And joy and hope, like flowers,||br||Spring up where He doth pass.||br||||sp||||sp||Before Him, on the mountains,||br||Shall Peace, the herald go;||br||||sp||||sp||And righteousness, in fountains,||br||From hill to valley flow.

Kings shall fall down before Him,||br||And gold and incense bring;||br||||sp||||sp||All nations shall adore Him,||br||His praise all people sing,||br||||sp||||sp||Outstretched His wide dominion||br||O’er river, sea, and shore,||br||||sp||||sp||Far as the eagle’s pinion,||br||Or dove’s light wing can soar.

Raise glad the song! for we can tell||br||||sp||||sp||How sovereign grace dissolved the spell||br||That kept us bound in chains;||br||||sp||||sp||And from that dear and happy day,||br||||sp||||sp||How oft constrained by grace to say,||br||||i||That Grace triumphant reigns!||/i||

Yes! though we’ve strayed like saints of old,||br||||sp||||sp||Grace has restored us to the fold||br||As captives in its chains;||br||||sp||||sp||Thus, saved by grace, we’d gladly sing,||br||||sp||||sp||Till all the earth and heavens ring||br||||i||With Grace triumphant reigns!||/i||

Grace still—till all redeemed by blood||br||||sp||||sp||Are taught to know themselves and God—||br||Its empire shall maintain;||br||||sp||||sp||To spoil the mighty of the prey,||br||||sp||||sp||To set the captive exile free,||br||||i||Shall Grace triumphant reign.||/i||

Then called to meet the church’s Head,||br||||sp||||sp||The Saviour’s grace shall banish dread,||br||His love our souls sustain;||br||||sp||||sp||And, as we rise to endless day,||br||||sp||||sp||We’ll raise the voice and boldly say,||br||||i||Grace doth triumphant reign!||/i||

Saviour! lead us by Thy power||br||Safe into the promised rest;||br||||sp||||sp||Choose the path, the way whatever||br||Seems to Thee, O Lord, the best:||br||||sp||||sp||Be our Guide in every peril,||br||Watch and keep us night and day,||br||||sp||||sp||Else our foolish hearts will wander||br||From the straight and narrow way.

Since in Thee is our redemption,||br||And salvation full and free,||br||||sp||||sp||Nothing need our souls dishearten||br||But forgetfulness of Thee:||br||||sp||||sp||Naught can stay our steady progress,||br||More than conquerors we shall be,||br||||sp||||sp||If our eye, whate’er the danger,||br||Looks to Thee, and none but Thee.

In Thy presence we are happy;||br||In Thy presence we’re secure;||br||||sp||||sp||In Thy presence all afflictions||br||We can easily endure;||br||||sp||||sp||In Thy presence we can conquer,||br||We can suffer, we can die;||br||||sp||||sp||Wandering from Thee we are feeble;||br||Let Thy love, Lord, keep us nigh.

O God of grace, our Father,||br||All praise we give to Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis in Thy sovereign favor||br||All blessedness we see;||br||||sp||||sp||There only is the fountain||br||Whence living waters flow,||br||||sp||||sp||Which like a glorious river||br||Still gladden as they go.

As Thine, Thou didst foreknow us||br||From all eternity;||br||||sp||||sp||Thy chosen, loved ones ever,||br||Kept present to Thine eye;||br||||sp||||sp||And when was come the moment,||br||Thou, calling by Thy grace,||br||||sp||||sp||Didst gently, firmly draw us||br||Each from his hiding-place.

Thy word, Thyself reflecting,||br||Doth sanctify by truth,||br||||sp||||sp||Still leading on Thy children||br||With gentle heavenly growth.||br||||sp||||sp||Thus still the work proceedeth,||br||The work begun by grace,||br||||sp||||sp||For each is meet, and training,||br||Father, to see Thy face.
God moves in a mysterious way,||br||His wonders to perform;||br||||sp||||sp||He plants His footsteps in the sea,||br||And rides upon the storm.
Deep in unfathomable mines||br||Of never-failing skill,||br||||sp||||sp||He treasures up His bright designs,||br||And works His sovereign will.
(Ye fearful saints fresh courage take,||br||The clouds ye so much dread||br||||sp||||sp||Are big with mercy, and shall break||br||In blessings on your head.
Judge not the Lord by feeble sense,||br||But trust Him for His grace;||br||||sp||||sp||Behind a frowning providence||br||He hides a smiling face.)
His purposes will ripen fast,||br||Unfolding every hour;||br||||sp||||sp||The bud may have a bitter taste,||br||But sweet will be the flower.
Blind unbelief is sure to err,||br||And scan His work in vain;||br||||sp||||sp||God is His own interpreter,||br||And He will make it plain.

O gracious Shepherd! bind us||br||With cords of love to Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||And evermore remind us||br||How mercy set us free.||br||||sp||||sp||O may the Holy Spirit||br||Keep this before our eyes,||br||||sp||||sp||That we Thy death and merit||br||Above all else may prize!

We are of God’s salvation||br||Assurèd through Thy love,||br||||sp||||sp||Yet oft, on slight occasion,||br||How faithless do we prove.||br||||sp||||sp||Thou hast our sins forgiven—||br||Then leaving all behind,||br||||sp||||sp||We would press on to heaven,||br||Bearing the prize in mind.

O may we, then Lord, ever,||br||While in this vale of tears,||br||||sp||||sp||Look up to Thee, and never||br||Give way to anxious fears.||br||||sp||||sp||For Thou wilt not forsake us||br||Though we are oft to blame;||br||||sp||||sp||O let Thy love then make us||br||True to Thy faith and name!

Have I an object, Lord, below||br||Which would divide my heart with Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Which would divert its even flow||br||In answer to Thy constancy?||br||||sp||||sp||Oh teach me quickly to return,||br||||sp||||sp||And cause my heart afresh to burn.

Have I a hope, however dear,||br||Which would defer Thy coming, Lord!||br||||sp||||sp||Which would detain my spirit here||br||(Where naught can lasting joy afford)?||br||||sp||||sp||From it, my Saviour, set me free,||br||||sp||||sp||To look, and long, and wait for Thee.

Be Thou the object bright and fair||br||To fill and satisfy the heart;||br||||sp||||sp||My hope to meet Thee in the air,||br||And nevermore from Thee to part:||br||||sp||||sp||That I may undistracted be||br||||sp||||sp||To follow, serve, and wait for Thee.
God in mercy sent His Son||br||||sp||||sp||To a world by sin undone;||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus Christ was crucified—||br||||sp||||sp||||i||’Twas for sinners Jesus died.||/i||
O the glory of the grace,||br||||sp||||sp||Shining in the Saviour’s face,||br||||sp||||sp||Telling sinners from above,||br||||sp||||sp||“God is light,” and “God is love.”
Sin and death no more shall reign,||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus died and lives again!||br||||sp||||sp||In the glory’s highest height—||br||||sp||||sp||See Him God’s supreme delight.
All who in His name believe,||br||||sp||||sp||Everlasting life receive;||br||||sp||||sp||Lord of all is Jesus now,||br||||sp||||sp||Every knee to Him must bow.
Christ the Lord will come again,||br||||sp||||sp||He who suffered once will reign,||br||||sp||||sp||Every tongue at last will own,||br||||sp||||sp||“Worthy is the Lamb” alone.

The Father sent the Son||br||A ruined world to save;||br||||sp||||sp||Man meted to the Sinless One||br||||sp||||sp||The cross—the grave;||br||||sp||||sp||Blest Substitute from God,||br||Wrath’s awful cup He drained;||br||||sp||||sp||Laid down His life, and e’en the tomb’s||br||||sp||||sp||Reproach sustained.

The new and living Way||br||Stands open now to heaven;||br||||sp||||sp||Thence, where the blood is seen alway,||br||||sp||||sp||God’s gift is given.||br||||sp||||sp||The river of His grace,||br||Through righteousness supplied,||br||||sp||||sp||Is flowing o’er the barren place||br||||sp||||sp||Where Jesus died!

The Lord shall come again!||br||The Conqueror must reign!||br||||sp||||sp||No tongue but shall confess Him then,||br||||sp||||sp||The Lamb once slain:||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus is worthy now||br||All homage to receive;||br||||sp||||sp||O! sinner, to the Saviour bow,||br||||sp||||sp||The truth believe!
There is life in a look at the crucified One;||br||There is life at this moment for thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Then look, sinner, look unto Him and be saved—||br||Unto Him who was nailed to the tree.
His anguish of soul on the cross hast thou seen?||br||His cry of distress hast thou heard?||br||||sp||||sp||Then why, if the terrors of wrath He endured,||br||Should pardon to thee be deferred?

We are healed by His stripes. Wouldst thou add to the word?||br||And He is our righteousness made;||br||||sp||||sp||The best robe of heaven He bids thee put on||br||Oh! couldst thou be better arrayed?
Then doubt not thy welcome, since God hath declared||br||There remaineth no more to be done;||br||||sp||||sp||Christ once in the end of the world hath appeared,||br||And completed the work He begun.
Oh take, with rejoicing, from Jesus at once||br||The life everlasting He gives;||br||||sp||||sp||And know with assurance thou never canst die,||br||Since Jesus thy righteousness lives.
There is life in a look at the crucified One:||br||There is life at this moment for thee:||br||||sp||||sp||Then look, sinner—look unto Him and be saved,||br||And know thyself spotless as He.
Broken heart! the fountain’s open,||br||Christ hath died upon the tree,||br||||sp||||sp||All the powers of hell are shaken,||br||Grace flows down from God to thee.
God Himself, the Source, the Fountain,||br||Christ the Way the waters flow,||br||||sp||||sp||By the Spirit manifested,||br||He the finished work hath done.
By one righteousness completed,||br||Adam’s life receives its doom;||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus Christ, in glory seated,||br||Everlasting life hath won.
Broken heart! the river’s flowing,||br||Haste! delay not! yet there’s room;||br||||sp||||sp||Hear the word of God beseeching,||br||“Whosoever thirst may come.”
O what a gift the Father gave||br||When He bestowed His Son!||br||||sp||||sp||To save poor ruined, guilty man,||br||By sin defiled, undone.
For I was lost and vile indeed!||br||To sin a willing prey,||br||||sp||||sp||Till God in mercy interposed,||br||And turned my night to day.
Now I can call the Saviour mine,||br||Though all unworthy still;||br||||sp||||sp||I’m sheltered by His precious blood||br||Beyond the reach of ill.
Come, all who trust in Jesus, now,||br||And tell our joys abroad;||br||||sp||||sp||Let thankful hymns of praise ascend||br||For Christ the gift of God.

Behold! behold the Lamb of God||br||||sp||||sp||On the cross;||br||||sp||||sp||For us He shed His precious blood,||br||||sp||||sp||On The cross.||br||||sp||||sp||Oh, hear the overwhelming cry:||br||||sp||||sp||“Eli lama sabachthani?”||br||||sp||||sp||Draw near and see the Saviour die||br||||sp||||sp||On the cross.

Come, sinner, see Him lifted up||br||||sp||||sp||On the cross:||br||||sp||||sp||He drinks for you the bitter cup,||br||||sp||||sp||On the cross;||br||||sp||||sp||The rocks do rend, the mountains quake,||br||||sp||||sp||While Jesus doth atonement make—||br||||sp||||sp||While Jesus suffers for our sake,||br||||sp||||sp||On the cross.

Where’er I go I’ll tell the story||br||||sp||||sp||Of the cross;||br||||sp||||sp||In nothing else my soul shall glory||br||||sp||||sp||Save the cross;||br||||sp||||sp||Yea, this my constant theme shall be,||br||||sp||||sp||Through time and in eternity,||br||||sp||||sp||That Jesus tasted death for me||br||||sp||||sp||On the cross.
Alas! and did my Saviour bleed!||br||And did my Saviour die?||br||||sp||||sp||Would He devote that sacred head||br||For such a worm as I?
Was it for crimes that I have done||br||He groaned upon the tree?||br||||sp||||sp||Amazing pity, grace unknown,||br||And love beyond degree!
Well might the sun in darkness hide,||br||And shut his glories in,||br||||sp||||sp||When the Incarnate Maker died||br||For man His creature’s sin.

Come, ye sinners poor and needy,||br||Weak and wounded, sick and sore,||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus ready stands to save you,||br||Full of pity, love, and power;||br||||sp||||sp||He is able,||br||He is willing, doubt no more.

Let not conscience make you linger,||br||Nor of fitness fondly dream;||br||||sp||||sp||All the fitness He requireth||br||Is to feel your need of Him.||br||||sp||||sp||This He gives you,||br||’Tis the Spirit’s rising beam.

Come, ye weary, heavy-laden,||br||Lost and ruined by the fall;||br||||sp||||sp||If you tarry till you’re better,||br||You will never come at all.||br||||sp||||sp||Not the righteous,||br||Sinners Jesus came to call.

Agonizing in the garden,||br||Lo! the Saviour prostrate lies;||br||||sp||||sp||On the bloody tree behold Him,||br||Hear Him cry before He dies,||br||||sp||||sp||“It is finished!”||br||Sinner, will not this suffice?

Lo! the Incarnate God ascended,||br||Pleads the merits of His blood;||br||||sp||||sp||Venture on Him, venture freely,||br||Let no other trust intrude:||br||||sp||||sp||None but Jesus||br||Can do helpless sinners good.

“Call them in”—the poor, the wretched,||br||Sin-stained wanderers from the fold;||br||||sp||||sp||Peace and pardon freely offer;||br||Can you weigh their worth with gold?||br||||sp||||sp||“Call them in”—the weak, the weary,||br||Laden with the doom of sin;||br||||sp||||sp||Bid them come and rest in Jesus;||br||He is waiting—“call them in.”

“Call them in”—the brokenhearted,||br||Cowering ’neath the brand of shame;||br||||sp||||sp||Speak love’s message low and tender||br||||i||’Twas for sinners Jesus came.||br||||sp||||sp||||/i||See, the shadows lengthen round us,||br||Soon the day-dawn will begin;||br||||sp||||sp||Can you leave them lost and lonely?||br||Christ is coming—“call them in.”
Vain is the thought of man||br||To merit heaven by prayer;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis only Jesus’ precious blood||br||Can give admission there.
Could ceaseless prayers ascend,||br||Could tears forever flow;||br||||sp||||sp||The soul were still unblest, unsaved,||br||And peace could never know.
But faith’s one look at Christ||br||Expiring on the tree—||br||||sp||||sp||One heart-believing glance at Him,||br||Can set the sinner free.
None can, without the blood||br||Of Jesus, be forgiven;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis resting on the blood alone||br||That fits the soul for heaven.
Come, weary, anxious laden soul,||br||||sp||||sp||To Jesus come, and be made whole;||br||||sp||||sp||On Him your heavy burden roll—||br||||sp||||sp||Come, anxious sinner, come!
Behold the cross on which He died;||br||||sp||||sp||Behold His wounded, bleeding side:||br||||sp||||sp||Come, in His precious love confide—||br||||sp||||sp||Come, anxious sinner, come!
True joy the world can ne’er afford,||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis found alone in Christ the Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||In Him for wretched sinners, stored—||br||||sp||||sp||Come, anxious sinner, come!
God loves to hear the contrite cry,||br||||sp||||sp||He loves to see the tearful eye,||br||||sp||||sp||To read the Spirit’s deep-felt sigh—||br||||sp||||sp||Come, anxious sinner, come!
Oh! if to Jesus you repair,||br||||sp||||sp||You’ll find eternal comfort there,||br||||sp||||sp||And soon shall heavenly glory share—||br||||sp||||sp||Come, anxious sinner, come!

Ho! ye that thirst, approach the spring||br||Whence living waters flow;||br||||sp||||sp||Free to that open fountain all||br||Without a price may go.||br||Without a price may go;||br||||sp||||sp||Free to that open fountain all||br||Without a price may go.

How long to streams of false delight||br||Will ye in crowds repair?||br||||sp||||sp||How long your strength and substance waste||br||On trifles light as air?||br||On trifles light as air?||br||||sp||||sp||How long your strength and substance waste||br||On trifles light as air?

My stores afford those rich supplies||br||That health and pleasure give;||br||||sp||||sp||Incline your ear and come to Me:||br||The soul that hears shall live.||br||The soul that hears shall live,||br||||sp||||sp||Incline your ear and come to Me:||br||The soul that hears shall live.

Seek ye the Lord while yet His ear||br||Is open to your call;||br||||sp||||sp||While offered mercy still is near,||br||Before His footstool fall.||br||Before His footstool fall,||br||||sp||||sp||While offered mercy still is near,||br||Before His footstool fall.

Not all the gold of all the world,||br||And all its wealth combined,||br||||sp||||sp||Could give relief, or comfort yield,||br||To one distracted mind;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis only to the precious blood||br||Of Christ the soul can fly,||br||||sp||||sp||There only can a sinner find||br||A flowing full supply.

Gold could not give the heart relief||br||The malefactor craved,||br||||sp||||sp||Ah, no! ’twas Christ, the Christ of God,||br||That dying sinner saved;||br||||sp||||sp||Faith’s view of Him who bleeding hung||br||A victim by His side,||br||||sp||||sp||He saw, he knew, the Lord was there,||br||The Lord for him had died.

O what can equal joy divine?||br||And what can sweeter be||br||||sp||||sp||Than knowing that this Christ is mine||br||To all eternity?||br||||sp||||sp||Safe in the Lord, without a doubt,||br||By virtue of the blood;||br||||sp||||sp||For nothing can destroy the life||br||That’s hid with Christ in God.
