Hark! the voice of Jesus calling—||br||“Come, ye laden, come to Me;||br||||sp||||sp||I have rest and peace to offer,||br||Rest, thou laboring one, for thee:||br||||sp||||sp||Take salvation—||br||Take it ||i||now||/i|| and happy be.”

Yes; though high in heavenly glory,||br||Still the Saviour calls to thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Faith can hear His gracious accents—||br||“Come, ye laden, come to Me;||br||||sp||||sp||Take salvation—||br||Take it ||i||now||/i|| and happy be.”

Soon that voice will cease its calling,||br||Now it speaks, and speaks to thee:||br||||sp||||sp||Sinner, heed the gracious message—||br||To the blood for refuge flee:||br||||sp||||sp||“Take salvation—||br||Take it ||i||now||/i|| and happy be.”

Life is found alone in Jesus,||br||Only there ’tis offered thee—||br||||sp||||sp||Offered without price or money,||br||’Tis the gift of God sent free,||br||||sp||||sp||“Take salvation—||br||Take it ||i||now||/i|| and happy be.”
What, sinner, canst thou do?||br||Where, sinner, canst thou fly?||br||||sp||||sp||Eternal wrath hangs o’er thy head,||br||And judgment lingers nigh.
For God must visit sin||br||With His displeasure sore:||br||||sp||||sp||Since He is holy, just, and true,||br||And righteous evermore.
So Jesus died for sin—||br||Upon the cross He died;||br||||sp||||sp||God’s righteousness was there displayed,||br||And justice satisfied.
Faith is the way of life;||br||Believe in Christ and live;||br||||sp||||sp||Fly to the shelter of His blood,||br||And peace with God receive.

I am not told to labor||br||To put away my sin;||br||||sp||||sp||So foolish, weak, and helpless,||br||I never could begin.||br||||sp||||sp||But blessed truth—I know it!||br||Though ruined by the fall,||br||||sp||||sp||Christ for my soul hath suffered,||br||Yes, Christ has done it all!

And if I now would seek Him—||br||In love He sought for me,||br||||sp||||sp||When far from Him I wandered||br||In sin and misery;||br||||sp||||sp||He oped my ears and gave me||br||To listen to His call;||br||||sp||||sp||He sought me and He found me,||br||Yes, Christ has done it all!

And now I cannot please Him||br||In aught I say or do,||br||||sp||||sp||Unless He daily help me||br||His glory to pursue;||br||||sp||||sp||Still helpless and still feeble,||br||On His strong arm I fall,||br||||sp||||sp||My strength in pressing onward—||br||Yes, Christ has done it all!

And when in heavenly glory||br||My ransomed soul shall be,||br||||sp||||sp||From sin and all pollution||br||Forever, ever free,||br||||sp||||sp||I’ll cast my crown before Him,||br||And loud His grace extol—||br||||sp||||sp||“Thou hast Thy self redeemed me;||br||Yes, Thou hast done it all.”
“All things are ready,” Come,||br||Come to the supper spread;||br||||sp||||sp||Come, rich and poor; come, old and young,||br||Come, and be richly fed.
“All things are ready,” Come,||br||O make no vain excuse:||br||||sp||||sp||No yoke of oxen, wife, or field,||br||Instead of Jesus choose.
“All things are ready,” Come,||br||The invitation’s given,||br||||sp||||sp||Through Him who now in glory sits||br||At God’s right hand in heaven.
“All things are ready,” Come,||br||The door is open wide;||br||||sp||||sp||O feast upon the love of God,||br||For Christ His Son has died.
“All things are ready,” Come,||br||All hindrance is removed;||br||||sp||||sp||And God, in Christ, His precious love||br||To fallen man has proved.
“All things are ready,” Come,||br||Tomorrow may not be;||br||||sp||||sp||O sinner, come, the Saviour waits||br||This hour to welcome thee!

Though all the beasts that live and feed||br||||sp||||sp||Upon a thousand hills should bleed—||br||Though all their blood should flow,||br||||sp||||sp||The sacrifice would be in vain,||br||||sp||||sp||The stain of sin would still remain:||br||Sin is not cancelled so.

“A better sacrifice” than these||br||||sp||||sp||It needs, the conscience to appease||br||Or satisfy the Lord:||br||||sp||||sp||No blood hath virtue to atone||br||||sp||||sp||For man’s offence, but His alone||br||Whose title is “The Word.”

His who could say, Himself the Son,||br||||sp||||sp||“My Father and Myself are one,”||br||Who made the world around;||br||||sp||||sp||His, who Jehovah’s Fellow stood,||br||||sp||||sp||And claimed equality with God,||br||Whose glory knows no bounds.

Jesus the Christ, on earth His name,||br||||sp||||sp||He came—in love to sinners came—||br||And bowed His head and died;||br||||sp||||sp||A full atonement now is made,||br||||sp||||sp||The ransom, by His death, is paid,||br||And justice satisfied.

That sinners might draw near to Him||br||||sp||||sp||God planned this great, this gracious scheme,||br||And found the ransom too:||br||||sp||||sp||Let all His saints their voices raise,||br||||sp||||sp||And sing the great Redeemer’s praise||br||While endless ages flow.

Go, tell thy wants to Jesus,||br||Thou needy, anxious one;||br||||sp||||sp||Spread out thy case to Jesus,||br||And look to Him alone;||br||||sp||||sp||To God confess, through Jesus,||br||He’s faithful to forgive;||br||||sp||||sp||And love the name of Jesus,||br||Through whom alone we live.

And follow only Jesus||br||Through the world’s trackless maze;||br||||sp||||sp||And yield each day to Jesus||br||The tribute of thy praise;||br||||sp||||sp||Oh! praise the name of Jesus||br||Above aught else beside;||br||||sp||||sp||Till thou above, with Jesus,||br||In light be glorified.

Come! hear the gospel sound—||br||“Yet there is room!”||br||||sp||||sp||It tells to all around—||br||“Yet there is room!”||br||||sp||||sp||Though guilty, now draw near,||br||||sp||||sp||Though vile, you need not fear,||br||||sp||||sp||With joy you now may hear—||br||“Yet there is room!”

God’s love in Christ we see—||br||“Yet there is room!”||br||||sp||||sp||Greater it could not be—||br||“Yet there is room!”||br||||sp||||sp||His only Son He gave,||br||||sp||||sp||He’s righteous now to save||br||||sp||||sp||All who on ||i||Him||/i|| believe:||br||“Yet there is room!”

“All things are ready: come!”||br||“Yet there is room!”||br||||sp||||sp||Christ everything hath done:||br||“Yet there is room!”||br||||sp||||sp||The work is now complete;||br||||sp||||sp||Before the mercy-seat||br||||sp||||sp||A Saviour you will meet:||br||“Yet there is room!”

God’s house is filling fast,||br||“Yet there is room!”||br||||sp||||sp||Some guest will be the last,||br||“Yet there is room!”||br||||sp||||sp||Yes! soon salvation’s day||br||||sp||||sp||To you will pass away,||br||||sp||||sp||Then grace no more will say—||br||“Yet there is room!”
The perfect righteousness of God||br||||sp||||sp||Is witnessed in the Saviour’s blood;||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis in the cross of Christ we trace||br||||sp||||sp||His righteousness, yet wondrous grace.
God could not pass the sinner by,||br||||sp||||sp||His sin demands that he must die;||br||||sp||||sp||But in the cross of Christ we see||br||||sp||||sp||How God can save, yet righteous be.
The sin alights on Jesus’ head,||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis in His blood sin’s debt is paid;||br||||sp||||sp||Stern justice can demand no more,||br||||sp||||sp||And mercy can dispense her store.
The sinner who believes is free,||br||||sp||||sp||Can say, “The Saviour died for me:”||br||||sp||||sp||Can point to the atoning blood,||br||||sp||||sp||And say, “This made my peace with God.”

By faith I see the Saviour dying,||br||||sp||||sp||On the tree;||br||||sp||||sp||To ruined sinners He is crying,||br||||sp||||sp||“Look to Me.”||br||||sp||||sp||He bids the guilty now draw near,||br||||sp||||sp||Hark, hark! His precious words I hear—||br||||sp||||sp||So soft, so sweet, they banish fear—||br||||sp||||sp||“Mercy’s free.”

This mercy still my soul refreshes—||br||||sp||||sp||Oh how free,||br||||sp||||sp||And every moment Christ is precious||br||||sp||||sp||Unto me.||br||||sp||||sp||None can describe the bliss I prove,||br||||sp||||sp||While through the wilderness I rove,||br||||sp||||sp||Enjoying still my Saviour’s love—||br||||sp||||sp||“Mercy’s free.”

Long as I live I’d still be crying,||br||||sp||||sp||“Mercy’s free”;||br||||sp||||sp||Point to the Lamb for sinners dying||br||||sp||||sp||On the tree.||br||||sp||||sp||There all my foes He hath withstood,||br||||sp||||sp||Washed all my sins away with blood,||br||||sp||||sp||Made manifest the love of God||br||||sp||||sp||E’en to me.

How sweet the truth, ye sinners, hear it,||br||||sp||||sp||“Mercy’s free.”||br||||sp||||sp||Ye saints of God, to all declare it,||br||||sp||||sp||“Mercy’s free.”||br||||sp||||sp||Visit your neighbor’s dark abode,||br||||sp||||sp||Proclaim to all this love of God,||br||||sp||||sp||Oh spread the joyful news abroad,||br||||sp||||sp||“Mercy’s free.”
Oh! the peace forever flowing||br||From God’s thoughts of His own Son,||br||||sp||||sp||Oh, the peace of simply knowing||br||On the cross that all was done.
Peace with God, the blood in heaven||br||Speaks of pardon now to me:||br||||sp||||sp||Peace with God! the Lord is risen!||br||Righteousness now counts me free.
Peace with God—is Christ in glory,||br||God is just and God is love;||br||||sp||||sp||Jesus died to tell the story,||br||Foes to bring to God above.
Now free access to the Father,||br||Through the Christ of God we have;||br||||sp||||sp||By the Spirit here abiding,||br||Promise of the Father’s love.
Jesus, Saviour, we adore Thee!||br||Christ of God—anointed Son;||br||||sp||||sp||We confess Thee, Lord of glory,||br||Fruits of victory Thou hast won!
We sing of the realms of the blest,||br||||sp||||sp||That country so bright and so fair,||br||||sp||||sp||The glorious mansions of rest—||br||||sp||||sp||But what must it be to be there?
We tell of its service of love;||br||||sp||||sp||The robes which the glorified wear;||br||||sp||||sp||The church of the Firstborn above—||br||||sp||||sp||But what must it be to be there?
We tell of its freedom from sin,||br||||sp||||sp||From sorrow, temptation, and care,||br||||sp||||sp||From trials without and within—||br||||sp||||sp||But what must it be to be there?
Do Thou, Lord, ’midst pleasure and woe,||br||||sp||||sp||Still for heaven our spirits prepare;||br||||sp||||sp||And shortly we also shall know||br||||sp||||sp||And feel what it is to be there.
Oh, my Saviour crucified,||br||||sp||||sp||Near Thy cross would I abide,||br||||sp||||sp||Gazing with adoring eye||br||||sp||||sp||On Thy dying agony.
Jesus bruised and put to shame,||br||||sp||||sp||Tells the glories of God’s name;||br||||sp||||sp||Holy judgment there I found,||br||||sp||||sp||Grace did there o’er sin abound.
God is love I surely know,||br||||sp||||sp||In the Saviour’s depth of woe;||br||||sp||||sp||In the Sinless, in God’s sight,||br||||sp||||sp||Sin is justly brought to light.
In His spotless soul’s distress,||br||||sp||||sp||I have learnt my guiltiness;||br||||sp||||sp||Oh, how vile my low estate,||br||||sp||||sp||Since my ransom was so great.
Rent the veil that closed the way||br||||sp||||sp||To my home of heavenly day,||br||||sp||||sp||In the flesh of Christ the Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||Ever be His name adored.
Yet in sight of Calvary,||br||||sp||||sp||Contrite should my spirit be,||br||||sp||||sp||Rest and holiness there find,||br||||sp||||sp||Fashioned like my Saviour’s mind.

It passeth ||i||knowledge!||/i|| that dear love of Thine,||br||||sp||||sp||My Jesus! Saviour! yet this soul of mine||br||||sp||||sp||Would of Thy love, in all its breadth and length,||br||||sp||||sp||Its height and depth and everlasting strength,||br||||sp||||sp||Know more and more.

It passeth ||i||telling!||/i|| that dear love of Thine,||br||||sp||||sp||My Jesus! Saviour! yet these lips of mine||br||||sp||||sp||Would fain proclaim to sinners far and near||br||||sp||||sp||A love which can remove all guilty fear,||br||||sp||||sp||And love beget.

It passeth ||i||praises!||/i|| that dear love of Thine,||br||||sp||||sp||My Jesus! Saviour! yet this heart of mine,||br||||sp||||sp||Would sing a love so rich—so full—so free,||br||||sp||||sp||Which brought a rebel sinner such as me,||br||||sp||||sp||Nigh unto God.

But though I cannot tell, or sing, or know,||br||||sp||||sp||The fullness of Thy love while here below,||br||||sp||||sp||My empty vessel I may freely bring—||br||||sp||||sp||O Thou, who art of love the living spring,||br||||sp||||sp||My vessel fill.

I ||i||am||/i|| an empty vessel—scarce one thought,||br||||sp||||sp||Or look of love to Thee I’ve ever brought;||br||||sp||||sp||Yet I may come, and come again to Thee,||br||||sp||||sp||With this the empty sinner’s only plea—||br||||sp||||sp||||i||“Thou lovest me!”||/i||

Oh! fill me, Jesus Saviour with Thy love;||br||||sp||||sp||Lead, lead me to the living fount above!||br||||sp||||sp||Thither may I in simple faith draw nigh||br||||sp||||sp||And never to another fountain fly,||br||||sp||||sp||But unto Thee.

And, Jesus, when Thee face to face I see,||br||||sp||||sp||When on Thy lofty throne I sit with Thee;||br||||sp||||sp||Then of Thy love in all its breadth and length,||br||||sp||||sp||Its height and depth, its everlasting strength,||br||||sp||||sp||My soul shall sing.

I was a wandering sheep,||br||I did not love the fold;||br||||sp||||sp||I did not love my Shepherd’s voice.||br||I would not be controlled:||br||I was a wayward child,||br||I did not love my home,||br||||sp||||sp||I did not love my Father’s voice,||br||I loved afar to roam.

The Shepherd sought His sheep,||br||The Father sought His child:||br||||sp||||sp||He followed me o’er vale and hill,||br||O’er desert waste and wild:||br||He found me nigh to death,||br||Famished and faint and lone;||br||||sp||||sp||He bound me with the chains of love,||br||He saved the wandering one.

Jesus my Shepherd is:||br||’Twas He that loved my soul,||br||||sp||||sp||’Twas He that washed me in His blood,||br||’Twas He that made me whole:||br||’Twas He that found the lost,||br||That found the wandering sheep;||br||||sp||||sp||’Twas He that brought me to the fold:||br||’Tis He that still doth keep.

No more a wandering sheep,||br||I love to be controlled;||br||||sp||||sp||I love my tender Shepherd’s voice,||br||I love the peaceful fold:||br||No more a wayward child,||br||I seek no more to roam;||br||||sp||||sp||I love my heavenly Father’s voice:||br||I love, I love His home.

“Behold the Lamb” enthroned on high—||br||||sp||||sp||“He is our peace”;||br||||sp||||sp||In Him we are to God brought nigh—||br||||sp||||sp||“He is our peace.”||br||||sp||||sp||He who on Calvary’s cross has bled—||br||||sp||||sp||He who was numbered with the dead—||br||||sp||||sp||Exalted now o’er all as Head,||br||||sp||||sp||“He is our peace.”

“Complete in Him” at God’s right hand—||br||||sp||||sp||“He is our peace”||br||||sp||||sp||Before the throne we boldly stand—||br||||sp||||sp||“He is our peace”:||br||||sp||||sp||The blood-besprinkled mercy-seat,||br||||sp||||sp||His piercèd side, His hands and feet,||br||||sp||||sp||Proclaim redemption’s work complete—||br||||sp||||sp||“He is our peace.”

God finds eternal rest in Him—||br||||sp||||sp||“He is our peace”;||br||||sp||||sp||That rest which was disturbed by sin—||br||||sp||||sp||“He is our peace”;||br||||sp||||sp||We too by faith on Him repose,||br||||sp||||sp||Who did the Father’s heart disclose,||br||||sp||||sp||From which this full salvation flows—||br||||sp||||sp||“He is our peace.”

As one with him we rest secure—||br||||sp||||sp||“He is our peace.”||br||||sp||||sp||Unchanging doth His work endure—||br||||sp||||sp||“He is our peace”;||br||||sp||||sp||Now seated on the Father’s throne,||br||||sp||||sp||Elect and precious Cornerstone,||br||||sp||||sp||On Him we rest—on Him alone—||br||||sp||||sp||“He is our peace.”
“No separation”!—Oh, my soul,||br||’Tis God who speaks the word,||br||||sp||||sp||So close the Spirit thee unites||br||With Christ thy risen Lord.
“No separation”!—thou art His,||br||And His forevermore;||br||||sp||||sp||Upon the cross thy debt He paid,||br||And all thy judgment bore.
“No separation”!—precious word;||br||In it, my soul, be glad;||br||||sp||||sp||Loved with an everlasting love,||br||And one with Jesus made.
“No separation”!—life not death,||br||Things present nor to come,||br||||sp||||sp||Can part thee from His precious care,||br||Or rob thee of thy home.
“No separation”!—linked with Him,||br||His glory—all is thine;||br||||sp||||sp||Oh, wondrous love, that thus could plan||br||A union so divine!
Thine, Jesus, Thine,||br||No more this heart of mine||br||||sp||||sp||Shall seek its joy apart from Thee||br||||sp||||sp||The world is crucified to me,||br||||sp||||sp||And I am Thine.
Thine—Thine alone,||br||My joy, my hope, my crown:||br||||sp||||sp||Now earthly things may fade and die,||br||||sp||||sp||They charm my soul no more, for I||br||||sp||||sp||Am Thine alone.
Thine—ever Thine,||br||Forever to recline||br||||sp||||sp||On love eternal, fixed and sure—||br||||sp||||sp||Yes, I am Thine forevermore—||br||||sp||||sp||Lord Jesus, Thine.
Then let me live||br||Continual praise to give||br||||sp||||sp||To Thy dear name, my precious Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||Henceforth alone beloved, adored;||br||||sp||||sp||So let me live—
Till Thou shalt come||br||And bear me to Thy home,||br||||sp||||sp||Forever freed from earthly care,||br||||sp||||sp||Eternally Thy love to share—||br||||sp||||sp||Lord Jesus, come!

The sands of time are sinking,||br||The dawn of heaven breaks,||br||||sp||||sp||The summer morn I’ve sighed for,||br||The fair sweet morn awakes.||br||||sp||||sp||Dark, dark hath been the midnight,||br||But dayspring is at hand,||br||||sp||||sp||And glory, glory dwelleth||br||In Immanuel’s land.

Oh, Christ! He is the fountain,||br||The deep sweet well of love!||br||||sp||||sp||The streams on earth I’ve tasted,||br||More deep I’ll drink above!||br||||sp||||sp||There, to an ocean fullness,||br||His mercy doth expand,||br||||sp||||sp||And glory, glory dwelleth||br||In Immanuel’s land.

With mercy and with judgment||br||My web of time He wove,||br||||sp||||sp||And aye the dews of sorrow||br||Were lustered with His love.||br||||sp||||sp||I’ll bless the hand that guided,||br||I’ll bless the heart that planned,||br||||sp||||sp||When throned where glory dwelleth||br||In Immanuel’s land.

Oh! I am my Belovèd’s,||br||And my Belovèd’s mine!||br||||sp||||sp||He brings a poor vile sinner||br||Into His “house of wine”!||br||||sp||||sp||I stand upon His merit,||br||I know no safer stand,||br||||sp||||sp||Not e’en where glory dwelleth,||br||In Immanuel’s land.

The bride eyes not her garment,||br||But her dear bridegroom’s face;||br||||sp||||sp||I will not gaze on glory,||br||But on my King of Grace—||br||||sp||||sp||Not at the crown He giveth,||br||But on His piercèd hand:||br||||sp||||sp||The Lamb is all the glory||br||Of Immanuel’s land.

I’m waiting for Thee, Lord,||br||Thy beauty to see, Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||I’m waiting for Thee, for Thy coming again.||br||Thou’rt gone over there, Lord,||br||A place to prepare, Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||Thy home I shall share at Thy coming again.

’Mid danger and fear, Lord,||br||I’m oft weary here, Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||The day must be near of Thy coming again.||br||’Tis all sunshine there, Lord,||br||No sighing nor care, Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||But glory so fair at Thy coming again.

Whilst Thou art away, Lord,||br||I stumble and stray, Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||Oh! hasten the day of Thy coming again.||br||This is not my rest, Lord,||br||A pilgrim confessed, Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||I wait to be blest at Thy coming again.

E’en now let my ways, Lord,||br||Be bright with Thy praise, Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||For brief are the days ere Thy coming again.||br||I’m waiting for Thee, Lord,||br||Thy beauty to see, Lord,||br||||sp||||sp||No triumph for me like Thy coming again.

Our great High Priest is sitting||br||At God’s right hand above,||br||||sp||||sp||For us His hands uplifting,||br||In sympathy and love:||br||||sp||||sp||Whilst here below, in weakness,||br||We onward speed our way;||br||||sp||||sp||In sorrow oft and sickness,||br||We sigh and groan and pray.

Through manifold temptation,||br||My soul holds on her course,||br||||sp||||sp||Christ’s mighty intercession||br||Alone is her resource;||br||||sp||||sp||My gracious High Priest’s pleadings,||br||Who on the cross did bleed,||br||||sp||||sp||Bring down God’s grace and blessings,||br||Help in each hour of need.

Oh, Jesus, blessed Saviour,||br||We hope to see Thee soon,||br||||sp||||sp||Who once on earth didst suffer,||br||Who soon for us wilt come;||br||||sp||||sp||’Twas God’s most gracious favor,||br||That gave His Son to die—||br||||sp||||sp||To live our Intercessor,||br||To plead for us on high.
Trembling soul, behold thy Saviour||br||Seated on the Father’s throne;||br||||sp||||sp||Object of God’s highest favor,||br||See Him, God’s belovèd Son!
Once on earth in Bethlehem’s manger,||br||As a newborn babe He lay,||br||||sp||||sp||God come down a heavenly stranger,||br||Love to sinners to display.
Sinner, see thy God beside thee,||br||In a servant’s form come near,||br||||sp||||sp||Sitting, walking, talking with thee!||br||Sinai’s mount no longer fear.
See Him weary, yet that sought thee,||br||Sitting on Samaria’s well,||br||||sp||||sp||Or in Simon’s house that found thee,||br||Snatched thee from the jaws of hell.
See the lonely Man now bending,||br||In the lone Gethsemane,||br||||sp||||sp||Drops of blood His conflict marking||br||Whilst He prays in agony!
Onward still to Calvary marching,||br||Onward still He speeds His way||br||||sp||||sp||(His own Father’s will fulfilling),||br||Love to sinners to display.
Sinner, see the bleeding Saviour,||br||Pierced and nailed to Calvary’s tree;||br||||sp||||sp||Sacrifice of sweetest savor,||br||Object of man’s enmity!
See the sun at noonday hidden,||br||See the rocks and mountains shake,||br||||sp||||sp||See the Man ’midst darkness smitten!||br||Why did God His Son forsake?
Sinner, hear the wondrous story,||br||Jesus died and rose for thee,||br||||sp||||sp||God in heaven now waits to save thee,||br||Now, believing, thou art free.

Let all who know the joyful sound,||br||||sp||||sp||With gladness send the tidings round,||br||And tell that God is love:||br||||sp||||sp||That God so loved the world He gave||br||||sp||||sp||His own dear Son the world to save;||br||God’s message from above.

That all who in the Son believe,||br||||sp||||sp||Shall never perish, but receive||br||Life endless and divine;||br||||sp||||sp||No condemnation e’er shall know,||br||||sp||||sp||From death to life they pass below,||br||And then in glory shine.

’Tis not of works: let no man boast,||br||||sp||||sp||Save in His name who saves the lost—||br||The Lord our righteousness!||br||||sp||||sp||Poor sinner, now from working cease,||br||||sp||||sp||And claim from God a blood-bought peace,||br||And Jesus, Lord confess.

Let all who know our God rejoice,||br||||sp||||sp||Praise Him in songs with cheerful voice,||br||And live to Him alone:||br||||sp||||sp||Let sinners too take up the strain,||br||||sp||||sp||Exalt the Lamb for sinners slain,||br||The coming Saviour own.

The Spirit and the bride say, Come!||br||||sp||||sp||Let him that heareth too say, Come!||br||Whoever thirsts may come:||br||||sp||||sp||Water of life is freely given||br||||sp||||sp||Till Christ the Lord descends from heaven;||br||Lord Jesus, quickly come!

Come to the blood-stained tree;||br||The Victim bleeding lies;||br||||sp||||sp||God sets the sinner free,||br||Since Christ a ransom dies:||br||||sp||||sp||The Spirit will apply||br||His blood to cleanse the soul,||br||||sp||||sp||O burdened soul, draw nigh,||br||For none can come in vain—||br||||sp||||sp||Come, come, come.

Dark though thy guilt appear,||br||And deep its crimson dye,||br||||sp||||sp||There’s boundless mercy here—||br||Do not from mercy fly:||br||||sp||||sp||Oh, do not doubt His word,||br||There’s pardon full and free,||br||||sp||||sp||For Justice smote the Lord,||br||And sheaths her sword for thee—||br||||sp||||sp||Come, come, come.

Look not within for peace,||br||Within there’s naught to cheer;||br||||sp||||sp||Look up, and find release||br||From sin and self and fear;||br||||sp||||sp||If gloom thy soul enshroud,||br||If tears faith’s eye bedim,||br||||sp||||sp||If doubts around thee crowd,||br||Come, tell them all to Him.||br||||sp||||sp||Come, come, come.
Behold the Lamb! ’tis He who bore||br||My sins upon the tree;||br||||sp||||sp||And paid in death the dreadful score—||br||The guilt that lay on me.
I’d look to Him till sight endear||br||The Saviour to my heart;||br||||sp||||sp||To Him I look who calms my fear,||br||Nor from Himself would part.
I’d look until His precious love||br||My every thought control,||br||||sp||||sp||Its vast constraining influence prove||br||O’er body, spirit, soul.
To Him I look, while still I run—||br||My never-failing Friend!||br||||sp||||sp||Finish, He will, the work begun,||br||And grace in glory end.

One there is above all others—||br||||sp||||sp||O how He loves!||br||||sp||||sp||His is love beyond a brother’s—||br||||sp||||sp||O how He loves!||br||||sp||||sp||Earthly friends may fail or leave us,||br||||sp||||sp||One day soothe, the next day grieve us,||br||||sp||||sp||But this Friend will ne’er deceive us—||br||||sp||||sp||O how He loves!

Joy and peace it is to know Him—||br||||sp||||sp||O how He loves!||br||||sp||||sp||Think, O think how much we owe Him—||br||||sp||||sp||O how He loves!||br||||sp||||sp||With His precious blood He bought us,||br||||sp||||sp||In the wilderness He sought us,||br||||sp||||sp||To His loved ones safely brought us—||br||||sp||||sp||O how He loves!

We have found a friend in Jesus—||br||||sp||||sp||O how He loves!||br||||sp||||sp||’Tis His great delight to bless us—||br||||sp||||sp||O how He loves!||br||||sp||||sp||How our hearts delight to hear Him||br||||sp||||sp||Bid us dwell in safely near Him—||br||||sp||||sp||Why should we distrust or fear Him?||br||||sp||||sp||O how He loves!

Through His name we are forgiven—||br||||sp||||sp||O how He loves!||br||||sp||||sp||Backward shall our foes be driven,||br||||sp||||sp||O how He loves!||br||||sp||||sp||Best of blessings He’ll provide us,||br||||sp||||sp||Naught but good shall e’er betide us,||br||||sp||||sp||Safe to glory He will guide us—||br||||sp||||sp||O how He loves!

The cross! the cross, oh, that’s our gain,||br||||sp||||sp||Because on that the Lamb was slain;||br||||sp||||sp||’Twas there the Lord was crucified,||br||||sp||||sp||’Twas there for us the Saviour died.
What wondrous cause could move Thy heart||br||||sp||||sp||To take on Thee our curse and smart,||br||||sp||||sp||Well knowing we should ever be||br||||sp||||sp||So cold, so negligent of Thee?
The cause was love—we sink with shame,||br||||sp||||sp||Before our blessed Jesus’ name,||br||||sp||||sp||That He should bleed and suffer thus,||br||||sp||||sp||Because He loved and pitied us.
